loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna C. is from the village of Lower Tiparak, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 46 years old, is married and has eight school-aged children. Edna owns and operates a business planting and harvesting fruit like bananas for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Edna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Edna is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her sixth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 25 years old and is married with two children aged 2 months and 4 years. His eldest child is currently attending school.

James is a farmer in Kitale town in Western Kenya where he has been farming for three years. His major products are maize, milk and beans which he sells to the local market. He is also a motorbike mechanic (he is pictured on one of the motorbikes). His biggest challenges in farming are competition and, in the future, poultry diseases.

James has requested this loan Kes 20,000 from Juhudi Kilimo to start a poultry project. He feels that the extra income from this project will enable him take care of his family. In future, he intends to take another loan that will enable him to expand and acquire other essential assets related to poultry.

loans.use: To start a poultry project

Betty L. is from the village of Taraka,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. L. She is 48 years old, is married, and has four school-aged children.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon A. is from the village of Sta.Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 51 years old. Corazon is separated from her spouse and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Corazon owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products like pants, t-shirts, candies, etc. in the local community. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Corazon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Corazon has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Corazon is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Corazon from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

In 2008, Venancia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. loans.name: Cleophas

texts.en:
Cleophas is 27 years old and single. He is a farmer from Western Kenya, in the town of Kitale, where he has been farming for 2 years. He sells his broilers (chickens kept for meat) to the local market. He also earns income from the sale of cereals.

His biggest challenge in farming is lack of capital for expansion.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.30,000 to upgrade his poultry farm. The proceeds from this project will assist him in planning for a better future. In 5 years' time, he says he will have increased the stock of poultry from the current 200 to 750, and plans to also practise dairy farming.

He says their group needs further training to enable members to repay their loans promptly.

loans.use: To upgrade his poultry farm.

loans.name: Elnora

texts.en:
Mrs. Elnora D. is from the barangay of P8 Pulot, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 66 years old. Elnora is a widow with no dependents. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating an internet café. She has been engaged in this kind business for 3 years already and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from this business activity. 

 In 2009, Elnora joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elnora is now requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP as her third loan, which will be used to purchase additional computers for her existing internet café business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, and also for savings for future use, loan repayments, and possible business expansion.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional computer units for her existing internet cafe business.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en: Chim S. N., 31 years old, lives in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia, where she owns and farms a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She plants her crops twice a year, and she was taught how to grow rice by her grandfather. She is a good mother and has four children, all of whom are going to school and live together in the family home. Her husband works with her on the farming business. To help alleviate the hard physical labor, Chim S. N. has requested a loan of $400 to be used to purchase a cow to help plow her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase cow to help plow the farmland.

loans.name: Varduhi

texts.en:
Varduhi A. lives in Ijevan city with her husband, a daughter and a son. For a long time, she worked in a consumer services agency. Since 2008, she has had her own food and household goods shop (which is only in that area), and also Varduhi's mother-in-law helps her to manage a fruits and vegetables trading in one of the Ijevan central streets. With the profit from her business, Varduhi was able to buy some necessary furniture for her house, and solve her family's needs. In future she intends to gain bigger profits and thereby to develop her business.

Now Varduhi needs a 700,000 AMD loan to extend the assortment of household goods (soaps, detergents, etc.) in her shop and to buy strawberries, cherries and apples to increase her fruits and vegetables trading.

loans.use: To buy more household goods for her shop and buy strawberries, cherries and apples for her fruits and vegetables business.

loans.name: Timothy

texts.en:
Timothy is 23 years old and married. He is a farmer from Western Kenya in Kitale town. He has been farming for 7 years and sells his maize, milk, beans and vegetables to the local market. He also operates a mini shop in the same area.

His biggest challenge in farming is marketing and poultry diseases which are common in the area.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.25,000 to expand his poultry project. He will use this loan to stock up chickens. He says that if he is able to stock enough poultry, he will take advantage of the numbers and find a better market, which will enable him to get enough profits, hence he will be able to meet the family basic needs.

In 5 years' time, he hopes to have expanded in terms of market coverage and also diversify his products and start keeping broilers as well.

He is hopeful that he will be taking more loans from Juhudi Kilimo.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en: Beatriz O. is from the village of Centro 2. She is 52 years old, is married, and has six school-aged children. Beatriz owns and operates a business providing recycling services, hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Beatriz joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase a transport vehicle to haul materials. Beatriz is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This loan will be her seventh from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has twenty-one branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell

loans.name: Davit

texts.en:
Davit M. is 30 years old and lives in Ijevan city. He is married and has two daughters. Davit is engaged in beekeeping and his father helps him in his hard work. With the profit from his business, Davit keeps his family. Part of his produced honey he keeps for his family's usage, because natural honey is very useful, especially for children. Davit said beekeeping requires systematic and attentive care, so you’ll have very strong and hard-working bee families. Davit has many regular customers, so he sells his honey very quickly.

Davit asks for a 900,000 AMD loan to buy 10 or 12 beehives, wax papers, and frames for his bee families.

loans.use: To buy 10 or 12 beehives, wax papers and frames for his bee families.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is 49 years old. He is married with 7 children aged between 5-22 years old. All the children except one are attending school.

He is a farmer from Western Kenya, in the town of Kitale, where he has been farming for 10 years. He sells his sheep and poultry to the local market. Fredrick is also a manson. He faces the challenge of heavy rains, which leads to low production.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.31,200 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to acquire a dairy cow that will produce enough milk for consumption and sale. In future he would like to acquire a posho mill (used for grinding maize into flour) that will increase his income.

He says that if he gets a cow which produces 5 litres daily, he will be able to sell and get income, and his family will also get milk for consumption.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lambert

texts.en:
Lambert is 32 years old and he is still single. He is well known in the business of selling a variety of domestic items including dishes, glasses, etc. He has been in this business for about eight years and the hours of his business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Lambert is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing some attractive dishes. With these additional dishes, he will hopefully earn more profits, which in turn will allow him to keep reinvesting in his business for better financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a variety of domestic items including dishes

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alvard Z. was born in 1966 in Ijevan; she is married and has two children. For about 6 years she lived in Russia, but she returned to her native land and organized a food trading business. In the spring and summer months, she manages a food kiosk where she also sells fruit and vegetables. With the profit from her business, she takes care of her family, and also bought land, where she plans to construct a new shop for her business. For her new shop construction, she needs to increase her shop’s turnover and her profits.

Alvard seeks for a 250.000 AMD loan to buy household goods and fruits to resell.

loans.use: To buy household goods and fruits to resell.

loans.name: Pon

texts.en: Mrs. Pon T., 50, is a local rice farmer in the village. In addition, she has connected to the watering system, which she pumps to sell by retail to people who live near her home. By doing this work, she is able to generate formal proceeds. Pon T. is a widow and the mother of three children who are now married and live with her in the family home. Pon T. always needs to pay a taxi for the propose of travelling to anywhere, as she has no vehicle of her own. She now wants to cut down this fee by asking for a loan to purchase a motorcycle, which will provide transportation for her family.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Marine

texts.en: Marine G. lives in Ijevan city. She is married and has two children. Marine works at Ijevan city administration, and at the same time she runs her own bakery, which is on the ground floor of her house. With the profits from her business, Marine takes care of her family and pays for her daughters’ education. Marine delivers her production to 12 nearby food shops, and now she is asking for a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy a car, which will allow her to deliver her production to distant food shops as well. Marine has borrowed loans from Nor Horizon 3 times, and she has never been delayed with her repayments.

loans.use: To buy a car to deliver her production to distant food shops.

loans.name: Nemwel

texts.en:
Nemwel is 54 years old. He is a married father of 6 children aged between 13-28. Three of the children are currently attending school.

He is a farmer from Western Kenya, in Kisii town. He has been farming for 28 years and has 2 employees. His main products are tea, which he sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority, and chicken layers, which he sells to the local market and institutions. Nemwel also operates a photo studio and is employed by the government as an assistant chief in his location. He also owns a fish pond and earns income from the sale of fish when they are ready.

His main challenge in farming is the lack of market for his products, natural disasters like hailstones which affect the production of tea, and poultry disease outbreaks which at times kills all the poultry.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.45,000 to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him acquire a quality dairy cow that will produce enough milk for sale and domestic consumption.

He would like to be financed further to uplift his business and farming activities.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ludivina

texts.en:
Ludivina G. is from the village of Taguilon. She is 61 years old. Ludivina is widowed and has 3 adult-aged children. To make a living, Ludivina owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Ludivina has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Ludivina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ludivina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Ludivina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Ludivina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Melita

texts.en:
Melita O. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 50 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Melita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. Melita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 40,000 PHP when she sells her raised pig every four months.
In 2006, Melita joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Melita is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her ninth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria P. is from the barangay of P2 San Antonio, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 61 years old. Gloria is a widow and has one dependent who is an adult. To make a living, she is presently engaged in operating both a "sari-sari" (general store) store and raising hogs. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 5 years already and earns approximately 8,000 PHP gross a month from these business activities. 

In 2008, Gloria joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gloria is now requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP as her 6th loan, which will be used to add capital to her existing sari-sari store, and to purchase feed for her hogs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayments and possible business expansion.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her sari-sari store and to purchase feed for her hogs.

location.town: P2 San Antonio, Ozamiz City, Mindanao

loans.name: Lezel

texts.en:
Lezel D. is from the village of Tubod. She is 35 years old. Lezel is married. To make a living, Lezel owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general store). While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lezel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for this activity.

In 2008, Lezel joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lezel has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Lezel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Lezel from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her house.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: 
To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 37 years old. She is married and has 3 children aged between 10 weeks and 14 years old. Two of the children are attendng school.

She is a farmer from Central Kenya in Murang'a town. She has been farming for 13 years and employs 1 permanent employee and 3 casual labourers. Her products are coffee, maize, and beans which she sells to the local market. She solely depends on the income from farming to meet the family's expenses. Her major challenge is the lack of sustainable water supply to the farm and for domestic use.

She has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes.60,000 to purchase a water tank. This water tank will reduce the cost of water for domestic use and also provide enough water for the animals. In future, she would like to be able to store enough water for irrigation and domestic use.

She says, "With Juhudi Kilimo loans she will be able to own a good dairy cow".

loans.use: To purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta P. is from the village of Bitag Pequeño, Baggao, Cagayan. She is 49 years old, married, and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Violeta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for fattening and sale. Violeta has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP when she sells her raised animals.
In 2009, Violeta joined Kiva partner, ASKI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Violeta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her second from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees.

About ASKI
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda B. is from the village of Bi-toon Catadman, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 53 years old. Erlinda is married and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, Erlinda owns and operates a video games and videoke business. She has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Erlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erlinda is now requesting a loan of 50,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her existing business (video games and videoke). She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To provide additional capital for her existing business.

loans.name: Sakk

texts.en:
Mrs. Sakk R. is 28 years old and lives in Traok village in Prey Veng province. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory while the others study at the local public school.
Mrs. Sakk R. is a pig breeder who works from her home. Her husband, Mr. Chrea Soeurn (pictured with her), is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support his family. They have a problem in that their field has infertile soil so, to improve production, Mrs. Sakk R. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Marie Chantal

texts.en:
Marie Chantal is 42 years old and is married with two children who are 13 and 17 years old. She makes a living by selling a large quantity of bananas and she has been in this business for about twenty years. The hours of her business are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Marie Chantal, after realizing that the demand of her customers is greater than her selling capacity, is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business. She will purchase a large quantity of bananas so that she can satisfy the demand of her customers.

With the demand satisfied, Marie Chantal hopes that she will earn more profits than previously and these profits will be used for a further reinvestment in her business and for building a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of bananas to sell

loans.name: Samon

texts.en:
Mrs. Samon C. is married with three children. Two are enrolled in local public school, and the youngest is eleven months old. Her husband, Mr. Phean Ghoem (who appears in the photo with her), is a rickshaw driver who earns some money to support his family. This family lives in Traok village in Prey Veng province.
Mrs. Samon C. is a farmer who owns one point three hectare plot of land On this land, she cultivates rice to sell to support her family. But now she has a problem because her soil is infertile. So to improve production, Mrs. Samon C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she will buy some piglets for breeding in order to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mr. Yun Y. is a villager in Trapeang Chak village in Prey Veng province. He is 44 years old. He and his wife, Mrs. Pao Phun (who appears in the photo with him), are farmers who own a three-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to support their family. His child helps him on the farm. On the side, Mr. Yun Y. also works as a construction worker.
The problem with his land is that the soil is infertile. So to improve production, Mr. Yun Y. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely M. is from the town of Villa Marzo Cordon. She is 42 years old. Fely is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Fely owns and operates a transportation business. The main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle transport. Fely has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Fely joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fely has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Fely is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Fely from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Adeline Dorothee

texts.fr: Commercante agee de 44 ans,celibataire et mere de 3 ans dont l'age varie entre 14 et 3 ans.Elle s'est lancee dans cette activite depuis 1992,elle gere une chambre froide ou l'on trouve les differents produits dont ses clients ont besoin,ce commerce lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille et toute la scolarite des ses enfants.Avec le financement qu'elle va recevoir elle compte satisfaire les besoins de ses potentiels clients, s'approvisionner en produits  de  qualite comme la viande fraiche, les differentes varietes de poulets frais et fumes, saucissons et poissons qui sont tres demandes par ceux ci.Pour elargissement de son activite, elle fait preuve d'une bonne gestion et tres rigoureuse dans ses choix ,pour ses perspectives d'avenir , elle pense etre grossiste un jour, importer plus pour faire des grandes benefices .Tres entreprenante, avec un fort esprit d'initiative elle pense aller loin tout en ameliorant les conditions de vie de sa famille .
texts.en:
This lady, 44, is a businesswoman, single and the mother of three children whose ages vary from 14 to 3 years old. She got into this business in 1992 and runs a "cold store" where her customers find various products they need. This business allows her to support her family and pay school fees for her children. With the loan she expects to receive, she hopes to satisfy the needs of her clientele by stocking up on quality products such as fresh meat, various sorts of smoked and fresh chickens, sausages and fish which are much sought after by her customers. To expand her business, she demonstrates good management principles and is rigorous in her choices. As for her future, she intends to be a wholesaler and import more to make more profit. Very enterprising and with a strong spirit of initiative, she expects to go far while at the same time improving living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cartons of fresh meat, chicken, and fish

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: Rosemarie B. is from the town of Villa Marzo Cordon. She is 53 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a business raising pigs for fattening and sale. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP when she sells her raised pigs. In 2006, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosemarie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Rosemarie is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Rosemarie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Non

texts.en:
Mrs. Non C. lives in Trapeang Chak village in Prey Veng province. She is married with five children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory, while another one is a construction worker, and the others are attending the local public school.

She and her husband, Mr. Heab Chea, are farmers who own a three-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Although they tried to work hard, they earn little income. So, to improve the living conditions of her family, she wants to start a new business, but she did not have enough money. Thus, Mrs. Non C. is seeking a loan to buy a plowing machine to make more money. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy a plowing machine to make more money

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda A. is from the village of San Rafael. She is 48 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalinda owns and operates a business providing recycling services, hauling cans and other recyclables for local businesses and community members. Rosalinda has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities. In 2007, Rosalinda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. Rosalinda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional waste and junk materials to sell. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Rosalinda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell

loans.name: Mr. Kea Prak Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is for ten people who live in Ka Kou village in Prey Veng province. They will each use a portion of the loan for different purposes. Mr. Kea P. has been selected as the group leader for this loan. He is 53 years old. He is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell in order to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Thet But, is a duck breeder who can earn some money from selling duck eggs. Now he has a problem because his wife’s ducks are too small to sell. To improve this, Mr. Kea P. is applying for a loan to buy duck food. He will also use the loan to buy gasoline. He is the father of two children, one of whom is helping him with the farming. The other is a duck breeder.

loans.use: To buy duck food

loans.name: Mr. Chea Chheang Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is for eleven people located in Chres village in Prey Veng province. Mr. Chea C. is the group leader, selected by the other members. Each group member will use a portion of the loan for different purposes. Mr. Chea C. is 45 years old. He is a farmer who owns a one-hectare plot of land to grow crops to sell in order to support his family. Now he has some problems because the soil in his field is infertile, and it is far away from an irrigation system. To improve production, Mr. Chea C. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. His wife, Mrs. Houn Mey, owns a general store at her home where she can earn some money from selling groceries. He is the father of two children, all of whom are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Mrs. Ly Pa Village Bank Group

texts.en: Mrs. Ly P. has been selected by eight people as a group leader. The group is located in Chres village in Prey Veng province. All the members in this group will use a portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their businesses in the future. Mrs. Ly P. is 54 years old. She and her husband, Mr. S. Leang, are farmers who own a plot of land to grow crops to sell in order to support their family. Now they have some problems because the soil in their field is infertile, and it is far away from an irrigation system. To improve production, Mrs. Ly P. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. She is the mother of one child who is helping her with the farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is 39 years old, married and has six children who range in age from 5 to 15.  All are currently attending school. He lives in the western Kenyan town of Kitale town, where he has been a farmer for 14 years and now has two employees. His most important products are milk, maize and beans, all of which he sells in the local market. His biggest challenges are diseases that affect his crops and changes in the price of milk.

Philip has applied for a loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes 62,400 to buy and insure a cow that will increase the amount of milk he can sell to his customers.  He will use the extra income to meet his family's basic needs. He is a strong supporter of Juhudi Kilimo and hopes it will continue to reach out to small scale farmers so that they can expand economically.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is 50 years old, married and the father of 11 children who range in age from 6 months to 20 years old. Nine of his children are currently in school.

He lives in Kitale town in Western Kenya, where he has practiced farming for 25 years and now has one employee. He also owns a mill and mini shop near his home, and sells maize, beans and milk to people who live nearby. His biggest challenges are marketing and fighting crop diseases. 

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for Kes. 62,400 to buy and insure a dairy cow. He will use this cow to increase his milk production and, with it, his income so that he can better meet his family needs.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mrs. Chaem Pov Village Bank Group

texts.en: In Manong Leu village in Prey Veng province, ten people are seeking a village bank loan. Mrs. Chaem P. is the group leader, selected by the other members. Each member will use a portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Chaem P. breeds pigs to earn money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Ken Some, is a farmer who owns a two-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell in order to support his family. Now she has some problems because the soil in her husband’s field is infertile, and it is far away from an irrigation system. To improve production, Mrs. Chaem P. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline. She is the mother of two children, one of whom is a waiter. The other is attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and gasoline

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
Borrower information removed at borrower's request.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of cloth for resale

loans.name: Mrs. Orn Ung Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nine people in Manong Leu village in Prey Veng province are seeking a village bank loan. Mrs. Orn U. is the group leader, selected by the other members. Each member will use a portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Orn U. is a pig breeder at her home. Her husband, Mr. Rey Chei, is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice in order to support his family. Now she has a problem because the soil in her husband’s field is infertile. To improve production, Mrs. Orn U. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. She is the mother of three children, one of whom is a seamstress in a garment factory. The others are attending a local public school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Mrs. Ny Chab Village Bank Group

texts.en: This village bank loan is for eleven people who are villagers in Manong Leu village in Prey Veng province. Mrs. Ny C. is the group leader, selected by the other members. Each member will use a portion of the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Ny C. and her husband, Mr. Ngey Khat, are farmers who own two hectares of land to cultivate rice to sell in order to support their family. Their problem is that the soil in their field is infertile. To improve production, Mrs. Ny C. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. She also intends to use part of the loan to buy some piglets to start a new business. The piglets will be used for breeding. She is the mother of three children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory. The other is attending a local public school. All the members are included in this photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Lkham

texts.en: Lkham is a 58-year-old widow who lives with one of her three children in a ger or Mongolian nomatic tent in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She makes a living running a carpentry business with her two sons, making furniture such as chairs and tables and selling their output at a local market called Narantuul. She opened her business in 1998 and, after several years of hard work and saving, managed to buy her own land and build a small house. Today she is planning on expanding their output and increase their sales. She likes to say “nothing is impossible" and has applied for a loan to expand her shop.

loans.use: to expand her business

loans.name: Paulin

texts.fr:
Cet homme de 40 ans est célibataire. Il est propriétaire d’un bar renommé appelé « LA COUR DES GRANDS ». Il y vend des bières et boissons produites par la Brasserie de Lomé. Ces boissons sont vendues par la Brasserie aux différents tenanciers de bar  dont « LA COUR DES GRANDS » qui à leur tour les servent en détail aux clients.
L’objet du crédit est l’achat de casiers de boissons pour répondre avec satisfaction à la demande des clients en forte augmentation.
Il espère avec l’évolution probable de son activité due à ce crédit, augmenter et conforter son autonomie financière.
texts.en:
Paulin G. is a 40-year old single man who owns a well-known bar called « La Cour des Grands. » He sells beer and other beverages produced by the Brasserie de Lomé, which sells wholesale to several bars, who serve them to retail clients. The purpose of this loan is to purchase cases of beverages in order to meet M. G.’s increasing demand. He hopes this will enable him to reinforce his economic independence.

Translated from French by Linda Koza, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase beverages for resale

loans.name: Hadabia Binaka

texts.fr:
Agée de 37 ans, cette femme est mariée avec 05 enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une boutique renommé appelé « SOURCE DE VIE ». Elle y vend des produits d'alimentation générale et des boissons.
L’objet du crédit est l’achat de produits d'alimentation générale et de boissons pour répondre avec satisfaction à la demande des clients en forte augmentation.
Elle espère avec l’évolution probable de son activité due à ce crédit, augmenter et conforter son autonomie financière.
texts.en:
This woman, 37, is married with five children. She owns a well-known shop called « SOURCE DE VIE » (source of life). She sells various foodstuffs and drinks. The goal of her loan is to buy more foodstuffs and drinks so as to meet the needs of her quickly growing clientele. With the expected growth of her business due to this loan, she hopes to bolster her economic autonomy.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of foodstuffs

loans.name: Coumba

texts.fr: Coumba C. est une femme de 66 ans, elle est veuve et mère de 9 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAYOUF-PALAL depuis le 23 aout 2007, elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans et a 6 fois de suite bénéficier de crédit. Elle faisait la vente de fruit de saison, mais à cause de la rareté des produit du à la période elle a changé d'activité et avec son nouveau prêt elle va commercialiser des arachides, du mil et des haricots locaux. C'est une femme très brave et dynamique, elle a pu réaliser des économies jusqu'à acheter du ciment en vue de construire une maison en dur. Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Coumba C., 66, is a widow and the mother of 9 children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of BAYOUF-PALAL since August 23, 2007, i.e., she has three years' seniority and has received six consecutive loans. She used to sell seasonal fruit but due to its scarcity at this period, she changed over and plans to use her new loan to sell peanuts, millet, and local beans. She is a respectable and hard-working woman and has managed to set aside savings so as to buy cement with which to build a durable house. Her goal is to support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing her working capital

loans.name: Thomas Amara's Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the R.C. Boys Primary School, Lunsar. These are diligent and hardworking teachers who have come to SMT/Kiva to apply for a loan of SLL 10,950,000 in order to help them pay school fees for their children, invest in their businesses, buy pieces of furniture, buy a plot of land, etc.

R.C Boys Primary school was founded in 1995 in Lunsar small-town, northern Sierra Leone by the Roman Catholics to help educate the children of Lunsar and its surrounding villages. It is a government-assisted school with 7 teachers and 297 pupils.

With the help of this loan, the leader of this group, Thomas A. K. will use his share (SLL 1,000,000) to pay school fees for his children. Born in Lunsar, Thomas is a 62-year-old man who is married to a nurse and they have six children who are attending schools. Thomas has been in the teaching profession for forty years now.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Marietou

texts.fr: Mariétou C. est une femme de 21 ans, elle est célibataire sans enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de BAYOUF-PALAL depuis le 15 septembre 2008, elle a une ancienneté de 1 an et demi dans le Banc Villageois et a 4 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit. Elle s'exerce a faire un petit commerce d'habits, de chaussures et d'écharpes. Elle est très travailleuse, en une année et demi elle a pu réaliser un bon niveau d'épargne. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité en achetant plus de marchandises et réaliser des bénéfices afin d'augmenter son épargne et de prendre en charge ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Mariétou C., 21, is single and has no children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of BAYOUF-PALAL since September 15, 2008, so she has a senority of one and a half years in the Banc Villageois and has received four consecutive loans. She has a little business selling clothing, shoes, and scarves. She works hard and in one and a half years she has been able to put aside a tidy sum in savings. Her new loan will allow her to better develop her business by buying more merchandise. She expects to make profit with which she can increase her savings and support herself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: develop and promote her income-generating business

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Awa P. est une femme de 48 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois depuis le 23 aout 2007, elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans dans le Banc Villageois et a 06 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et a toujours remboursé sans difficulté. Elle est vendeuse de poissons frais et son nouveau crédit lui permettra de renforcer son niveau d'approvisionnement. Cette activité lui rapporte des bénéfices qui lui permettent d'épargner et d'acheter des équipements, par exemple un poste téléviseur pour la famille. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari pour la prise en charge familiale.
texts.en:
48-year-old Awa P. is married and has 6 dependent children. She has been a member of Banc Villageois since August 23, 2007. During her three years with Banc Villageois, she has received and repaid 6 loans without any difficulty.
She makes a living selling fresh fish and this new loan will allow her to expand her inventory. Her business generates profits that allow her to set money aside and to buy equipment, for example a TV for her family. Her goal is to help her husband provide for their family.

Translated from French by Carolyn McCaffrey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand her inventory

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. makes a living selling green vegetables in the local market and has applied for a loan to buy fish to sell. She is 33 years old and married to a teacher. She has three children, all of whom are enrolled in school. With the extra income made possible by this loan, she hopes to expand her shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Asunta

texts.en:
Asunta C. makes a living selling earrings and necklaces at a local shop and has applied for a loan to buy more necklaces to sell to her customers.  She is 39 years old and married. Her husband is a driver and they have three children, all of whom are in school. With the extra income made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to build a small hotel.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy necklaces to sell to her customers

loans.name: Agata

texts.en: Agata O. is currently in the business of selling bread and groundnut phase (peanut paste) at the market and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and cooking oil to sell. Agata is 31 years old and is married to a businessman. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a restaurant. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Marther

texts.en: Marther A is currently in the business of selling beer and local brew and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer to sell. Marther is 27 years old and is married to a teacher. She has two children and her children do not go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a bar. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer to sell

loans.name: Rina

texts.en: Rina J. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and tomatoes at her home and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. Rina is 39 years old and is married to a soldier. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a charcoal store. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Roda

texts.en: Roda J. is currently in the business of selling bedsheets and sandals at her shop and is requesting a loan to stock dresses and pairs of trousers. Roda is 41 years old and is married to a nurse. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy two sewing machines and employ two tailors. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock dresses and pairs of trousers

loans.name: Mame Bissane

texts.fr: Mame Mbissane D. est une femme de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants en charge. elle est membre du banc Villageois de BAYOUF-PALAL depuis le 02 février 2006, elle a une ancienneté de 3 ans et demi dans le Banc Villageois et a 07 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle est vendeuse de fruits à la gare routière de sa commune et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'augmenter son approvisionnement en marchandises. Son objectif à long terme est de construire une maison pour sa famille et à court terme soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Mame Bissane D. is a 49-year old woman who is married and mother to five children, who are in her care. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in BAYOUF-PALAL since 2nd February 2006 and she has thus been with the Banc Villageois for three and a half years; she has had seven consecutive loans and has never had any problems with the repayments. She sells fruits at the bus station in her town and her new loan will allow her to increase her stock. Her long-term aim is to build a house for her family, and in the short term she wants to help her husband to take care of the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Strengthen her economic initiative

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian G. is currently in the business of selling beans and maize flour at the market and is requesting a loan to stock tomatoes and onions to sell. Lilian is 27 years old and is married to a teacher. She has two children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock tomatoes and onions to sell

loans.name: Margret

texts.en: Margret J. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, onions, cooking oil and sweet potatoes and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of onions to sell. Margret is 39 years old and is married to a clerk. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more bags of onions to sell

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une femme de 56 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 09 enfants. Elle est membre du banc villageois de BAYOUR-PALAL depuis 9 ans et a 18 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. C'est un membre assidu, et très dynamique qui cultive un esprit de de solidarité au sein du groupe. Elle est vendeuse de fruits, elle achète des mangues à bord champ et fait la cueillette des fruits au rythme de l'écoulement. Son nouveau crédit lui permettra de d'acheter toute la production d'un verger de manguier et de vendre les fruit sur une période de 5 à 6 mois. Son objectif est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de la famille.
texts.en:
Mariama D. is a 56-year old woman who is married and mother to nine children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois in BAYOUF-PALAL for nine years and has had 18 consecutive loans; she has never had any problems with the repayments. She is an assiduous member and very dynamic, creating a spirit of solidarity within the group. She is a vendor of fruits, buying mangos on the edges of the field and picking fruit at the rhythm at which she sells them. Her new loan will allow her to purchase the entire production of a mango orchard and sell the fruit over a period of five to six months. Her aim is to support her husband in taking care of the family.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her level of investment

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is 38 years old, married, with one 6-year-old who goes to school. She also takes care of 3 other children, who help her with her business. In 2003, Beatrice started with 5000 Francs, selling firewood and ice cream. Since then, she began to make cakes for sale and increased her sales by allowing customers to try her cake; she gained much more business in that way. Now, she would like to have some capital to increase the variety of foods she sells from her stall. In addition, she has the dream to use her increased profits to hire more young people to help with her activities because she wants to help reduce poverty and hunger in Brazzaville.

loans.use: Diversify food products sold at her stall

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Last summer, Elizabeth came to ACCION USA for her second loan, which provided her with $6,000 to refurbish part of her beauty salon in Long Island City. She used the money to install a new beauty station and buy another hairdryer chair.

When borrowers pay down 40% of their loans with ACCION USA, they are eligible to refinance for more funds. In April, when Elizabeth had paid down about 60% of her loan, she came to us to refinance in order to make further improvements to her salon. 

With her loan, Elizabeth will refurbish the tile flooring in her salon and to buy additional dryers. Elizabeth will be able to continue strengthening her credit and making her salon more welcoming and professional-looking to customers. Ultimately, she hopes this renovation of her business space leads to a more profitable business to support her and her husband and children.


 About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA:
Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education.

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To install a new tile flooring and additional hairdryers

loans.name: Denison

texts.en:
In the past, Denison worked for a commercial cleaning company. He was unsatisfied being unable to take charge of his own work while not being compensated for his value. This inspired him to take charge and start his own commercial cleaning business.  

Due to the tough economic environment, it was difficult finding the capital needed to purchase the equipment necessary to run his small business.  Luckily, the little help he has received from his family was enough to jump start his business.  Proof that he is business savvy, he has been able to find work during the economic recession and has been able to keep his clients very satisfied.  

Being approved for the ACCION USA loan will facilitate his business growth by purchasing more equipment and cleaners, allowing him to expand services to his current and future clients.

About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA

Have you ever thought about how the new café on your corner and the delivery service that brings the fresh baked goods acquired the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated 10 million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis.” Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. 

Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and cleaning supplies

loans.name: Sylvain

texts.fr: Jeune commercant et celibataire de 41 ans,economiste de formation, a la fin de ses Etudes se lance dans les activites commerciales; il ouvre une boucherie en 2001 pour la vente des vivres frais comme la viande ,les cuisses de poulets, les cartons de poulets, poissons et saucissesAvec le pret qu'il compte recevoir , il veut rehausser le niveau de son commerce, rechercher les produits de bonne qualite et de premiere necessite pour satisfaire la demande des ses clients.Etant bon gestionnaire il fait preuve de beaucoup de rigueur et va toujours vers l'avant malgres les difficultes qu'il rencontre pendant les coupures de courant et delestage qui sont tres frequente dans la ville.Dans l'avenir il a l'intention d'importer a Kinshasa et dans d'autres pays et etre un grand grosssiste dont les benefices de sa vente lui permettra de fonder une famille et construire un grande maison; de sa rigueur il fait preuve d'une bonne volonte,tres solidaire et souvent assiste les autres dans l'exercice de leur activite.
texts.en:
This young businessman, 41 and single, who studied to be an economist, went into business at the end of his studies. He opened a butcher shop in 2001 selling fresh food such as meat, chicken thighs, and cartons of chicken, fish, and sausages. With the loan he expects to receive, he wants to expand his business and choose good quality products and staples to satisfy the demand of his customers. Being a good manager, he has demonstrated exactness and continues to progress despite the difficulties he encounters when the electricity is cut, either suddenly or on a rotating basis, which happens often in the town. In the future, he hopes to import goods from Kinshasa and from other countries and become a big wholesaler whose profits will allow him to found a family and build a big house. With his exactness, he demonstrates good intentions, solidarity, and often helps others in their work.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fresh foods for resale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother with two children, both of whom are in school. She rents a house with electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

Mary worked as an accounts assistant before starting her own business. She has a beauty shop where she has been selling her products to her neighbors for four years; she has no other sources of income. She would like to buy hair care products and additional cosmetics with the KES 20,000 loan.

Mary faces the challenge of stiff competition from other beauty shops selling the same products. She hopes to open more beauty shops in different areas to diversify the market.

Mary joined Yehu because of the organization's good reputation in the community.

loans.use: to buy more hair products and cosmetics

loans.name: Ange

texts.fr:
Jeune homme couturier   de 46 ans , célibataire avec 3 enfants a sa charge dont l’age varie entre 8 et 5 ans, il est  dans la couture il y a plus de 15 ans , il excelle dans la couture dame et la broderie pour lui c’est très rentable parce que les dames sont les meilleures de ses clients.

Des que le prêt lui sera octroyé , il va acheter des pagnes en gros , des métrages et fourniture de couture comme des rouleaux de doublures , lots de fermetures, dentelles… pour coudre  des robes et chemises  prêt a porter a vendre au lieu d’attendre les commandes des clients. 
 
Dans ses projets d’avenir il a l’intention d’ouvrir un grand atelier de Coupe Couture et Formation  déjà qu’a l’heure actuelle il a  trois (3) couturières  qui sont en formation chez lui.
Faire beaucoup plus d’épargne selon lui ; est l’une des stratégies pour qu’il puisse accroître son activité, certes les commandes sont multiples mais il s’efforce toujours de respecter  les délais  avec ses clients pour ne pas les décourager
texts.en:
This young man, 46, is a tailor and single but raising three children whose age varies from 8 to 5 years. He has been a tailor for 15 years and excels in sewing women's clothing and doing embroidery, which brings in a good deal of income since women are among his best customers. As soon as he receives his loan, he intends to buy lengths of African print cloth wholesale, other cloth by the meter, and sewing notions such as bolts of lining material, packs of zippers, lace, etc., to use to make dresses and shirts ready-to-wear, to display for sale instead of waiting for orders from customers. Among his plans for the future, he intends to open a big workshop of cutting, sewing, and training and right now he already has three seamstresses who are in training with him. He says that being able to put aside more in savings will allow him to grow his business. He does get a lot of orders but he works hard at getting them ready on time so as not to discourage the customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sewing supplies, African print cloth and other fabrics, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Higinio

texts.es: Higinio C. C., tiene la edad de 46 años, está en unión libre, y  tiene 2  hijos, uno de 28 y otro de 9 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Higinio tiene algunos años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Higinio C. C. is 46 years old and has a live-in partner and 2 children, aged 28 and 9. He is requesting a loan to buy some calves and their feed. He wants to take good care of his livestock to obtain the highest return possible when he sells them. He also wants to increase the number of animals he keeps and improve the conditions under which he raises them. He has a well-suited area set aside for raising livestock. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR, and he is very happy with the conditions offered to him. Higinio has raised livestock for some years now. In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and he would also like to continue growing as an individual and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cattle

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with one son who is working. Her husband works as a land officer. Mwanasiti owns a home with electricity and piped water. Her greatest expenses are electricity and water bills.

For the past thirteen years, Mwanasiti has been selling fruit juice as well as firewood to her neighbors. Her other sources of income are her husband's salary, house rent and selling milk from her cows. With this KES 40,000 loan, she hopes to buy more passion fruits and also a lorry of firewood. 

Mwanasiti faces the challenge of seasonality as the demand for her products is lower during the rainy season than hot weather. She decided to join Yehu because of the support it offers to women and the issuing of small loans without strong collateral.

loans.use: to buy passion fruits and one full lorry of firewood

loans.name: Benijean

texts.fr:
Jeune homme âgé de 27ans, marié et père de 2 ennfants.Il est dans ce commerce depuis 2008 et veux devenir grossiste.son esprit d'ouverture lui permet d'avoir autres visions que ce qu'il fait maintenant, pour cela, il pense maîtriser les prix d'achats afin de revendre avec des prix concurrentiels pour attirer plus de la clientèles et gagner plus de bénéfice.
son épouse est couturière, pour l'éducation de leurs 2enfants, il voudrai la soutenir en lui ouvrant un atelier de couture et faire de sa boutique une boucherie avec des produits plus variés, il a aussi entre autre une cabine téléphonique qui fonctionne avec un générateur et de plus en plus les besoins en électricité est Pressant, il aspire a d'autres opportunités pour atteindre son but.
l'actuel prêt lui permettra de se stabilisé dans son activité et soutenir son épouse dans sa couture afin de permettre a leurs enfants de faire des bonnes études.
Dans son quartier, il est considéré comme débrouillard et les gens le félicite beaucoup.
texts.en:
This young man, age 27, is married and the father of two children. He has been in this business since 2008 and would like to become a wholesaler. His open attitude allows him to imagine other possibilities than what he is presently doing, so he would like to get his purchasing prices straightened out and his prices competitive. Then he can attract more customers and make more profit. His wife is a seamstress and so that they can educate their children, he intends to support her work by opening up a sewing workshop for her. He plans to turn her old place of business into a butcher shop with a varied inventory. Among other things, he also has a phone booth which runs on a generator, and as the need for electricity becomes more and more of a problem, he is looking toward other opportunities to reach his goal. This loan will allow him to stabilize his business and help his wife out with her sewing activities, so that their children will be able to do well in school. In his neighborhood he is considered a "can-do" kind of person and people praise him a lot.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expand his business and his shop

loans.name: Keilyn

texts.es: Keilyn R. M., tiene la edad de 26 años, está en unión libre, y vive con la pareja y sus 3  hijos de 1, 3 y 11 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de inventario para su salón de belleza. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de productos para ofrecer en su sala de belleza. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio y de contar con las herramientas necesarias para desempeñarse de la mejor manera con su trabajo, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecida con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
texts.en:
Keilyn R. M. is 26, in a common-law marriage, and lives with her partner and three children, who are 1, 3 and 11 years old. She wants the loan in order to buy inventory for her beauty salon. She wishes to have a broader and more varied inventory for sale in her beauty salon. She has been working in this business for a few years and has good customers. Because of this, she sees the need to offer a greater variety of products and to have the necessary tools to do her job well and to contribute more income to her household’s finances. This is the first time that she is taking a loan from FUDECOSUR and she is very grateful to them for the services they have provided. She hopes in the future to provide her family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability and to continue growing as a person and as a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Jacqueline Demeranville, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her beauty salon

loans.name: Salama

texts.en:
H. is a happily married woman with six children who all attend school. She owns a house with no electricity but with piped water. She notes that her greatest monthly expenses are school fees.

With this KES 40,000 loan, H. hopes to purchase wheat flour, cowpeas and sugar for her business which she has been operating for the past 24 years. Before that, she was employed as a secretary. She gets assistance for the business from her husband, who works as a driver.
