Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de SAMBA 15 ANS1, dont elle occupe le poste d'assistante dans le comité de gestion, depuis le 19 octobre 2002. Elle est couturière de profession, elle a ouvert un atelier de couture où elle a embauché du personnel pour la confection sur mesure des vêtements. Son nouveau prêt lui permettra de renforcer son stock de fournitures de couture afin d'augmenter sa production. Son objectif est de renforcer ses épargnes tout en participant à la prise en charge des besoin familiaux.
texts.en:
Kadiatou B. is a 45-year-old woman. She is married and a mother responsible for nine children. She is a member of the “Banc Villageois” Samba 15 ANS1. Since October 19, 2002 she holds the position of assistant in the managing committee. She is a seamstress by trade. She opened a sewing workshop where she has hired help to make custom made clothing. Her new loan will allow her to increase her sewing supplies in order to boost her production. Her goal is to consolidate her savings while participating in meeting the family’s needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her sewing activity

loans.name: Jeanne D'arc

texts.fr: Jeanne D'Arc N. est une femme de 53 ans, elle est divorcée et vit avec ses 04 enfants. Elle est membre fondateur du Banc Villageois de SINTHIANG HOULA et en est l'une des assistantes au comité de gestion. Elle a comme activité principale la vente sur table de produits divers, tel des denrées alimentaire et des légumes. Avec son nouveau prêt elle va renforcer son niveau désapprovisionnement dans le but de réaliser plus de bénéfices afin de pouvoir faire face aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir aux siens.
texts.en:
Jeanne D'Arc N. is a 53-year old woman. She is divorced and lives with her four children. She is a member of the “Banc Villageois” Sinthiang Houla and is one of the assistants to the managing committee. Her main activity is the street sale of various products such as foodstuff and vegetables. With her new loan she will strengthen her level of supplies in order to make more profit. Her goal is to meet her family’s needs and her own.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her commercial activity.

loans.name: Maria Gerardina

texts.es:
La señora María Enríquez  pertenece al banco comunal Corazón de Jesús y vive en el sector del Valle, en su mayor parte su población se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería pero los jóvenes han migrado a la ciudad en busca de mejores oportunidades de trabajo.

Nuestra socia es una mujer muy alegre y sencilla tiene 62 años de edad y es viuda desde que tenia 31 años, su esposo ha falleció por consecuencia de su trabajo ya que ha sabido realizar trabajos en paja toquilla y azufre llegando este material por absorción al corazón y matándolo de un infarto. Ha concebido 7 hijos, 6 hijos son casados excepto un hijo quien es padre soltero y le ayuda en la casa con los gastos, viven en una casa arrendada.

 Doña María se ha roto la mano por un accidente pero se encuentra recuperándose de una manera satisfactoria, se dedica a la agricultura,  también a la venta de aves y chanchos, anteriormente lavaba ropa pero ahora por su lesión no lo puede hacer, una amiga le invito a ser a parte del banco comunal hace 6 años y todo este tiempo el dinero le ha beneficiado para poder incrementar mas animales para su negocio y también para comprar los alimentos necesarios en su casa. Con el nuevo crédito que recibirá de parte de la fundación ESPOIR lo va a invertir en la compra de alimento y mas animales, su sueño es  seguir manteniendo su salud para trabajar.
texts.en:
Maria Enríquez belongs to the Corazón de Jesús [Heart of Jesus] Communal Bank and lives in the Valle area. Most people in this region work in agriculture and cattle ranching but many young people have left for the cities in search of better job opportunities. This bank member is a happy and unassuming woman. She is 62 years old and was widowed at age 31. Her husband died from work-related injuries. He worked with palm fibers and sulfur, which was absorbed through his skin and eventually caused a heart attack. Maria has 7 children, 6 of whom are married. The 7th is a single father who lives with her in a rented house and helps out with everyday expenses. Maria broke her hand in an accident but is recovering well. She works in the fields and sells birds and pigs. She used to work washing clothes but is no longer able to do so because of her injury. A friend invited her to be part of the communal bank 6 years ago and the loans she has gotten have helped her to be able to increase the number of animals she sells and also to buy food for her household. With this new loan that she will receive through ESPOIR [the Kiva field partner] she will buy more food and more animals. Her dream is to stay in good health so that she can keep working.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chickens, pigs, and food.

loans.name: Namm's Group

texts.en: Eight members make up this village bank loA., located in Prek They village in Kandal province. Mrs. Namm S. is 53 years old and is the village bank president, selected by the members. The members of this village loA. will each use the loA. for a different purpose. Mrs. Namm S. is a grocery seller who earns a small income to support her family. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. So she decided to ask for a loA. to buy more groceries to enlarge her business.  Mrs. Namm S. is a widow with two children. One of her children is a military officer and one is a student in the local school.

loans.use: To buy more groceries

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: La solicitante es casada, tiene 2 hijos en edad escolar. Cuenta con casa propia de material noble y posee una buena acumulacion de bienes; tiene ingresos diversificados. Posee una bodega surtida en la que venden todo tipo de productos. Alquila cuartos; posee un automovil que trabaja en la empresa de transportes Magister´s la cual es manejada por su esposo (chofer). Tiene buena experiencia crediticia con la CMAC ICA. El destino del credito es para incremento de capital.
texts.en:
The applicant is married. She has 2 children of school age. She has her own well-made house and she possesses a good accumulation of goods. She has diversified incomes. She has a well-stocked convenience store in which she sells all kinds of products. She rents rooms and possesses an automobile that she uses in the Magister´s transportation company which is driven by her husband (the chauffeur). She has a good credit history with the CMAC ICA. The loan will be used to as capital to grow her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Capital to grow her businesses (a store, a transportation and a rental business)

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna V. is a married woman who lives in Prk. 7, Linao, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  hog raising and swine raising. Her husband, Charlie V., who is 56 years old, works as a hog raiser to earn his living. They have two children who are 26 and 27 years old. 

Erna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 20 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Erna has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 14,000, raising the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 21st loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for their future and to improve their living conditions. Erna V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mr. Leng L., 34, is a villager living in a rural area of Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. His wife is a seamstress in a garment factory and takes care of three kids. Leng L. is a construction worker who builds stone and wooden house, usually making 3 dollars daily. This helps alleviate some of the financial problems of his family. However, Mr. L. constantly faces a harsh reality that his living situation is affected by the growing cracks in his house due to heavy rainfall. Leng L. will be using this loan to change the broken part of his existing house.  His wife appears in the photo.

loans.use: To fix broken house

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna T. is a 56-year-old married who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  a general store, nipa production and E-loading.   She lives in Sitio Malabong, Brgy. Andulawan, Ilog, Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store, nipa production and E-loading businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average income of P20,000. 

Lorna is now borrowing PHP 23,000 so that she can have additional capital.  This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of P20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Lorna aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: As additional working capital

loans.name: Agueda Rosa

texts.es: Solicitante con buenas referencias, se dedica al alquiler de cochera para mottotaxis, en una casa de su propiedad.Sus clientes con propietarios de motos de la zona. Ademas su conyugue se dedica a la venta e instalaciones de fluorescentes a domicilio. Cuentan con casa propia de material noble, la cual se encuentran levantando paulatinamente. No presentan endeudamiento en el sistema financiero, con buena calificacion en la SBS.Solicitan el prestamo para terminar de levantar una pared colindante medianera trasera de su casa.
texts.en:
The applicant has good references. She rents out the garage in her house for “mototaxis” (three wheeled motorized vehicles). Her customers own motorcycles in the area. Her life partner sells and installs fluorescent lights in homes. They have their own home, which is made of sturdy material. They are gradually adding on to it. They are not in debt to any financial entity. They have a good score with the SBS, the Peruvian Superintendent of Banks. They are requesting the loan to finish adding on a dividing wall adjacent to the back of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a wall in the back of their house

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia G. is a 36-year-old married woman who lives in Bagumbayan, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by producing rooster boxes and engaging in a rice retailing business.

Julia’s husband, Arnel, is a tricycle driver.  They have three children who are between 12 and 15 years old. The children are currently going to school and help their parents in the business as part of their daily chores.

Julia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by the production of their rooster boxes and engaging in a rice retailing business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000 from her business activities.

Julia is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 27,000 was used to fund operations of her rooster box making and rice retailing businesses, which had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 15th loan in the amount of PHP 29,500, which she intends to use on the production of her rooster boxes and rice retailing business. Julia is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en: Mrs. Yeng L. is 44 years old and is a villager who lives in Preaek Ta In village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Thy Oun, are fisherfolk who  earn a small income to support their family living. For supporting this business, Mrs. Yeng L. has decided to ask for a loan to buy a fishing boat to support her business. Aside from fishing, Mrs. Yeng L. is also a farmer who owns a plot of land to grow crops. This couple has four children; two are seamstresses in the garment factory, one is a student, while the youngest one is only a year old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fishing boat

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: S. has been selling different types of vegetables at the local market for years and typically generates an income of $2.8 per day. She is a determined mother of three teenage children. Two are employed at a garment factory while another is going to school every day. S. sells vegetables that she grows by herself on her own farmland as well as buys from her wholesale supplier. She and her husband also farm a rice crop for family to eat. Because it is farming season, S. is looking for assistance to purchase equipment to help her plant crops.

loans.use: To purchase equipments to plant crops

loans.name: Arcelie

texts.en:
Arcelie V. is from the village of Holy Friday. She is 49 years old. Arcelie is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Arcelie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Arcelie has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Arcelie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Arcelie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Arcelie is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the ninth loan taken out by Arcelie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Pedro Fermin

texts.es: El solicitante es soltero, vive en casa de sus padres. Cuenta con bienes de primera necesidad; es tecnico electricista. No tiene deudas en la actualidad. El destino del credito es para compra de materiales para su trabajo y de necesidad personal
texts.en:
The loan applicant is single and lives in his parents' house. He has the basic necessities; he is an electrical technician. He has no debt at this time. The loan is to purchase materials for his work and for personal necessities.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To acquire fixed assets and for personal necessities

loans.name: Leang

texts.en: S., age 33, operates her own small handicraft business. She produces traditional purses and sells them to retailers in the local market. S. is married and has three children who remain dependent on her. Her husband is a construction foreman. S. has been planning to buy a kiosk inside the market where she hopes to sell clothes and some cakes to earn additional income for family. She has not yet accomplished her mission due to the lack of funds. S. is asking for loan of $700 from Kiva’s project partner, HKL.

loans.use: To buy a kiosk inside the market

loans.name: Rona

texts.en:
Rona S. is a 33-year old married woman who lives in Bagumbayan, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by engaging in a buy and sell, ready to wear business.

Rona’s husband, Cydric, is a sugarcane labourer. They have 2 children who are between 5 and 12 years of age. Their eldest is currently going to school and also helps in the business as part of the daily chores.

Rona joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2006 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in the buy and sell ready to wear clothes business. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP4,000 from her business activities.

Rona is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP16,000 was used to fund the operations of her buy and sell ready to wear clothes business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing for her 10th cycle loan, the amount of PHP17,500, which she intends to use on her buy and sell ready to wear clothes. Rona is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Mrs. Sou Y. started her grocery business a long time ago. She is a 60 year old villager living in a rural area of Kompong Tom province. She is a widow with five children, four of whom are married and employed with different jobs while one remains a student. She currently sells cooking ingredients, sweets and other items, to villagers. Most of her clients buy on credit and return income after a few days later. This is the second cycle of the loan she has requested. Sou Y. will use this loan to purchase grocery inventory to sell.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La solicitante es viuda, cuenta con casa propia y bienes D. primera necesidad. Vive con 2 D. sus hijos y su yerna con quienes son mayores D. edad y comparten gastos D. la unidad familiar. Tiene buena experiencia crediticia con Mi Banco. Se dedica a la venta D. pisco hace 5 años; compra este producto en la bodega alvarez. El destino del credito es para gastos personales y capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
The loan applicant is a widow with her own home and the basic necessities. She lives with two of her children and her daughter in law who are adults and who share the family expenses. She has a good credit history with Mi Banco. She has been selling pisco for five years. She buys this product in the Alvarez warehouse. The loan is for personal expenses and working capital.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses and working capital

loans.name: Sor

texts.en:
Mr. Sor P., is 50 years old and his wife, Mrs. Chanthou Ung, is 46 years old. They have been married for 30 years. They have three children: one son and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, one is a garment factory worker, and another one raises cows at home. The family lives in a small village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Sor and his wife are farmers. They grow rice on their farmland in the village. The couple does not have enough capital to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain their rice farm. Sor is asking his first loan of $600 to help build his capital. 

Photo: Mr. Sor P. was at home not at the rice farm.

loans.use: To purchase farming materials

loans.name: Leanghy

texts.en: Mrs. Leanghy Phe is 45 years old and is a villager who lives in Preaek Ta In village, Kandal province. She is growing mushrooms to sell, while her husband, Mr. Try Sris, is a construction worker. With both positions they can earn a small income to support their family's costs of living. In order to support the mushroom business, Mrs. Leanghy Phe decided to ask for a loan to buy mushroom supplies to support her mushroom business. This couple has five children, all students who also help in their parent's businesses. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy mushroom supplies.

loans.name: So

texts.en: Mrs. So K. is a 46-year-old resident of Kompong Tom province. She has skills for raising pigs and growing rice, and she currently raises a few pigs for a profit. Additionally, she goes with her husband to fish around the river for extra income. In a day, this couple is able to make $4 to control the financial crisis of their family, and they have five children. K. is taking out her first loan to grow rice crops during this farming season.

loans.use: To grow rice crops during this farming season.

loans.name: Sam-Ol

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-ol T.  is 27 years old and her husband, Mr. Sam-ol Yong, is 34 years old. They have been married since 2006 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both of them still young.

Mrs. Sam-ol T. has been a scarf weaver since 2008, a skill she learned from her mother-in-law. Her husband is a barber. She is asking for her first loan of $150 to purchase cotton thread for her scarf-weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase cotton thread for her scarf-weaving business

loans.name: Ma. Amparo

texts.en:
Ma. Amparo M. is from the town of Villa Marzo Cordon. She is 39 years old. Ma. Amparo is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Amparo owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Ma. Amparo has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3500 PHP when she sells her raised animals. Aside from livestock raising Ma. Amparo also manages a vulcanizing shop as her other source of income.

In 2008, Ma. Amparo joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Amparo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. Ma. Amparo is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Ma. Amparo from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Mr. Sophy P. is 40 years old and lives in Khpob Kraom village, Kandal province. He is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land to cultivate rice Aside from being a farmer, he also breeds pigs.  With both businesses, he earns a small income, enough to support his family.  His wife, Channary Ear, is a teacher at the local school where she earns a small salary and with her husband income they are able to meet their family living expenses. This couple has three children, who all are students. The children help support their father businesses. Channary Ear is in the picture with him.

To improve his pig breeding business, Sophy P. decided to ask for a loan to buy additional supplies of pig feed.

loans.use: To buy supplies of pig feed

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.en:
Baltazar M. is a 39 year old married man who supports his family by operating a general store and fish vending business. He lives in Brgy Alijis, Valladolid, Negros Occidental with his 36 year old wife, Nerisa, who helps her husband in managing the business while their 2 children attend school.

He has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved his living conditions with the help of his loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in his general store and with his fish vending business, he is gradually making his family more economically stable. He now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,500.

Baltazar is borrowing Php 12,500 so that he could continue and improve his general store and fish vending business. This will be his 10th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. His previous loan of Php 9,500, which he paid off well within its term, was just another step in his journey towards economic freedom. Baltazar aspires to elevate his family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Francisca Sabina

texts.es: La solicitante es casada con tres hijos en edad escolar, vive en casa alquilada en Parcona cedida por un amigo del conyugue, la solicitante se dedica a la enseñanza educativa primaria teniendo 8 años como experiencia y tiene a su cargo no menos de 6 alumnos. Su conyugue es contador y presta servicios a 5 empresas ademas de otros trabajos de asesoramiento, no tien experiencia en creditos. Cuenta con buenas referencias. Solicita el credito para implementar acondicionamiento del local y materiales para enseñanza
texts.en:
The applicant is married with three children of school age. She lives in a rented home in Parcona provided by a friend of her spouse. The applicant is dedicated to teaching at the primary school level, having 8 years of experience and she has to her charge not less than 6 students. Her spouse is a bookkeeper and offers services to 5 businesses in addition to other consulting work. She does not have any prior loan experience. She has good references. She requests the loan to implement improvements in the condition of her place and for materials for teaching.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to improve the quality of her teaching

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes S. is a 59 year old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a vegetable plantation and selling  the produce.  She lives in Brgy Alijis, Valladolid, Negros Occidental with her 58 year old husband, Armando, who works as a driver and their 4 children who are between the ages of 25-34 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her vegetable plantation and selling business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000.

Lourdes is borrowing Php 17,000 so that she can continue and improve her vegetable and selling business. This will be her 16th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 17,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Lourdes aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ounn's Group

texts.en: Mr. Ounn C. is 48 years old and was selected as the leader of a group loan of four members, located in Angk Khleu village, Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purposes. Mr. Ounn C. and his wife, Mrs. Thy Noeun, are farmers who own 1.30 hectares of land to cultivate rice and water melons. For this farm, Mr. Ounn C. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a water machine to support his crops. Aside from farmers, they also own a rice mill machine. This couple has four children; one is a carpenter (table, chairs, etc.), and the other three are students and also support their parent's businesses.

loans.use: To purchase a water machine

loans.name: Sok Khy

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Khy C. is a 31-year-old married woman and a villager who lives in Chong Kaoh village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Roeun Chom, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow crops. For this farm, Mrs. Sok Khy C. decided to ask for loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline to support her crops.

Aside from farming, Mr. Roeun Chom is a fisherman who is able to earn a small income to support his family. He is shown in the photo with his wife. This couple has three children: two are attending the local school while the youngest one is four years old.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en: Rosalinda C. is a 39-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store business. She lives in Hacienda Santa Rita, La Carlota City, Negros Occidental, with her husband and their four children who are between 3 and 14 years old with three of them currently going to school. Rosalinda has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 12,000. Rosalinda is now borrowing Php 15,000 so that she can expand her general store. This will be her 7th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 12,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Rosalinda aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Ma. Regina

texts.en: Ma. Regina M. is a 33-year-old single mother who supports her children by engaging in a general store. She lives in Barangay Robles, La Castellana, Negros Occidental with her two children who are between 3 and 4 years old. Ma. Regina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2006 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000. Ma. Regina is now borrowing Php 18,000 so that she can expand her general store. This will be her 9th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Ma. Regina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Savaet

texts.en:
Mrs. Savaet V. is a 28-year-old married woman and a villager who lives in Thmei village in Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Samnang Him, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they grow crops. Aside from farming, Mrs. Savaet V. is also raises pigs at home and is able to earn a small income to support her family.

For her pig business, Mrs. Savaet V. decided to ask for a loan to buy five piglets to raise. With the rest of the loan she wants to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her farm crops.

This couple has three children: two are attending the local school while the youngest one is two years old. Her husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy five piglets plus fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Heng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. N. is the leader of this four-member group; all the borrowers live in the province of Siem Reap.

N., 43, is currently a massage employee in a small club and earns a suitable salary to contribute to her family’s wellbeing. She is married to Saiy, 46, who is a requirement (temporary) laborer. N. is the mother of five children, all of whom are single. One of her sons works driving a taxi.

N. has an older house that frequently has problems and she hopes to repair it by using this loan from Kiva.

The other three borrowers are:

S., 58, who sells firewood to earn a living. She needs a loan to repair her broken motorcycle.

N., 55, who makes and sells various cakes. She is asking for a loan to sustain her business growth.

L., 63, who is a porter in the busy local market. She requests a loan to repair her old house.

loans.use: To repair her old house

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en: Wilma Y. is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by engaging in a general store and a pig-fattening business. She lives in Barangay Polo, Tanjay City, Negros Oriental with her husband and their 20-year-old child who is still currently going to school. Wilma has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and pig-fattening businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 4,000. Wilma is now borrowing Php 18,000 so that she can continue her general store and pig-fattening businesses. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 18,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Wilma aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Aylin

texts.en:
Aylin S. is a 48-year-old married woman who lives in Guartel Enclaro, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling fish.

Aylin’s husband, Marvin, is also a fish vendor and they have three children who are between 15 and 26 years old. They have one child who is currently going to school and who also helps in the business as part of the daily chores. Their other two children are currently working for other people.

Aylin S. joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 1995 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in fish vending. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000 from her business activities.

Aylin S. is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 was used to purchase a motorcycle so that they could reach more rural areas in their fish vending business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and on her family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing PHP 24,000 for her 14th loan which she intends to use as additional working capital in her fish-vending business. Aylin is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which is to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.


 About NWTF:

Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her business

loans.name: Oll

texts.en:
Mrs. Oll Y. is 54 years old and is a villager who lives in Thmei village, Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Phoa You, are farmers who own 1.50 hectares (3.75 acres) of land on which they grow crops. Her husband is shown with her in the photo. For this farm, Mrs. Oll Y. decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support her crops.

Aside from farming, this couple are also farm laborers from which they are able to receive a small salary to support their family living. They have seven children: one is seller, one is a farmer, two are laborers while the other three are students and also support their parents’ farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida D. C. is a 58-year-old married woman who lives on 5th Street, Barangay Progreso, Binalbagan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living with her general store business. Leonida’s husband, Romeo, is a company guard and they have two children who are between 33 and 35 years old, both employed. Leonida joined NWTF-Project Dungganon (NWTF-PD) in 2002 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by engaging in her general store business. Now she earns an average monthly income of P9,000 from her business activities. Leonida is a member of good standing. Her previous loan of P18,000 was used to fund operations of her general store and it had a positive impact on both the business and on the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing P8,000 for her 13th loan which she intends to use for her general store. Leonida is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To use as additional working capital for her general store

loans.name: Rithy

texts.en:
Mr. Rithy P. is 30 years old and is a villager who lives in Thmei village, Kandal province. He is a farmer and also a motorbike repairer who is able to earn a small income to support his family. His wife raises pigs at home and she is shown with him in the photo.

In order to support his wife’s business, Mr. Rithy P. decided to ask for a loan to buy six piglets and pig feed and to buy fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline to support his farm crops.

This couple has three children: two are attending the local school while the youngest one is 2 years old.

loans.use: To buy six piglets and pig feed plus fertilizer, pesticide and gasoline

loans.name: María Aurora

texts.es:
María Aurora tiene 57 años D. edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, actualmente solo vive junto a su esposo y a uno D. sus hijos; juntos residen en el distrito D. Cayaltí, una zona agrícola ubicada a una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, gaseosas y frutas desD. hace más D. diez años, ella ofrece su mercadería durante la época escolar frente a una institución educativa D. la zona. Las ganancias que le brinda este negocio las utiliza en ayudar a su esposo en el mantenimiento D. la economía D. su familia; ella es muy conocida por los estudiantes D. la zona, la cuales siempre acuden a su puesto para adquirir los productos que ofrece.

María se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra D. mas mercadería para ampliar su negocio, D. esa manera ella planea responder a la demanda por los productos que ofrece y también aumentar sus ganancias.

Ella es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, en la zona donD. vive es bastante conocida y estimada por sus vecinos.
texts.en:
María Aurora is 57 years of age. She is married and has three children. At present she lives with her husband and only one of their children. Together they resiD. in the district of Cayaltí, an agricultural zone located an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has been dedicated to the sale of snacks, carbonated drinks and fruits for over ten years. She offers her merchandise during the school term in front of an educational institution of the area. The profits that she earns from this business are used to help her husband in the maintenance of the economy of their family. She is very well known by the students of the area, who always freqent her stand to acquire the products that she offers. María is requesting for the first time a loan of 500 new soles from Edpyme Alternative, which she plans to use to purchase more merchandise to expand her business. In that way she hopes to respond to the demand for the products that she offers and also to enlarge her profits. She is a hard-working and responsible woman. In the zone where she lives she is well known and well thought of by her neighbors.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy snacks, fruit and carbonated drinks to sell in her food stand.

loans.name: Nhaem

texts.en:
Mrs. Nhaem T. is 61 years old and is a villager who lives in Thmei village, Kandal province. She and her husband, Mr. Nhork Ro, are farmers who own a piece of land on which they grow beans and corn. In order to increase their income to improve the family living, Mrs. Nhaem T. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

This couple has two children, both of whom are farmers who also support their parents’ farming. Mrs. Nhaem T.’s husband is shown with her in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Nhech

texts.en:
Mrs. S., 28, is works in the service department of a casino club located in Phnom Penh, the capital of Cambodia. She started her job in 2007 and has been receiving a suitable salary to resolve her family’s financial problems.

S. is a single lady who currently lives with her mother, who earns a living by selling food. S. is the eldest daughter who never wastes time that could be spent earning money for her family. Also, she helps her mother in selling food when she is free from her job.

S. sees that the food-selling trade is very profitable for her family and she wants to sustain its growth by asking for a $1,200 loan through Kiva’s field partner, HKL.

loans.use: To sustain the growth of her family's food business

loans.name: Exaltaciona

texts.es:
Exaltaciona tiene 49 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive junto a su madre y a su hermano en el caserío Annape del distrito de Mórrope, una zona caracterizada por tener a la mayor parte de su población situada en zonas rurales que distan mucho una de la otra, pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra ubicada a mas de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega – tienda instalada en su domicilio, este negocio le ayuda a colaborar con la economía de su familia y también a sus vecinos, ya que con su negocio tienen diversos productos de uso diario al alcance de la mano, lo que sería difícil dada la ubicación alejada del caserío respecto al pueblo central.

Exaltaciona se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la adquisición de más mercadería para así ampliar su negocio y obtener mayores ganancias.

Ella es una mujer tranquila y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresaria para mejorar su calidad de vida. Anteriormente ya ha trabajado con Nuestra Institución y ha demostrado puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Exaltaciona is 49 years of age. She is a single woman and does not have children. She lives with her mother and her brother in the settlement Annape of the district of Mórrope, a zone characterized by having most of its population situated in rural zones that are widely separated from one another. It belongs to the province of Lambayeque and is found located more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She is dedicated to the sale of consumer staples and groceries from a small convenience store located in their residence. This business helps to contribute to economy of her family and also helps her neighbors, since with her business they have diverse products that they use every day within easy reach, which would otherwise be difficult to obtain given the remote location of the settlement with respect to the central town. Exaltaciona is requesting a loan of 2000 new soles from Edpyme Alternative that she plans to use to acquire more merchandise and thus to expand her business and obtain greater profits. She is a hard-working and tranquil woman. Her greatest wish is to continue growing as a businesswoman to improve her quality of life. She has already worked with our institution previously and has shown timliness and responsibility in making her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumer staples and groceries for resale in her convenience store

loans.name: Srey Pom's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of five people located in Krang Koam village in Kandal province. Mrs. Srey Pom K. is 32 years old and is the leader of the group who has been selected by the members. Each member of this group loan will use the loan to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Srey Pom K. is a farmer who owns 2.50 hectares (6.25 acres) of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from farming, she is also a seamstress in a garment factory where she receives a small income to support her family.

Mrs. Srey Pom K. is a widow with a child who is just three years old. In order to increase her income to improve her family’s living conditions, she decided to ask for a loan to buy piglets and pig feed for pig-raising.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Celia

texts.es:
Celia es una madre de familia de 22 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el distrito de Cayaltí, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Se dedica desde hace más de año y medio a la venta de comida en un puesto ambulante ubicado en el paradero de la línea de transporte Chiclayo – Oyotún (Oyotún es un distrito ubicado a media hora del distrito de Cayaltí). Allí ella ofrece todo tipo de alimentos a los choferes y transeúntes del lugar. El negocio es su principal fuente de ingreso, adicionalmente se dedica también a la crianza y venta de animales de corral.

Celia desea adquirir una mesa y utensilios de cocina para poder trabajar de una mejor manera, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden con el logro de su objetivo.

Celia es una joven que lucha diariamente y da lo mejor de sí para sacar adelante a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es tener un pequeño restaurante.
texts.en:
Celia is a 22-year old mother who lives with her husband and son in the Cayaltí district, an agricultural zone located one hour from the city of Chiclayo. For more than a year, she has dedicated herself to selling food from a stall located parallel to the Chiclayo - Oyotún transportation line (Oyotún is an area located a half-hour from Cayaltí). From there, she offers all types of food to the drivers and passengers in the area. The business is her primary source of income, however she also raises and sells farm animals. Celia would like to buy a table and kitchen utensils in order to better perform her work. This is the reason she has turned to Edpyme Alternative for her first loan of 500 Peruvian soles to achieve her objective. Celia is a young woman who fights each day to help get her family ahead. Her greatest wish is to one day have a small restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a table and utensils for her business.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en: Melinda C. is happy-looking and feels so excited about the support that she received from Kiva lenders for her fishing business in her previous loan. Melinda prays they all be blessed. She has a sound and solid relationship with the Kiva/ASHI partnership. Now, Melinda is proposing another Kiva loan to continue her fish cage and to support the maintenance of her sari-sari (variety) store. She has been able to improve her businesses due to her access to bigger loans from Kiva lenders. In addition, Melinda revealed the huge impact the loan has made on her family as, with the additional income, she was able to afford to buy desired food items for her family to eat and ensure prompt weekly payment of her obligation to ASHI and other needs. She is also happy because she is able to eat well and support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. What Melinda hopes right now is that their businesses will continue to succeed because this has been their life, providing for their family for more than twenty-six years now. They love what they do in making their business achievements. Melinda’s businesses have been very helpful in achieving her dreams for her children. For her, it is joy to see fulfillment in her businesses and family and, with her children growing up, she will want to see them having the best in life.

loans.use: To continue her fishing business and support the maintenance of her sari-sari store

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chea C. is 57 years old and is the leader of this group loan having been selected by its five members who are located in Prek Hang village in Kandal province. Each member of this group loan will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Chea C. is a rice hay seller who is able to earn a small income to support her family. For this business, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more rice hay to resell.

Mrs. Chea C.’s husband is a farm laborer who receives a small salary to support his family. This couple has two children: one is seamstress in a garment factory and the other is a student.

loans.use: To buy more rice hay to sell

loans.name: Yaceli Yaqueline

texts.es:
Yaceli tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en el caserío Monte Sullón del distrito de Catacaos, un distrito conocido por las artesanías y por los sombreros de palma que fabrican sus habitantes. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicado a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de ropa al crédito y al contado en su propio caserío, ella compra su mercadería en las ciudades de Chiclayo o Lima y lo distribuye entre sus clientes. También trabaja en base a pedidos. Este negocio es una fuente importante de ingresos para su familia, por lo que trata de mantenerla de la mejor manera posible.

Yaceli es encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que planea invertir en la compra de ropa para la estación de invierno, sus clientes le han solicitado diversas prendas de vestir para esta temporada.

Yaceli es una joven trabajadora y bastante responsable, su mayor anhelo es poder contar con una casa propia para poder vivir junto a los suyos.
texts.en:
Yaceli is 22 years old and single with no children. She lives in her parents' house, which is located in the Monte Sullón area of the Catacaos district, which is known for its handicrafts and the palm hats produced by its inhabitants. It is part of the Piura region, more than two and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past year, Yaceli has worked selling clothing for cash and credit to customers living in her area. She buys her merchandise in the cities of Chiclayo or Lima and distributes it to her clients. She also takes customer orders for merchandise. This business is an important source of income for her family, so she is trying to maintain it as effectively as possible. Yaceli is requesting a loan for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa, in the amount of 2000 Peruvian new soles, which she plans to invest in buying clothing for the winter season [June-September]. Her customers have asked her for a range of clothing items for this season. Yaceli is a hard-working and very responsible young woman; her greatest desire is to be able to have a house of her own where she can live with her loved ones.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding her inventory with clothing for the winter season

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mr. S. presently resides with other family members in the capital, Phnom Pen. He is married with a young child who is not enrolled in school. His wife works as a garment laborer in the factory.

S., age 27, acquired the skill of building wooden houses from his grandfather and is currently using his knowledge to earn his daily income. He is hired by people to repair or construct their new houses for a fee and has a few laborers who help him to provide this service.

Recently, S. has received a project to build a new house for a customer, but he is concernsed that he lacks some construction materials to perform this service. So, he decided to request a loan to buy the required articles.

loans.use: To buy some construction materials

loans.name: Baigalmaa

texts.en:
Baigalmaa, 39, is the mother of three children and she and her family live together in a ger (the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent). Her oldest two children, aged 18 and 17, are university students while her younger son, Chinguun, attends a local kindergarten.

Baigalmaa and her husband sell Japanese car parts at a local market called “Auto Hall" Center. She started her business in 2006 with a working capital of 1,000,000 MNT and she has managed to increase her working capital. They purchase their products once or twice a month. Since she started this business, Baigalmaa has been providing money for her family expenses and paying the education fees for her children.

Baigalmaa is an open person who has very good communication skills. She says, “The most important thing to me is to provide a good education for my children." She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more spare parts for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more spare parts

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es:
Eulalia es una madre de familia de 42 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en el caserío Narihualá, del distrito de Catacaos, provincia de Piura en la Región Piura, ubicada a 3 horas y 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El anhelo de sacar adelante a sus hijos llevó a ella y a su esposo a trabajar en la venta de algarrobina (jalea hecha a base del fruto del algarrobo) y miel de abeja, actualmente ella ofrece este producto en los terminales terrestres de la ciudad de Piura y su esposo la ofrece en la ciudad de Chimbote. La algarrobina es preparada por ellos en sus casas y la miel de abeja la adquieren de los apicultores de la zona. Ambos productos son embotellados para luego ofrecerlos al público.

Eulalia ya ha trabajado anteriormente con el fondo Kiva, su primer crédito fue para ampliar su negocio con la compra de más miel de abeja para empezar a ofrecerla en otros distritos. Y actualmente se encuentra solicitando un nuevo crédito de 800 nuevos soles para invertirlos en la compra de insumos con los cuales preparará más algarrobina.

Eulalia es una madre que día a día da todo de sí para seguir adelante y progresar junto a su familia. Ella se encuentra agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva y nos comenta que gracias a su primer crédito pudo obtener mejores ventas y captar más pedidos de sus productos.
texts.en:
Eulalia, age 42, lives with her husband and their two children in the Narihualá village in the Catacaos district, Piura province, Piura region. It is located 3 hours and 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. The desire to get her children ahead drove Eulalia and her husband to work selling “algarrobina” (jelly made from a base of carob fruit) and honey. She currently sells this product at the bus terminals in the city of Piura. Her husband sells it at the city of Chimbote. They make the algarrobina in their house, and they get the honey from beekeepers in the area. Both products are bottled to later be sold to the public. Eulalia has previously worked with a Kiva loan. She used her first loan to expand her business by purchasing more honey in order to start selling it in other districts. She is currently requesting 800 PEN to buy supplies for making more algarrobina. Eulalia is a mother who gives all of herself everyday in order to keep getting ahead and to progress together with her family. She is grateful for the Kiva loans. She tells us that, thanks to her first loan, she was able to have better sales. She was also able to get more orders for her product.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy supplies to make carob fruit jelly

loans.name: Leng

texts.en:
Mrs. Leng S., 27, lives in Phnom Penh city, in Cambodia. She has had a job as a garment laborer in industry for years. She earns a salary of over $90 a month, helping to ensure her family has a stable income. She currently cares for a lovely young child, who is not going to school. She is married to Sarun, 28, who works with her in the same factory.

The rice comes to maturity this season; Leng S. wants to take this good occasion to earn more revenue by investing as a rice trader. Because she doesn’t have capital, Leng S. decided to request a $400 loan in order to buy rice in bulk to resell. She is hopeful that the loan will update her family’s financial situation.

loans.use: To buy rice in bulk to resell

loans.name: Thy Mi Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy M. is 50 years old and is the leader of this group loan having been selected by its four members located in Prek Hang village in Kandal province. With this group loan, each member will use it to support their different purpose.

Mrs. Thy M. and her husband, Mr. Sen Khorn, are fishermen who are able to earn a small income to support their family. For this business, Mrs. Thy M. decided to ask for a loan to buy fishing nets and a fishing boat to support her business.

This couple has six children: two are laborers while the other four are students in the local school.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and a fishing boat

loans.name: Afgan

texts.en:
Afgan is 30 years old and from the Fuzuli region. He is married and has two children, ages 10 and 15. For the past six years, Afgan has been raising sheep. His 15-year-old son helps him, while his wife shears the sheep for wool from which she makes warm jackets and blankets that the family sells. 

Afgan is seeking a loan of 2,000 Azerbaijani New Manats to buy five more sheep, hoping to sell more meat, milk, yogurt and cheese in time for Ramadan this year. This would be his first loan.

loans.use: To buy 5 more sheep

loans.name: Sakit

texts.en:
Sakit is 35 years old and an internally displaced person from Fuzuli city. He currently lives in the Fuzuli region, an area still under Azerbaijan's jurisdiction. He is married and has two children, ages 13 and 14. His business is a stand from which he sells fruits and vegetables all year.

Sakit is seeking a loan of 2,000 Azerbaijani New Manats to expand his stand so that it would provide shade for his produce. He worries that the vegetables go bad too quickly under the heat of the sun during the summers and freeze during the winters. By building additional shelves on his stand, he could increase the shelf-life of the produce he sells. 

Sakit hopes that by keeping his produce fresh longer, he can decrease the number of trips he takes to purchase them at the various bazaars, some of which are located quite a distance away.

loans.use: To expand his stand so that it would provide shade for his produce

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina R. is a busy entrepreneur managing her fishing and sari-sari (variety) store businesses. Her previous loan from ASHI provided working capital to expand her businesses by purchasing additional fishing materials and more foodstuffs for her store. With the loan, she noticed that her monthly income has almost doubled since she has attracted new customers with the additional inventory.

Josefina joined Kiva’s partner ASHI in 2002, attracted by ASHI's lower interest rates and range of loans for business, education, and home repair. Prior to joining ASHI, Josefina had no access to capital to support her entrepreneurial dreams.

Positive growth from Josefina’s businesses has helped her fund the education of her children. Since joining ASHI, she has experienced positive changes in her life. She hopes her businesses will continue to flourish so that she can provide longterm financial stability for her family.

Josefina’s fishing business also contributes income and that’s why, even if sometimes selling fish is hard to do, she never gets tired of doing it. Therefore, she is now requesting another loan for the much larger amount of 45,000 PHP to purchase other fishing materials and to support the maintenance of her sari-sari store. This will allow her to grow her businesses further so that her children can fulfill their dreams of completing college degrees and experience a life that’s full of happiness.

Josefina’s family feels very happy with the loan that improved their lives. She continues praying and wishing all lenders all the best and good luck and hopes they will continue to support poor families like hers, who want to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase other fishing materials and to support the maintenance of her store

loans.name: Ket

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is 31 years old and has been selling roasted meatballs in the busy local market for more than two years. She sells meatballs to market buyers who eat them as a snack. She has another financial earner in her husband who is a mechanic in a factory. This couple is blessed with two young kids who attend the primary school.

S.’s husband finds it hard commuting to his work location because he has no vehicle of his own for his transportation needs. To help solve this problem, S. is applying for a Kiva loan to be used to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to drive to work.

Mrs. S. was busy at her business activity when the photo taken so her mother is pictured instead.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to use for commuting

loans.name: Damira's Group

texts.en: Damira S. is the leader of this group. She is 34, married, and has two daughters and two sons. The youngest son is not yet in school but the others are. Five years ago Damira saved some money and, with the initial investment of 1,000 soms (approximately $21), she began to make pillows and mattresses for sale. Her husband and her older daughter help her in this activity. In this way Damira earns 9,000 soms (approximately $195) per month and this profit made is possible for her to purchase a vehicle. With money received from the new loan she wants to purchase materials to increase the turnover of her business. In the future she plans to repair her house. Tinatin C. is 45 and is married. Her husband works as a musician; he sings at weddings and other festivities. Tinatin works in a barbershop which she has been doing for fifteen years, earning 15,000 soms (approximately $325) per month. Because of that profit she was able to purchase musical equipment for her husband. Tinatin wants to obtain a loan because she needs money to repair her barbershop and to buy some equipment for it. In the future she wants to open a cafeteria and purchase a vehicle. Turdumat A. is 43 and works as a driver. His wife works in a sewing workshop. They have two sons, both of whom study at school. Turdumat and his wife have a piece of land where they cultivate fruits and vegetables. They also breed cattle. Turdumat applied for this loan because he needs money to repair his vehicle and also to purchase a bull-calf for breeding. Ainura Z. is 23 and is married. She is the treasurer of the group. Her husband sells spare parts at the market. They have three sons, all of whom are too young to work or go to school, and her mother-in-law sits at home and takes care of them. Ainura wants to obtain a loan to purchase women's apparel in order to resell it at the market. In the future she wants to expand her business and open a store. --- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135. If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making pillows and mattresses

loans.name: Zhamysh's Group

texts.ru:
Обычно мечты у людей возникают ещё в детстве. Но эти мечты скорее имеют сказочный, или скажем не совсем реалистичный характер. Однако в последующие годы взросления, мечты нас никогда не оставляют, и всегда сопутствуют нас в наших повседневных делах. Они и очерчивают и конкретизируют наши действия, направляя их в определённое русло, постоянно питая нас дополнительной энергией и энтузиазмом и всегда настраивая нас на упорство по их достижению. В преклонном возрасте, когда больше половины жизни уже прожито, человеку уже больше хочется покоя, и чего – то более привычного, и того задорного пыла и поиска, что был у него в молодости уже нет. Жамыш Майымбетова – лидер данной группы. Ей шестьдесят лет, но у неё есть мечта, которая придаёт ей дополнительные силы и делает её намного моложе.  Муж Жамыш – пенсионер, однако и он старается во всём помогать Жамыш. В 2005 году, Жамыш, её муж и сын открыли магазин, и с тех пор этот магазин является основным источником их семейного дохода. Копя доход, им удалось купить земельный участок. Вот и у Жамыш появилась мечта – построить большой ресторан. Ведь у неё есть с кем вести дело – муж, младший сын, и его жена, которая и сейчас работает в магазине. Жамыш обратилась за этим кредитом, чтобы вложить средства в обновление торговли.
Партнёры Жамыш:

Турумбековой Шаршебубу 59 лет. Она вырастила троих детей и сейчас живёт с младшей дочкой. Чтобы прокормить себя и дочку, Шаршебубу продаёт лепёшки, самсы и булочки. Дочь Шаршебубу также работает и помогает маме. Шаршебубу обратилась за этим кредитом, так как хочет вложить средства для улучшения условий в доме. 

Мусаевой Рахат 28 лет. Муж Рахат – токарь, а сама Рахат – частный предприниматель. Несколько лет назад она начала своё дело – открыла цех по производству пластиковых окон и дверей. Её доход составляет около десяти тысяч сомов. Рахат сейчас нуждается в помощи – ей нужен кредит, чтобы купить материалы для производства. 

Азыркулову Кубанычбеку 31 год. У Кубанычбека годовалый сын. Жена Кубанычбека в данное время находится дома с сыном и не работает. Кубанычбек – начинающий предприниматель. Пока он решил начать с перепродажи скота. Он очень надеется получить этот кредит, чтобы купить десять баранов для дальнейшей перепродажи. Он хочет увеличить поголовье скота и улучшить благосостояние семьи. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
People usually have dreams since childhood, but these dreams have more of fairytale-like and unrealistic characteristics. However, in subsequent years of growth, the dreams never leave us and always accompany us in our day-to-day business. They define and make our actions concrete, directing them into a set channel, constantly feeding us additional energy and enthusiasm and always preparing us to have determination to achieve these dreams. At an older age, when more than half a life has been lived, a person wants more peace and be more settled, and does not have the passion and drive that he had in his youth. Zhamysh M. is the leader of this group. She is sixty years old, but has a dream that gives her additional strength and makes her feel much younger. Although her husband is retired, he tries to help Zhamysh with everything. Zhamysh, her husband and their son opened a store in 2005, and this store has been the primary source of their income since then. Having saved the profits, they were able to buy a plot of land. And Zhamysh started to dream of building a big restaurant. She can run this business with her husband, younger son and his wife, who currently works at the store. Zhamysh requested this loan in order to invest money into renewal of sales. Zhamysh’s partners are: Sharshebubu T. is 59 years old. She raised three children and now lives with her younger daughter. In order to support herself and her daughter, Sharshebubu sells flatbread, samsas and small bread. Her daughter also works and helps her mother. Sharshebubu requested this loan because she wants to invest money into home improvements. Rahat M. is 28 years old. Her husband is a machinist, and Rahat is an entrepreneur. Several years ago, she started her own business and opened a plastic windows and doors manufacturing factory. Her income is about ten thousand som. Rahat currently needs help. She needs a loan in order to buy manufacturing supplies. Kubanychbek Azyrkulova is 31 years old. He has a one-year-old son. His wife currently stays home with the son and does not work. Kubanychbek is a beginner entrepreneur. For now he decided to start with livestock sales. He really hopes to obtain this loan, so that he can buy ten sheep for subsequent resale. He wants to increase the livestock headcount and improve his family’s wellbeing.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales renewal

loans.name: T

texts.en:
T D. is currently in the business of selling cassava and maize flour and is requesting a loan to stock bags of beans and pulses to sell.  She is 41 years old and married. Her husband is a peasant. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to continue sending her children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy supplies of beans and pulses to resell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose A. is currently in the business of selling food at her restaurant and is requesting a loan to stock more supplies of beans and rice.  Rose is 42 years old and married. Her husband is a police man. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to secure a house for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of beans and rice for her restaurant

loans.name: Azra Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Azra perveen lives in the mid-sized city of Vehari, Pakistan. She is a seamstress and very skillful in her work. She works for her neighborhood clients and receives a reasonable income.
