Son stock de produits nécessaires à l’activité de la restauration est épuisé, elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter 5 sacs de riz, 3 bidons d’huile, 5 sacs de haricot et un sac de piment.
Elle est  mariée et mère de 4 enfants, avec son revenu elle contribue aux charges financières du foyer.
texts.en:
This lady’s activity is preparing food, and she specialises in Togolese cuisine. She has developed a solid reputation in the area because of the quality of her cooking. As the stock of supplies she needs to prepare food is now depleted, she is requesting her first credit loan from WAGES to buy 5 bags of rice, 3 containers of vegetable oil, 5 bags of beans and one bag of chilli peppers. She is married and the mother of four children, and uses her income to help cover household expenses.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy products necessary to prepare food

loans.name: Rubina Kousar's Group

texts.en: Rubina Kousar lives with her two children in a two room brick house situated in Vehari, Pakistan. A very caring lady, Rubina stays at home and manages the household chores. She also supports her husband by taking care of his animals. He is an animal seller, and has been operating a business for the last fifteen years. Rubina is applying for a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan, and a partner of Kiva) for the first time.  She will invest the capital in her husband’s business, so he can purchase goats and meet his customers’ needs.

loans.use: to purchase goats for selling

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife, and has owned a car metal shop for the past 20 years. He now wants to improve the business by requesting a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., in the amount of $1,200.

loans.use: to improve the business

loans.name: Jacques  Babatoundé

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est âgé de 34 ans, il est un couturier brodeur, il fait cette activité depuis 1998, la machine qu’il utilise pour faire son activité de broderie est en panne, il souhaite se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat d’une nouvelle machine à Broderie. Il est marié et père  d’un enfant .
texts.en:
This gentleman is 34 years old. He is a tailor and embroiderer, and has been active in this profession since 1998. The machine he has been using for embroidery is out of order and he needs a replacement. This is why he approached WAGES requesting a loan to buy a new embroidery machine. He is married and the father of one child.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase needed merchandise

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: Mamadou B.  jeune marié, 33 ans age père de 04 enfants il habite a grand yoff, un quartier non loin de la caisse membre depuis 2008 il est mécanicien de profession et sollicite son troisième prêt à la caisse pour acheter des motos d'occasion les retaper puis les revendre pour augmenter ses profits et éventuellement sa situation sociale
texts.en:
Mamadou B. is a young married man, who is 33 years old and father to four children. He lives in Grand Yoff, a district that is not far from the savings bank. He has been a member of this savings bank since 2008. He is a mechanic by profession and is requesting a third loan from the savings bank to buy second hand motorbikes to do up and then resell, in order to increase his profits and potentially his social situation.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vehicles and second-hand motorbikes to do up and resell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 43-year old married man living in Lebanon. His three young children still attend school, and he is the only person in the family who is working. He has been a freelance construction worker for the past 25 years, and works hard in order to provide for his family and give his children the chance to get an education. He now wants to improve his business by purchasing new tools, for which he is requesting a $700 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing new tools

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la restauration, elle a 5 ans d’expérience dans ce commerce. Sa cuisine est spécialement togolaise. Les produits nécessaires à la préparation de la nourriture sont épuisés c’est pour cette raison qu’elle s’adresse à WAGES pour solliciter et obtenir de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  sacs de maïs et 2 tas d’ignames.
texts.en:
This lady has an income-generating restauration activity and she has five years' experience in this business. Her cooking is particularly Togolese. The products she needs to prepare her food have run out, and for this reason she has approached WAGES to request a loan for the purchase of sacks of corn and two piles of yams.

Translated from French by Alison Le Bras, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products necessary for restauration activity

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 20-year old man from Lebanon. He is living with his mother and younger sibling. In 2008, he opened his own call center where people from the neighboring areas come to make local or international calls. He is requesting a $2,000 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new phones and improve his store.

loans.use: to purchase new phones and improve his store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 34-year old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and he is the main income provider for his family with his business.
 For the past few years, he has made his living as a professional taxi driver. He operates transportation services for customers in his village as well as neighboring towns. With his Kiva loan requested of US $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l., he will be able to perform maintenance work on his vehicle. He reports that these improvements will enable him to provide his service to more passengers.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on his car

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 21-year old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and younger sibling, who still attends school. When he was still in school he started working as a tutor for pocket money; after he graduated he took it more seriously and he currently gives private lessons from his parents' house.  He is requesting a loan of  $800 to purchase a new computer in order to become more efficient.

loans.use: to purchase a new computer

loans.name: Yasmeen Abbas' Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen, 27, is from the area of Babar Chowk, Lahore, Pakistan. She is the leader of a 5-member group.  She is married and has three children: one son and two daughters. Her son is in kindergarten, and the others are not yet old enough to attend school.  

This year, Yasmeen joined Asasah to improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. To make a better living for her family, she runs a general store where she sells a variety of different products in the local community. She started this business three years ago. Her husband is a rickshaw driver, and has fifteen years of experience in this profession. He purchased a rickshaw three years ago and is paying for it in installments.  Yasmeen is applying for a loan to pay off the remaining instalments, so that her husband can become the full owner of the rickshaw and get better profits from driving.

loans.use: to pay the remaining installments on her husband's rickshaw

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William S. currently sells groundnut paste and bread and is requesting a loan to stock cooking oil and tomatoes to sell.  William is 29 years old and is married; her husband is a farmer. The couple has 2 children who attend school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, William hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock cooking oil and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 48-year old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two children who also help out with the family expenses. He has been working as a security officer for the past 10 years, but the last 6 years he has been working on his own as per the clients' request. This type of business became popular in Lebanon due to the instability situation during the last few years.
He is requesting a $1,000 loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l in order to buy a special suit and a stun gun.

loans.use: to buy a special suit and a stun gun

loans.name: Firdous' Group

texts.en:
Firdous A. A., 36 years old, is from Babar Chowk, in the city of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the group leader of a 4-member loan.

Firdous is married and has three sons and one daughter. Her elder son sells used handsets. The next son works in a local factory on monthly wage. The third son reads in 3rd standard. Her daughter also shares the same school with her brother and reads in 7th standard.

Her husband operates a juice corner in the market. He has over 15 years of experience in this business. He sells the fresh juice of fresh fruits. He also offers fruit shakes to his customers. His quality and presentation style attract more customers to his juice corner. He offers a small glass of juice with the big one free of cost.

Firdous is applying for a loan for the first time from Asasah. She will invest her loan in her husband’s juice corner so he can buy fresh fruits in bulk and make his clients happier with the quality of his work.

loans.use: Purchase fresh fruits to use for juice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old single man from Lebanon who lives with his parents and brother. He has worked in the jewelry business for the past 17 years, and five years ago went into business making and selling his own jewelry. He is requesting a $800 loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. to buy supplies for his small company.

loans.use: to buy supplies for a small jewelry-making business

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya I. makes a living brewing and selling local Sudanese alcohol and has applied for this loan to buy supplies for her company. She is 31 years old and married to a soldier. She has three children, all of whom go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build bar and stock up on supplies of beer. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy brewing supplies

loans.name: Um-E-Arbab's Group

texts.en: Um-e-arbab is 30 years old and lives in an area of Lahore, Pakistan known as Babar Chowk. She leads a loan group made up of four people, and is married with four children: three sons and one daughter. All of her children are enrolled in school and are doing especially well in reading. A caring lady, Um-e-arbab stays at home to raise her family. Her husband is Muhammad A. and he makes a living selling fruit. He has been in this business for the last seven years, and works hard traveling from area to area to sell his produce. Um-e-arbab has applied for this loan to help her husband expand his business by buying more in-season produce to sell to his customers.

loans.use: To buy in-season fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year old married man living with his wife and two young children in Lebanon. Fifteen years ago he started working for a company by transporting supplies. And in 2007, he purchased his own mini-van and started working on his own as a taxi driver. And he's thankful for his successful taxi business. In Lebanon, it is common to use taxi services to go between neighborhoods in a given town as well as to travel between different regions. These services are especially important in areas where the infrastructure is less developed, which is true for most of the towns outside of Beirut and its surrounding suburbs. 

He is now requesting for a $1,200 loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l to improve the maintenance of his taxi and replace its tires.

loans.use: to repair his van

loans.name: Naziran's Group

texts.en:
Naziran and her husband M. J. live in Lahore, a city which is famous for historical places and Punjabi foods. In addition to raising four children -- two sons and two daughters -- she leads a loan group with three members. Her older son makes a living embroidering dresses for a boutique. Her younger son is a laborer who works for a daily wage. Her daughters are doing well in school, and Naziran and her husband want to continue to give them a good education. To achieve this dream, their sons are helping them pay their daughters' tuition.  

Naziran and her husband both work very hard. For the last 10 years, she has earned an income working at home as a seamstress, a line of work at which is she is very skilled. Because her prices are low and she is good at what she does, all of her neighbors want her to sew their clothes, and she has an excellent reputation in her area. 

Her husband makes a living selling clothes, buying supplies in cities such as Multan and Faisalabad, where prices are low and quality is high. He sells this clothing in different parts of Lahore, where he works hard to make money to support his family. He has been in this line of work for the past six years.  

Naziran has successfully repaid her first loan from Asasah and now is applying for the second loan with her group. She will use her portion of this loan to buy clothing in bulk for her husband to sell to his customers for a good profit.

loans.use: to buy clothing in bulk for resale

loans.name: Eduina

texts.en:
Eduina D. is in the business of selling charcoal at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell. She is 39 years old and is married. Her husband is a police officer. She has four children who go to school. With the extra profit from her loan she hopes to be able to build up her charcoal store.

About BRAC

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year old married man with one new baby born from Lebanon. In 2006, he opened his own barber shop. Despite his young age, he has been working for severA. years in this type of job before opening his own business. He works hard to satisfy the needs of his new family; his story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household expenses, sick and aging family members, and at the same time run a business.
He is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new equipment for his business. He remains optimistic about the future and hopes that both his income and business productivity will be increased with the help of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his business

loans.name: Zubaida's Group

texts.en:
Zubaida is the wife of K. D. and they both are citizens of Lahore (famous for its historical places and Punjabi foods). She owns a small house with two rooms and has been living in it with her family for over twenty years. 

Zubaida has given birth to seven children: three sons and four daughters. Her first two sons work in a cotton factory for monthly wages. The others are enrolled in school and read in 5th, 4th and 3rd standards.

A very talented lady, Zubaida operates a clothes-sewing business. She has been doing domestic sewing for more than six years. She is a skilled woman and she offers her sewing services to her neighbors. The price of her sewing is reasonable; so her neighbors come again to her to place orders.  

Her husband is also a very hard-working person. He runs his dairy business. He purchases the milk from the milk shops and sells it to the community. But it gives him little income for his struggle. 

Therefore Zubaida is applying for a loan for the second time from Asasah to purchase a dairy cow for her husband so he gets the milk from it and sells it to more customers and makes more profit from the business.

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow for her husband's milk-selling business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 35-year-old married man living with his wife and three young children in Lebanon. Ten years ago he started working for a company by transporting supplies. In 2006, he purchased his own minivan and started working on his own.

He is now requesting a $1,200 loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to improve the van's condition and paint it.

loans.use: To improve the van's condition and paint it

loans.name: Elizebeth

texts.en:
Elizebeth A. is currently in the business of selling bread and ice cream at the market and is requesting a loan to stock cakes and groundnut paste to sell. Elizebeth is 35 years old and married to a businessman. She has 3 children, who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to establish a restaurant.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock cakes and groundnut paste to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 23-year old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and two siblings. In 2005, he started working as an electrician.
He is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l, in order to purchase a car for his business. Once he has the car, he will become much more time efficient and able to take on more projects.

loans.use: to purchase a car for his business

loans.name: Monika

texts.en:
Monika M. is currently in the business of selling beans and pulses at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice to sell. Monika is 34 years old and married; her husband is a driver. She has 2 children, who both attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Abuk

texts.en:
Abuk A. is currently in the business of selling maize and cassava flour at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of rice to sell.  Abuk is 37 years old and married; her husband is a laborer. She has 3 children, who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock bags of rice to sell

loans.name: Twesonde Development Group, Jinja

texts.en:
This 21-year-old is now three years into his fruit and vegetable selling business in Aldina, Jinja. O. Francis began his business after he dropped out of school when his parents could no longer afford his fees. At his young age, he already has responsibilities: he is married and has one child of his own to take care of, plus his wife.

To all appearances, Francis is destined for success on the basis of his strong sense of optimism and strength of character. His customers have been benefitting from his good human and customer relationship skills in this short time he has been operational.

With the confidence Francis is carrying himself around with, his business’s future prospects look brighter. Though he has been operating on 50,000 shillings a week, his financial gains are more likely to increase. He for the most part sells oranges, passion fruit juice and guavas. His plan is to expand his business and subsequently provide a better future for his children.

Francis also ekes out supplementary profits from doing casual odd-jobbing for people like digging. With this loan, he feels he will be financially empowered to buy more fruits to sell to his increasing clientele.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits for his business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year old married man living with his wife and two young children in Lebanon. In 2005, he started working in a clothing store and after two years he found that this profession was suitable for him. That’s why in 2007, he has established a small clothing shop in his town. He offers all the new collections of man's wear and he always tried to be up to date with this market to be in the requisition of his clients. And he's thankful for his decision to start his own business.

He is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l. to expand his inventory for the summer season and propose a bigger choice of clothes to his clients.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Anai

texts.en:
Anai S. is currently in the business of selling simsims (sesame seeds) and groundnuts at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize flour to sell. Anai is 25 years old and single. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock bags of maize flour to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine A. is currently in the business of selling green vegetables at the market and is requesting a loan to stock dried fish and cooking oil to sell.  Christine is 34 years old and married to a policeman. She has 4 children, who all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to send her children to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to stock dried fish and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Cette femme est mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de gblinkomé qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. Elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Elle fait ce commerce depuis 2003. Elle a connu une baisse de stock, elle veut se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 3 sacs de charbons de bois
texts.en:
This is a woman who is married and the mother of three children. She lives with her family in Gblinkomé, which is an outlying district of the city of Lomé. She has a revenue-generating business involving charcoal. Her customers include anyone. She has been in this business since 2003. She has experienced a drop in inventory, so she wants to stock up again. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying three sacks of charcoal.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is an experienced construction worker. He’s 33-year old married man living with his wife and little child from Lebanon. He is especially talented at completing woodwork projects and wallpapers. He has been involved in this occupation for the past 15 years and he has made a good business reputation during those years. 
He is now requesting for a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l for the amount of $1,200 to purchase new tools and merchandise for his newest project.

loans.use: to purchase new tools and merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 34-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She lives with her husband and four small children. In order to help her husband with the family expenses, in 2006 she started working as a home-based tailor. She is requesting to borrow $2,000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to improve and expand the business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 21-year old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings who are still too young to start helping with the family expenses. He and his father collaborate to provide for the family. In 2006, he opened his own car repair shop specialized in selling and repairing vehicle’s body. He has been involved in this occupation for the past 10 years, having begun to work at a very young age.
He is now requesting for a $1,200 loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l to purchase used car parts in order to expand his business in the coming year.

loans.use: to purchase used car parts

loans.name: Yawa Klenam

texts.fr: Cette dame est âgée de 47 ans, elle exerce dans la restauration et a ouvert à cet effet un petit restaurant, elle s’est spécialisée dans la préparation de KOM qui est une pâte d’origine togolaise faite à base de maïs. Les matières nécessaires à la cuisson du KOM sont épuisées raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 5 sacs de maïs et 2 cartons de poissons fraîches. Elle est  mariée et mère d’un enfant
texts.en:
This lady is 47 years old and works in food catering. She opened a small restaurant for that purpose. She became specialized in making KOM, which is originally a Togolese mash made of corn. The necessary ingredients for cooking KOM are out of stock. For this reason, she is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying five sacks of corn and two boxes of fresh fish. She is married and the mother of one child.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sacks of corn and fresh fish

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 32-year old married man with one child from Lebanon. In 2003, he opened a gadget shop as his own business which included balloons, gifts and games after he had worked at such a store for 10 years and found that the business brought happiness to the hearts of the children. He’s very thankful for his business; it allows him to improve his life situation. 
He is now asking for his second loan of $1,500 loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l to increase his purchases for the upcoming summer season.  And he hopes that his diverse selection of gadgets will continue to generate good profits and enable him to expand his business even further. He expects his productivity and income to increase in the coming year.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Twegatte Association, Jinja Group

texts.en:
It is now six years since 29-year-old I. Paul began his produce-selling business in Namulesa, Jinja. This hardworking married father of four kids has given a good account of himself in taking measures aimed at consolidating the gains he has so far made over this short period.

Paul has mostly been selling beans and maize. He started off by selling his own home-grown produce till he later came to terms with the fact that he needed to diversify his business by buying more from other farmers who were growing on a larger scale. He previously bore a hand in a small business selling new clothes that is now non-operational.

Paul makes 100,000 shillings per week. What is on his mind now is the idea of expanding his business and educating all his children to university level. In his estimation, what will stimulate all his plans into action is this loan. With this loan, Paul says, he is going to purchase larger quantities of crops like maize, beans and cassava to sell.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of maize, beans and cassava to sell

loans.name: Vanesa Erika

texts.es: La solicitante es separada, tiene un hijo de 5 años, vive en casa de sus tios los cuales apoyan constantemente, cuentan con un negocio de venta de golosinas, bebidas, maní, habas tostadas y otros desde hace 2 años, enteriormente en la calle La Mar con Av Grau y ahora en Calle Cajamarca con Ayacucho contando con una carreta de metal propia donde exibe sus productos,no cuenta con ningun endeudamiento ni experiencia crediticia. El destino del credito es para realizar el deposito de S/. 720.00 para acceder a la construccion de un modulo basico de 35m2 mediante el programa del estado Techo Propio en el terreno que posee en la Tinguiña
texts.en:
The applicant is separated, has a five year old son, and lives in the house of her aunt and uncle who help her on a regular basis. For two years she's had a business selling sweets, drinks, peanuts, roasted nuts, and other items, first on the corner of La Mar Street and Avenue Grau and now on the corner of Cajamarca Street and Ayacucho. She uses her own metal cart where she exhibits her products. She does not have any debt or credit experience. The purpose of the loan is for a deposit of 720 soles to get started with the construction of a basic housing unit of 35 square meters through the state program Techo Propio (Own Roof) on the plot of land she has in the neighborhood of La Tinguiña.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a basic housing unit under the Techo Propio (Own Roof) program.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 43-year-old married woman from Lebanon with two children. Ten years ago she opened her own clothing store for the neighboring areas in order to help her husband with the family expenses. She is now well-known in the area.

She is now requesting a loan of $1,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase merchandise for her store.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Félicité Ayawavi

texts.fr:
Cette femme est âgée de 44 ans, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de produits d’alimentation elle a près de 10 ans d’expérience  professionnelle dans ce commerce, sa clientèle se compose de toutes personnes. Une partie de son stock est épuisée elle veut se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de 3 cartons de tomates, 2 cartons de pâtes alimentaires et divers.
Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants
texts.en:
This woman is 44 years old and has a revenue-generating business involving grocery items. She has nearly ten years of professional experience in this business. Her customers include anyone. Part of her inventory is exhausted. She wants to stock up again, which is why she is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying three boxes of tomatoes, two boxes of pasta, and various other items. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grocery items

loans.name: Sonia Angelica

texts.es:
Sonia es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo pequeño, de profesión Obstetriz, tiene una botica en un local alquilado que se encuentra cerca al hospital de la ciudad, su negocio se inicio en la casa de sus suegros, sus ventas eran pocas, ahora se han incrementado y necesita implementar con mas productos que tiene demanda en la zona, Sonia cambio la ubicación de su negocio hace 1 mes y esta cada día mejor, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su esposo, lo que mas le agrada de su Banco Comunal es el ahorro y la facilidad del préstamo. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de medicamentos antibióticos. 
Sus sueños son ampliar su botica y tener un mayor capital.
texts.en:
Sonia has a common-law husband and one small child. She is a midwife by profession, and she operates a pharmacy in rented quarters near the city's hospital. She began her business in her in-laws' house, but she had few customers. Now, sales have improved and she needs to stock her business with more products which are in demand in the area. Sonia changed the location of her business one month ago, and each day it is going better and better. She works every day, sometimes with her husband's help. What she likes most about her communal bank are the savings and the ease of obtaining a loan. Her loan will be invested in buying antibiotic medications. Her dreams are to expand her pharmacy and have a higher level of capital.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying antibiotic medications

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: La señora Justina se dedica a la compra y venta de ganados, viaja a la feria de Putaja que se encuentra a 2 horas de la ciudad de Ayacucho y compra los animales, en algunas oportunidades los engorda en su casa para tener mayores ingresos, también cría cuy y gallina, sus productos los vende en los mercados de la ciudad, Justina tiene 4 hijos que están estudiando. Justina pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Vida y lo que mas le agrada es el incentivo al ahorro, tiene proyectado comprar un carro con sus ahorros. Su préstamo sera invertido en la compra de cerdos para engordarlos. Justina sueña con tener una tienda.
texts.en:
Señora Justina is dedicated to the buying and selling of livestock. She travels to the outdoor market in Putaja that is located 2 hours from the city of Ayacucho to purchase the animals. Sometimes she fattens them at her house to have a greater income. She also raises guinea pigs and chickens. She sells her products in the city markets. Justina has 4 children that are in school. Justina belongs to the New Life Communual Bank and what pleases her the most is the incentive to save. She is planning to buy a car with her savings. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of hogs to fatten. Justina dreams of having a store.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy hogs to fatten for market

loans.name: Épé

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu la vente de friperie, sa clientèle se compose aussi bien de personnes adultes que de jeunes gens,  elle s’approvisionne au  marché local de hedrzanawoé. Elle veut gonfler son stock de marchandises et sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat d’un balle de vêtements. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a woman who has a revenue-generating business selling second-hand clothing. Her customer base is composed of adults, as well as youngsters. She gets her supplies at the local market of Hedrzanawoé. She wants to expand her stock of merchandise and is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying a bale of clothing. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying used clothing

loans.name: Luz Marleny

texts.es:
Luz tiene una hija de 1 año y es conviviente y vive en la casa de sus padres, desde muy niña ayudaba a sus padres en la venta de frutas, actualmente tiene un puesto en el mercado mayoristas de frutas en donde vende frutas de acuerdo a la temporada, ahora vende plátano y piña, actividad que realiza desde la madrugada hasta las 5 de la tarde. Luz pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Vida y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro. 
Luz necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plátanos. El sueño de Luz es cambiar de negocio por la venta de ropa o ferretería y tener un hotel.
texts.en:
Luz has a 1 year old daughter and shares a home, living in the house of her parents. From a very young age she helped her parents selling fruit. At present she has a position in the wholesale fruit market where she sells fruits according to the season. Now she sells bananas and pineapple, an activity that she performs from the early morning to 5 in the afternoon. Luz belongs to the New Life Communal Bank and what she likes most is the incentive to save. Luz needs a loan of 1500 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of bananas. The dream of Luz is to change her business to the sale of clothing or hardware and to have a hotel.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bananas for resale

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El señor Francisco vive en casa alquilada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa.
El señor Francisco es chofer y su esposa es ama de casa.
El crédito solicitado es para la reparación de movilidad, la misma que necesita un mantenimiento.                              
Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco lives with his wife in a rented home in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. Señor Francisco is a chauffeur and his wife is a housewife. The requested loan is for the repair of his vehicle, which needs maintenance. This it is the second occasion that he has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis carried out qualifies him favorably so that we can agree to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his taxi

loans.name: Paulina Julia

texts.es:
Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Vida y lo que mas le gusta son los prestamos fáciles y el incentivo al ahorro, con el cual compro su carro para repartir sus productos.
Julia tiene 64 años y 3 hijos que estudian, Julia Junto a su esposo tienen una carpintería en su casa, su taller cuenta con maquinaria necesaria, sus trabajos son con contrata D. personas particulares y D. instituciones, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos, Julia ayuda en el lijado D. los muebles. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra D. madera.
Julia sueña con comprar una granuladora para implementar su taller.
texts.en:
Julia belongs to the New Life Communal Bank and what she likes most are the ease of obtaining a loan and the incentive to save. With a previous loan she bought a car to distribute her products. Julia is 64 years old and has 3 children who are students. Julia and her husband have a carpentry shop in their house. Their workshop relies on necessary machinery. Their projects are through contracts with private individuals and institutions. They carry out this activity with the aid of their children. Julia helps in the sanding of the furniture. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of wood. Julia dreams of buying a sanding machine to use in the workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wood for their carpentry shop

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria C. esta muy agradecida por su cooperación en el crédito anterior el cual pudo comprar el equipo de sonido que necesitaba.
Solicita nuevamente un préstamo ya que tiene los gastos de la graduación de la escuela de su hija, no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar lo que le están pidiendo.
Pagara el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de renta de mesas y sillas para eventos sociales.
texts.en:
Señora Ana Maria C. is very thankful for the cooperation with the previous loan with which she was able to buy the sound system that she needed. She again requests a loan since she has the graduation expenses for her daughter, and does not have the necessary money to pay what they are asking of her. She will repay the loan with the profits that she obtains from her business renting tables and chairs for social events.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay graduation expenses for her daughter

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Jesús vive en casa propia con su señora madre en la zona de San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz.
Jesús es cocinero de la Escuela Hotelera; además atiende eventos los fines de semana.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de herramientas como ser ollas, vajilla, etc., e insumos.
Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Jesus lives in his own home with his mother in the zone of San Pedro in the city La Paz. Jesus is the cook of a hotel school and attends to events on the weekends as well. The requested loan is to buy tools such as pots, dinnerware, etc., and ingredients. This is his second loan, and a socioeconomic analysis grades him favorably and indicates that he is eligible for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pots, dinnerware, to serve events

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores tiene dos puestos en el mercado mayorista de frutas de la ciudad de ayacucho en donde vende frutas al por mayor y menor, su día inicia en la madrugada hasta las 6 de la tarde, sus productos los adquiere de los productores que le traen a su puesto, Dolores tiene 7 hijos de los cuales 3 son estudiantes y cuenta con el apoyo de ellos en la venta de sus productos.
Dolores tiene 54 años y es socia del Banco Comunal Nueva Vida hace 121 años, lo que mas le agrada de Finca es el ahorro programado y el préstamo rápido que otorgan. Dolores necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de plátano.
Dolores sueña con tener mas capital, educar a sus hijos e implementar otro negocio de especerías por mayor.
texts.en:
Dolores has two stalls in the wholesale fruit market in the city of Ayacucho. She sells wholesale and retail fruit there. Her workday starts at dawn and lasts until 6pm. She acquires her products from the producers who bring the fruit to her stall. Dolores has 7 children, 3 of whom are students, and she counts on their support in selling her products. Dolores is 54 years old and has been a member of the Communal Bank Nueva Vida for 12 years. What she likes best about Finca is the scheduled savings program and the quick granting of the loans. Dolores needs a loan of 3000 PEN, which will be invested in the purchase of bananas. Dolores hopes to have more capital, to educate her children, and to start another business in wholesale spices.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bananas.

loans.name: Janet

texts.es:
Yanet es conviviente, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo de 3 años, de profesión profesora y trabaja en un colegio, Yanet tiene proyectado casarse este año y terminar de construir su casa en el terreno que se compro con sus ahorros..
Yanet vende ropa, zapatos, colonias de acuerdo a pedidos, sus productos los ofrece a amigos y familiares, la mayoría de sus ventas son al crédito.
Yanet pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Vida y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones que recibe y el incentivo a ser responsable. Yanet necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de casacas, botines y ropa de niños.
Los sueños de Yanet es terminar de construir su casa, comprar un departamento de Lima y un carro para alquilar a empresas.
texts.en:
Yanet has a partner, is 25 years old, has a 3-year old son, and works in a school as a teacher. Yanet plans to get married this year, and to finish the construction of her house on a plot of land she bought with her savings. Yanet sells clothes, shoes, and colognes based on demand, offering her products to friends and relatives. Most of her sales are done on credit. Yanet belongs to the Nueva Vida Cooperative Bank, where she appreciates the resources has access to and the incentive to be responsible. Yanet needs a loan of 2,000 Peruvian soles, funds that she will use to invest in the purchase of masks, boots and children’s clothing. Yanet’s dreams include to finish building her house and to buy a car to rent out to various enterprises.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy masks, boots, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Aurora E. es madre soltera y tiene bajo su responsabilidad a dos hijos.
A la vivienda le esta haciendo falta cambiar la tubería del agua y drenaje, ya que actual mente esta en muy malas condiciones. Quiere que se la cambien ya que sus niños no pueden salir a patio a jugar. 
Pero no cuenta con el dinero para comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de cambiar las tuberías.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de sueldo por limpiar casa particulares en la vecina ciudad. 
Esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual termino los acabados del interior del cuarto.
texts.en:
Aurora E. is a single mother who cares for her two children. Their home is currently in poor condition and is in need of new plumbing and and a drainage system. Aurora would like to get these fixed because at the moment her children cannot play in the patio of the house. However, she doesn't have the money to buy the necessary materials and pay someone to change the plumbing. Aurora plans to repay this loan with part of the salary she earns cleaning houses in a neighboring city. She is thankful for the help given with her previous loan, which helped her to complete work on the interior of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of plumbing and drainage system

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia Q. is married to a farmer and has two children. She has received junior high education.

Emelia buys charcoal in bags and sells them in smaller quantities at Abura. She uses her income to support her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Emelia will use the loan to buy more bags of charcoal for her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to save to buy a plot of land for her family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying grocery items

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha vive en casa alquilada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, con su madre y sus dos hijos.

Martha es empleada de la Alcaldía Municipal  de esta ciudad, con sus ingresos ella mantiene a su familia.

El crédito solicitado es para la compra de víveres al por mayor y venderlos al por menor y a si aumentar sus ingresos. Esta es una segunda actividad que ella realiza para poder tener mejores ingresos.

Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Martha lives in a rented home in the Alto San Pedro section of the city of La Paz. She lives with her mother and her two children. Martha is an employee at the city’s Town Hall and supports her family with the income from this job. The loan is being requested to buy goods at wholesale, to later sell at retail so she can augment her income. This is a second activity she carries out in order to improve her earnings. This is the first time she requests a loan, and the financial analysis conducted favorably qualifies her to access credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase goods at wholesale, to then sell at retail.

loans.name: Carmen Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Patricia U. esta agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito.
Esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo para invertir en el negocio en mercaría y arreglos de fiestas y ocasiones especiales. Pero no cuenta con el dinero para invertir ya que no quiere descapitalizar el negocio es la fuente de ingreso para su familia.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas del negocio de ropa y arreglos.
texts.en:
Carmen Patricia U. is thankful for her previous access to credit. She is once again requesting a loan in order to invest her business through the purchase of merchandise and supplies for parties and special occasions. She does not have the funds to make this investment, as she does not want to reduce her business’ capital level, since it is the source of income for her family. She plans to pay for the loan using part of the earnings she obtains through her enterprise’s sales.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua E. cooks Jollof rice (a popular West African dish) at Abura for sale. She is married to a mason and lives together with her four children.

Efua has been selling cooked Jollof rice for about a year now, supporting her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy extra bags of rice to cook for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy extra bags of rice to cook for sale

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos vive en casa propia que esta ubicada en la zona central de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos.
El señor Carlos se dedica a la venta al por mayor de artículos de ferretería, fontanería y calefacción. Su puesto lo tiene en alquiler.
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar su capital de trabajo para poder traer más mercadería  y así poder tener más ingresos para la familia 
Esta es la séptima ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Carlos lives in his own home, located in the central zone of the city of La Paz, with his wife and four children. Carlos dedicates himself to selling hardware, plumbing and heating supplies. He works from a rented site. The loan he is requesting is to augment his working capital, in order to carry more merchandise. This would help him increase his earnings to support his family. This is his seventh loan request, and the financial analysis conducted qualifies him favorably for access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more products for his hardware store, where he sells a variety of products related to his trade.

loans.name: Saturnino

texts.es:
El señor Saturnino vive en casa alquilada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja en la prefectura, que es una institución pública, con un sueldo muy bajo. Por tal razón, Saturnino se dedica a elaborar chalinas para los fanáticos de los equipos de fútbol, con cuya actividad genera otros ingresos. El crédito que solicita es para comprar lana y otros tejidos para fabricar sus chalinas.

Es cliente de Impro desde Noviembre de 2006, y tiene un historial de pagos muy bueno, por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Saturnino lives in a rented home in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. He works in the prefectura, which is a public institution, with a very low salary. For this reason, Saturnine is dedicated to making scarves for the fans of the soccer teams. With this activity he generates additional income. The loan that he requests is to buy wool and other woven materials for making his scarves. He has been a client of Impro since November of 2006, and has a record of very good payments. Therefore we can agree to a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy wool and other woven materials for making scarves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair the patio in front of his house

loans.name: Gaston

texts.es:
El señor Gastón vive en casa de su suegra  en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa y tres hijos.
 
Gastón  es profesor al igual que su esposa, ingresos con los que mantienen a su familia.

El crédito solicitado es para educación superior de especialización y postgrado.

Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Gastón lives in the home of his mother-in-law in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz, with his wife and three children. Gastón is a professor just like his wife. With their incomes they maintain their family. The requested loan is for education of further specialization and post-graduate education. This it is the first occasion that he has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis carried out qualifies him favorably, so we can agree to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for continued education for his career as a professor

loans.name: Luisa Luna

texts.es:
Luisa Luna D. V.. D. Márquez, tiene 57 años resiD. en San Miguel,  es viuda  hace 10 años y actualmente vive con su hija  y un nieto, tiene una tienda D. productos D. primera necesidad.
Su padre era comerciante y se dedicaba a la venta D. cerdos y elaboración D. hamacas, lazos, el negocio les permitió establecer una tienda, y con el paso del tiempo Luisa también se dedico a crear su negocio donD. venden queso, carne, frijoles y otros productos D. primera necesidad, la prosperidad D. negocio le ha permitido sacar adelante a su familia. 
Luisa actualmente necesita dinero para comprar productos y continuar mejorando su negocio, ella necesita invertir en la compra D. carne D. pollo, queso, vegetales, frijoles, jugos D. diferentes frutas y ropa, ella es una persona emprendedora y responsable, alegre y amable con sus clientes sus aspiraciones son continuar con su negocio y ofrecer a sus clientes los productos que le demandan y por falta D. dinero no lo adquiere, este préstamo le permitirá mantener su fuente D. trabajo, cubrir gastos personales y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Luisa Luna, 57, has been widowed now for ten years and currently lives with her daughter and grandson. She has a shop where she sells basic essentials. Her father was a merchant who sold pigs and maD. hammocks and rope snares for sale. The business activity led them to establish a shop, and in time Luisa also went into business selling cheese, meat, beans and other essential items. The prosperity of her business has allowed her to improve her family’s quality of life. Currently Luisa needs money to buy products and continue improving her business. She needs to invest in the purchase of chicken, cheese, vegetables, beans, various fruit juices and clothing. She is an enterprising and responsible person, cheerful and friendly with her customers. Her goals are to continue with her business and to offer her customers the products they ask for which she has not been able to get for lack of money. This loan will allow her to maintain her source of work, cover personal expenses and improve her family's quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chicken, cheese, vegetables, beans, various fruit juices and clothing.

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger vive en casa de sus padres en la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como cajero en el supermercado Ketal, donde le pagan un salario muy bajo.
El crédito que solicita es para pagar sus estudios y poder de esta manera mejorar su educación y acceder a un trabajo mejor.

Es cliente de Impro y paga muy bien por lo tanto puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Roger lives in his parents' home and works as a cashier at the Ketal supermarket, where they pay him a very low wage. The loan he is seeking is to pay for his studies and thus to allow him to improve his level of education and gain access to a better job. He is a client of Impro and is very good with making payments; therefore he is able to apply for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Margaret Wolfe-Roberts, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cost of continuing his education in order to obtain a higher paying job.

loans.name: Mathusalam

texts.es: Mathusalam tiene 21 años, es un joven muy  responsable y  trabajador, es el tercero de 6 hermanos, por lo que aún vive en casa de sus padres. Lo que más desea, es mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, es por ello que desea terminar de construir su casa, aprovechando además su oficio de albañil, para cumplir ese propósito. Anteriormente trabajaba como ayudante de albañil, hoy se ha independizado y se dedica hacer revestimientos de paredes y pisos, es así que ha logrado trabajar por más de 5 años. Por el momento que aún no tiene contrato, tiene días libres para levantar la pared y arreglar el piso de su casa con ayuda de padre y hermanos. Él disfruta mucho su trabajo, sin embargo el tener que cargar las latas con mezcla batida le resulta pesado, pero sabe que solo así podrá mejorar su condición de vida. Con el tiempo espera invertir en un negocio. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso para ayudar a construir su casa, por ello se compromete pagar todas las cuotas puntualmente. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar materiales de construcción, como: arena y piedras chancadas para terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mathusalam is 21 years old. He is a very responsible and hard-working young man. He is the third of six children. That is why he still lives in his parents’ house. What he wants most of all is to improve the quality of life for his family. That is why he wants to build his house, and he will take advantage of his trade as a bricklayer to complete this proposal. Previously he worked as a bricklayer’s helper. Now he has become independent, and he makes coverings for walls and floors. He has worked this way for five years. For the moment he does not yet have a contract. On his days off he can raise the wall and do the floor with help from his father and brothers. He really enjoys his work even though he has to carry the heavy cans of the mixture. But, he knows that this is the only way he will be able to improve his quality of life. In time he plans on investing in his business. This is his first loan with MFP. He knows that the loan will be very beneficial in helping him build his house. He commits to making all of his payments on time. He will use the loan he is requesting to buy construction materials like sand and crushed stones to finish building his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sand and stones to finish building his house

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
El señor Hugo M. es padre de familia y tiene dos hijos que actualmente están estudiando, y para que le puedan entregar los papeles de estudio tiene que realizar varios pagos, pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para pagar y que sus hijos terminen el siclo escolar. 
Es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación en este crédito ya que desea que sus niños terminen la escuela.
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe como chofer de un camión de carga de una compaña de trasportes.
texts.en:
Hugo M. is a family man, and he has two children. They are now in school, and in order to be able to register them he must make several payments. But, at the moment he does not have the money to pay. His children are finishing the school cycle. That is why he is requesting your cooperation with this loan. He wants his children to finish school. He plans on repaying the loan from his salary. He drives a freight truck for a transportation company.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Educational expenses for his children

loans.name: Victoria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Victoria es soltera, tiene 32 años y 2 hijos, Victoria pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva vida lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones en temas de familia.
Victoria tiene una tienda en un local alquilado en donde vende mochilas, maletas, la atención en su negocio son todos los días durante todo el día, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima a donde viaja cada 15 días o dependiendo de la demanda. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de mochilas y maletas. Victoria esta ahorrando en su Banco Comunal para la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Victoria, age, 32, is single and has two children. Victoria belongs to the Nueva Vida Communal Bank. What she likes the most are the trainings on family. Victoria has a store in a rented location. She sells backpacks and suitcases. Her business is open all day everyday. She gets her products in the city of Lima. She travels there every 15 days, depending upon the demand. She will use the loan to buy backpacks and suitcases. Victoria is saving in her communal bank for her children’s education.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy backpacks and suitcases

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La señora Sonia es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres que esta ubicada en la zona alto Obispo Bosque de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora es empleada de supermercados Ketal y en su tiempo libre se dedica  a realizar masitas (repostería).
El crédito solicitado es para un capital de trabajo (compra de harina, huevos, levadura, etc.) para la elaboración de masas para pan y galletas y así mejorar sus ingresos.
Esta es la primera  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sonia is single and lives with her parents in the Obispo Bosque highland zone of the city of La Paz. She is employed by Ketal supermarkets and in her free time she makes pastries to sell. The loan Sonia solicits is for purchasing flour, eggs, yeast, etc., to make bread and cookie dough and, thus, to increase her income. This is the first occasion in which she has requested a loan and our socioeconomic analysis finds her qualified and eligible for credit.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING FLOUR, EGGS, YEAST AND OTHER INGREDIENTS FOR HER PASTRY BUSINESS

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
La señora Consuelo vive en alquiler en la zona Los Andes ubicado en ladera norte de la ciudad de La Paz, con su hijo.
Consuelo trabaja en una entidad financiera; sus ingresos son los que mantienen a su familia.
El crédito solicitado es el monto que le falta para la compra de una movilidad para poder hacerla trabajar como taxi y así tener un ingreso mas para mejorar su calidad de vida.
Esta es la sexta ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Consuelo rents a home in the Los Andes area on the north side of La Paz, Bolivia, with her son. She works in a financial institution and her income is what supports her family. This loan is for the amount she needs to buy a vehicle that she can use as a taxi, in order to have extra income and improve her quality of life. This is the sixth time that Consuelo has requested a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis that was done shows that she is qualified for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a vehicle for use as a taxi, to improve her income

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria De Lourdes R. le esta haciendo los acabados el exterior y interior del la casa.
Por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejor, es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de la mejora.
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su negocio de abarrotes que tiene en su propia casa. Ya que los gastos familiares se encargara su esposo el señor Gilberto Reyna, quien trabaja como supervisor de mantenimiento de una compañía de trasportes. 
Desean que sus dos pequeños hijos tengan un mejor lugar donde vivir.
texts.en:
Maria De Lourdes R.' home is being worked on, to finish the exterior and interior of the house. At the moment she does not have enough money to pay for these improvements. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy the materials needed and to pay the person who is in charge of the job. Maria plans to repay the loan through profits from the small grocery store that she runs from her house. Her husband, Gilberto Reyna, will take care of the household expenses. He works as a maintenance supervisor at a transportation company. They both want their two small children to have a better place to live.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvements to the exterior and interior of the house

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta es conviviente, tiene 47 años y 5 hijos de los cuales 3 estudian en el colegio, 1 de ellos termino sus estudios superiores y el otro todavía es pequeño.
Modesta pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva Vida y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones y el incentivo al ahorro.
Modesta tiene un puesto en el mercado Basilio Auqui en donde vende frutas variadas al por mayor y menor, de acuerdo a la temporada, actividad que realiza todos los días desde la madrugada hasta las 6 de la tarde. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de plátano. 
Modesta sueña con que todos sus hijos sean profesionales y que su hija viaje a España.
texts.en:
Modesta is 47 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has 5 children, 3 of whom still study in school. Her eldest child has graduated from secondary school and her youngest child is still small. Modesta belongs to the Nueva Vida (New Life) Communal Bank and what she enjoys most are the training classes and the incentive to save. Modesta has a stall in the Basilio Auqui Market where she sells various fruits seasonally, wholesale and retail, every day from early morning until 6:00pm. Her loan will be invested in purchasing plantains. Modesta dreams that all of her children might become professionals and that her daughter may travel to Spain.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASING PLANTAINS TO SELL

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
El señor Eusebio vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como carpintero independiente en su propio domicilio.
El crédito que solicita es para comprar madera y poder entregar los muebles que le piden ya que solo le dan el 50% de adelanto por cada obra y no le alcanza para terminar la obra completa, y lo que Eusebio quiere es no perder su trabajo ya que es su única fuente de ingresos.

No es cliente de Impro, esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito, pero por el carácter social puede acceder a un crédito.
texts.en:
Eusebio owns a house in the Pasankeri zone of La Paz city. He works as a carpenter and runs his own workshop. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy wood. He is working on an order of furniture but his customers only pay a deposit of 50% of the price, and it is not enough to allow him to finish the job. Eusebio wants to finish his work so that he doesn't lose business, as it is his only source of income. Eusebio isn't an Impro client - this is his first loan request. However, his character and reputation qualify him to obtain a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood to finish an order of furniture that is in progress.

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.es:
Gudelia pertenece al Banco Comunal Nueva vida.
Gudelia es casada, tiene 63 años y 4 hijos de los cuales solo uno esta con ella y esta estudiando en la universidad. Gudelia tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, especerías que ella misma prepara, actividad que realiza todos los dias desde temprano hasta la noche.
Gudelia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, aceite, verduras.
Gudelia sueña con que todos sus hijos tengan una casa y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gudelia belongs to the Nueva Vida Communal Bank. Gudelia is 63, married, and has four children. Only one of them lives with her, and he is studying in the university. Gudelia has a grocery store in her house. She sells general groceries, vegetables, fruit, and spices that she prepares. She does this everyday from early until nighttime. Gudelia needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy rice, oil, and vegetables. Gudelia dreams that all of her children have a house and that her son finishes his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy rice, oil, and vegetables

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
La señora Marisela F. es madre de familia, tiene dos hijos adolescentes que actualmente estudian.
Con un dos créditos anteriores de FVP ha construido dos cuartos, pero le falta colocarles el techo. Tiene el proyecto de construir una losa de concreto para que la casa sea más segura y duradera.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para esa construcción y planea pagarlo con el ingreso que obtiene su esposo el señor Juan Ruiz, como chofer de camión de carga de una compañía de trasporte. 
Su deseo es que sus hijos tengan su propio cuarto y vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Marisela F. is the mother of 2 adolescent children who are currently in school. With her 2 previous loans from FVP she built 2 rooms, but was unable to finish the roof. She wants to construct it with cement tiles so that the house is safer and more durable. Marisela is requesting a loan for this construction and plans to repay it with her husband's income as a cargo truck driver. Juan Ruiz works for a transportation company. Marisela's hope is for her children to have their own room for a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of roof.

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora Silvia es separada, vive en casa propia con un hijo  en la  zona Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Silvia trabaja en el Ministerio de Medio Ambiente y con el sueldo que gana mantiene su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de insumos (carne de vaca, de pollo, chorizos, tomates, cebollas, etc.) para la preparación y venta de comida rápida para mejorar sus ingresos.
Esta es la séptima  ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Silvia is separated and lives in her own house with one child in the Tembladerani zone of the city of La Paz. She works in the Ministry of the Environment and with the salary she earns is able to maintain her home. Silvia is soliciting a loan to buy supplies (beef, chicken, sausages, tomatoes, onions, etc.) to prepare and sell fast food in order to improve her income. This is the 7th occasion on which she has requested a loan and our socioeconomic analysis finds her to be qualified and grants her access to credit.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING BEEF, CHICKEN, PORK AND OTHER INGREDIANTS FOR PREPARING FAST FOOD

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. MARTHA; ella tiene 55 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 1 hijo, Nuestra socia es de profesión docente, ella enseña en el colegio Cecilia de los Andes en primaria, Nuestra socia estudió en la universidad docencia y le gusta su profesión y está disfrutando mucho enseñar todas las materias de primaria en cuanto a cursos básicos, La socia solicita el préstamo para uso personal ella desea comprar algunas cosas para su casa y para ella, esté dinero lo irá pagando cada mes con su sueldo mensual.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This member belongs to "Renovación" (Renewal) community bank. She lives in San Jerónimo district in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Martha; she is 55 years old, married, and has a son. Martha teaches at Cecilia de los Andes primary school. She studied at the teacher training college and likes her profession. She enjoys teaching basic subjects in primary school. Martha is requesting a personal loan to buy things for her house. She will repay the loan from her monthly salary. Martha is grateful for and values the support provided to her through this loan and is committed to making her repayments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home and personal use.

loans.name: Emiliana

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana vive en casa propia con su esposo en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz; en la puerta de su casa ella vende comida rápida a los chóferes y mecánicos que tienen sus talleres cerca, y  el crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y poder dar comodidad a sus clientes comprando una mesa mas y algunas sillas además de comprar insumos y otros

Es cliente de Impro paga muy bien y puede acceder a un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Emiliana lives in her own house with her husband. They live in the Tembladerani area in the city of La Paz. She sells fast food in the doorway to her house. She sells to drivers and mechanics who have shops nearby. The loan she is requesting is to increase her capital. She wants to be able to make her customers more comfortable by purchasing another table and some chairs. She will also buy some supplies and other things. She is a client of Impro. She pays very well and is able to have a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a table and chairs to make the customers who buy her fast food more comfortable

loans.name: Misael

texts.es:
El señor Misael L.  esta agradecido por su cooperación en el anterior crédito el cual  pudo realizar la mejora a su casa.
Esta solicitando nuevamente otro préstamo para terminar su casa ya que le están haciendo falta el vitropiso, por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que realizara la mejora. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como chofer de una constructora de casas. 
Las personas que aparecen en la foto son la señora Ana Laura Gómez y un de sus hijos ya que el señor Misael se encontraba en su trabajo el día de la visita.
texts.en:
Misael L. is thankful to all those who helped him with his previous loan, which allowed him to make improvements to his home. He is asking for another loan now to finish his house, as the floor still needs to be tiled. At the moment he doesn't have enough money to buy the material and pay someone to install it. Misael plans to repay the loan with the income from his job as a driver for a homebuilder. The people in the photograph are his wife, Ana Laura Gómez, and one of his sons. Misael was at work the day that the photo was taken.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of floor tiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Concrete slab for the patio

loans.name: Geovanny

texts.es: Geovanny U. H., tiene la edad de 31 años, está en unión libre, y vive con la compañera. El crédito lo quiere para hacer reparaciones en su casa. Desea comprar materiales para poder mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda. También terminar algunos trabajos inconclusos en su casa. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Geovanny se dedica a la agricultura, tiene varios años dedicado a la siembra del café. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Geovanny U. H. is 31 years old and lives with his common-law wife. The loan he is requesting will go towards making repairs to his house. He hopes to buy materials to improve their living conditions. He would also like to complete some unfinished work on his house. This is the first time he is taking out a loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services they have offered him. Geovanny works in agriculture and has several years of experience cultivating coffee. In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He would also like to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvements

loans.name: Maikel

texts.es: Maikel Castillo V., tiene la edad de 18 años, está soltero, y vive con sus padres. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de una motocicleta.
