La idea es tener un medio de transporte que le permita movilizarse hacia su trabajo y así poder llegar a tiempo al trabajo y poder lograr tener una estabilidad laboral. El cuenta con la experiencia necesaria para conducir la moto. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Maikel espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona, además de poder alcanzar el logro de sus metas y proyectos.
texts.en:
Maikel Castillo V. is 18 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He is requesting a loan in order to purchase a motorbike. The idea is for him to have a means of transportation for getting to work, and to therefore be able to arrive at his job on time and to achieve employment stability. Maikel has the experience necessary to drive a motorbike. This is the first time that he has taken out a loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the assistance offered to him. Maikel hopes that in the future he will be able to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability. He also hopes to be able to continue growing as a person and to be able to achieve his goals and plans.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Serapia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “RENOVACION”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo pertenece al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Serapia; ella tiene 45 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 2 menores hijos, la socia a estudiado en un instituto superior tecnológico Tupac Amaru la profesión de corte y confección, La socia sueña con tener su propio taller de costura y diseñar ropas para damas, caballeros y niños, Nuestra socia cuenta con una máquina de coser  de segunda mano y por el uso está un poco deteriorada, entonces ella necesita comprar algunos repuestos nuevos para la máquina. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar repuestos para la máquina de segunda mano que tiene la socia.
 
La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our partner is part of the Renovacion community bank and lives in the San Jeronimo district in the department of Cusco. Our partner, Serapia, is 45, married with 2 young children, and has studied dressmaking in the Tupac Amaru Technical Institute. Our partner dreams of having her own sewing shop where she could design clothes for men, women and children. Our partner has a second hand sewing machine that is a bit run down due to use and she needs to buy some replacement parts. Our partner is requesting the loan to purchase these replacement parts. Our partner appreciates and values the support she is receiving and commits herself to repayment within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Our partner requests the loan to purchase replacement parts for her second hand sewing machine

loans.name: Stephanie

texts.es:
La señora Stephanie vive con su esposo e hijo en anticretico, en la zona Cota Cota de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Stephanie es estudiante y hace labores de casa
El crédito solicitado es para seguir estudiando, y de esta manera poder conseguir un trabajo y ayudar a su esposo.
Esta es la segunda ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Stephanie lives with her husband and son in a rented home in the Cota Cota neighborhood of the city of La Paz. She is a student and also does the household work. The loan she requests is for her educational expenses, so that she can get a job and help her husband. This is the second time that she has requested a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis conducted by this institution qualified her to receive a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for the cost of matriculating in the university so that she can finish her education and get a job.

loans.name: Porfirio

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor Porfirio V. le esta haciendo falta el techo pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder realizar la mejora.
Solicita el préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora.
Desea terminar si casa ya que actualmente esta pagando renta, y le están cobrando mucho.
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como mesero de un restaurante.
texts.en:
Porfirio V.'s house needs a roof, but he doesn't have the money needed to finish this part of his home. He is asking for a loan to buy the materials needed and to pay the person who will be in charge of completing the job. He would like to finish construction of the house because he is currently paying quite a bit in rent. He plans to repay the loan with part of the income he earns as a waiter in a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a wooden roof

loans.name: Aydalina

texts.es:
Doña Aydalina es una mujer trabajadora, madre soltera de dos hijos, desde hace varios años se dedica al comercio de venta de nacatamales, pues ha sido su fuente de trabajo, pero hoy en día, ah comenzado a negociar con ropa, cosméticos ya que las venta de nacatamales han desminuido lo que para ella es una crisis ya que depende de sus ventas.

Es por eso decide invertir en cosméticos y ropa  ya que por ser productos bonito y accesibles de precios los vende. Y ah tenido mejores ganancias, su casa es de concreto y aun le falta muchas mejoras como repellar las paredes, embaldosar por que aun es de tierra para una mejor higiene, lo que hará a largo plazo. Ya que con el financiamiento invertirá en la compra de ropa y cosmético para lograr colocar sus productos a sus clientes a si como lograr captar clientes nuevos y poder cubrir sus gastos y alimentar a su familia.
texts.en:
Aydalina is a hardworking single mother who has two children. For a number a years she has had a business selling nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales). This has been her source of work, but currently she is starting another business selling clothing and cosmetics since her sales of nacatamales have decreased. For her, this is a crisis, because she depends on these sales for her livelihood. For this reason she decided to invest in cosmetics and clothing, since these are attractive products that are accessible in price and generate better profits. Her home is made of concrete, and lacks a lot of finishing, such as plaster on the walls and tiles on the floor for better hygiene, as her floors are still made of dirt. She will make these improvements over the longer term. She will use the loan to buy clothing and cosmetics so that she can attract new customers and increase her sales. As a result, she hopes to be able to cover her expenses and feed her family.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and clothing so that she can increase her sales and have a better income

loans.name: Moutala

texts.fr:
Ce jeune homme s’est lancé en 2008 dans le commerce de produits d’alimentation générale, il veut dynamiser son commerce actuellement c’est pour cette raison qu’il sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l’achat de  10 sacs de riz, 20 bidons d’huile, 30 cartons de pâtes alimentaires et divers.
il est célibataire et c’est avec le revenu de son  commerce qu’il subvient à ses propres charges.
texts.en:
This is a man who got started in the commerce of grocery items in 2008.  He wants to revitalize his business at this time.  This is why he is requesting a loan from WAGES for buying 10 sacks of rice, 20 containers of oil, 30 boxes of pasta, and various other goods.  He is unmarried.  With the revenues from his business, he supports himself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying grocery items

loans.name: Deysi

texts.es:
Deysi tiene un salón de belleza ubicado en la zona 12 de octubre de la ciudad de El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con que cubre la manutención de sus dos pequeños de 10 y 1 años. Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la zona de Alto Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El crédito lo destinara para la compra de herramientas de trabajo (secadora electrica, tintes, cepillos, etc.) para poder equipar su salón de peinados y incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con IMPRO, el buen comportamiento de pago permite la aprobación de otro préstamo para Deysi.
texts.en:
Deysi has a hair salon in the 12 de Octubre area of the city of El Alto. It's her main source of income and helps maintain her two children ages 10 and 1. She lives in here parent's home in the Alto Llojeto area of La Paz. Her loan will be used to purchase work related items (hair dryer, dyes, brushes, etc) to outfit her hair salon and so increase her income. This is her second loan with IMPRO and her good payment history allows approval of a second loan for Deysi.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a hair dryer, dyes, brushes and others for her hair salon

loans.name: Silvia

texts.es:
La señora es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos bajo su responsabilidad y quines les quiere dar un buen estudio para que tengan un futuro mejor. 
Solicita un préstamo porque necesita hacer unos pagos en la escuela de sus hijos para que puedan terminar el siclo escolar. 
Planea pagar el crédito con una parte del sueldo que recibe de su trabajo en una fabrica en el área de producción.
texts.en:
Señora Silvia is a single mother and has three children for whom she is responsible. She wishes to provide her children with a good education so that they may have a bright future. For this reason, she requests a loan to help her make payments to her children's school so that they will be able to finish out the school year. She plans to pay back the loan with a portion of the salary she earns from her job at a local factory.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gastos escolares

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Janet M. le esta haciendo falta un cuarto, pero por el momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario. 
Solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que le realizara la construcción. Ya que será la recamara de sus dos pequeños hijas, para que tengan su espacio en la casa. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el sueldo que recibe como guardia de seguridad de un centro comercial.
texts.en:
Janet M.’s house needs a room, but she does not have the necessary money. She is requesting a loan to be able to buy the material and pay for the labor for the construction. It will be a bedroom for her two small daughters. Then they will have their space in the house. She plans on repaying the loan with the salary she gets as a security guard in a commercial center.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand the lower floor

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi D. is single and sells corn at Abura. She travels to buy maize in sacks to returns to sell it to her customers. She has not been to school.

Esi requests the loan she hopes to get to buy additional bags of maize to sell to her increasing number of customers. The income she is able to generate from her sales is used to pay her rent.

Esi hopes to invest in palm oil and selling raw cassava to expand her business. More so, she plans to save to build a house for herself and her future children.

loans.use: To buy additional bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Crisologo

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenece al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es el Sr. Crisologo; él socio tiene 55 años de edad, Nuestro socio es casado y tiene 5 hijos, Nuestro socio es jubilado él trabajo en el ministerio del interior y hoy disfruta de sus nietos y de estar en casa junto a su esposa y viajar los fines de semana fuera de la ciudad, Nuestro socio está dentro de este grupo desde hace 9 años, él disfruta de estar en el grupo a modo de reunirse con sus amigos y pasar unas horas de entretenimiento. El socio solicita el préstamo para uso personal y para mejorar su casa y comprar llantas a su carro. 

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Renovación Communal Bank. Our member lives in the San Jerónimo province in the Cusco department. Our member is Crisologo. He is 55, married, and has five children. Our member is retired from working in the Ministry of the Interior. Now he enjoys his grandchildren, being at home with his wife, and traveling outside of the city on the weekend. Our member has been in this group for nine years. He enjoys being in the group as a way to get together with his friends and spend a few entertaining hours. He is requesting a loan for personal use, to improve his house, and to buy tires for his car. He is grateful for and values the support given through this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For personal use, to improve his house, and to buy tires for his car

loans.name: Betzabet

texts.es: Betzabet tiene 33 años, vive con sus 3 hijos en casa de su madre. Luego que se separara de su  esposo, decidió emprender un negocio de venta de comida, es así que prepara sus platillos en casa de sus padres, en donde su mamá la ayuda en este trabajo. Sus compradores son los obreros, que trabajan en una obra de alcantarillado cerca a su domicilio, por el momento le va muy bien, pero también es conciente de que sus comensales son ocasionales. Se siente muy a gusto con el negocio que emprendió; ya que además no descuida su bebe de 6 meses. Lleva 4 meses con esta actividad y lo más difícil para ella; es que no cuenta con un lugar apropiado donde continúe su negocio. Su mayor anhelo, es  formalizar su negocio y de ese modo  continuar trabajando para el bienestar de sus hijos. Este es su primer crédito con MFP y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas, ya que este dinero  le servirá para instalar su negocio, asimismo se siente en la responsabilidad de apoyar en las actividades que realicen las integrantes de su grupo. Con este crédito que solicita, piensa comprarse una cocina ó un carro sanguchero, dependiendo de la ubicación o lugar que encuentre.
texts.en:
Betzabet, age 33, lives with her three children in her mother’s house. After separating from her husband she decided to begin a business selling food. She prepares the dishes in her parents’ house, and her mother helps her with this work. Her buyers are workers who work on the sewage system close to her house. For the moment things are going very well for her. She is aware that her diners are on-and-off. She is very happy with the business that she started because she can also take care of her six month old baby. She has been doing this for four months. The most difficult part for her is that she does not have an appropriate place to continue her business. Her greatest goal is to formalize her business. She wants to do this so that she can continue working for the well-being of her children. This is her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments on time. The money from the loan is to set up her business. Also, she feels responsible for supporting the activities that the other members of the group do. She plans to use the loan she is requesting to buy a stove or a sandwich cart. It depends on the place that she finds.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a stove or a sandwich cart

loans.name: Restauración Group

texts.es: El Señor Juan Bonifacio I. C. es el coordinador de este grupo y se dedica a actividades de agricultura con lo que ha logrado sostener a su familia, desde hace más de 20 años.   Los integrantes de este grupo denominado “Restauración” está conformado por 5 personas que buscan mejorar sus condiciones de vida, se dedican a diferentes actividades como lo son la crianza de animales, venta de ropa, venta de medicinas y artículos de consumo diario. Los cuales pertenecen a una misma familia. Actualmente son una familia grande y buscan mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por lo que han decidido formar un grupo, para solicitar un préstamo, que les servirá para mejorar sus viviendas, ya que últimamente el clima  a estado cambiando, y ellos quieren estar  preparados para el futuro, en lo que pueda acontecer  y reducir el riesgo en cuanto a sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Juan Bonifacio I. C. is this group's coordinator and works as a farmer, which has allowed him to maintain his family for the past 20 years. The members of this group known as Restauracion, are all family members who are looking to better their situation. They make a living through a variety of activities including, raising livestock, clothing sales, as well as selling medicine and everyday needs items. They are part of a large family that formed a group to request a loan for improvements on their homes. Since the climate has been changing lately, they want to be prepared for the future and reduce the risk to their current situation.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home Improvements

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestra socia nació en la provincia de la Convención Quillabamba y vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Consuelo;  ella tiene 54 años de edad, la socia es soltera, Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de café snack, Nuestra socia tiene una pequeña cafetería snack en la universidad de bellas artes, situado a dos cuadras de la plaza principal de armas en la ciudad del Cusco. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos, insumos  y mercadería para su negocio. Ella vende sándwich de queso, jamón, carne, pollo, huevo, salchichas, empanadas, salteñas, leche, café, jugos y confites. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “RENOVACIÓN” ("Renewal") communal bank. She was born in the province of Convención Quillabamba, and she lives in the San Jerónimo district of the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Consuelo, and she is 54 years old and single. Her business is selling café-type snacks. She operates a small cafeteria at the University of Fine Arts, which is located two blocks from the main plaza of the city of Cusco. She is requesting the loan to buy products, supplies and merchandise for her business. She sells ham and cheese sandwiches, meat, chicken, eggs, sausages, empanadas, salteñas [another type of empanada], milk, coffee, juices and sweets. Consuelo values and appreciates the support provided to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies for her café

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Akosua is a lovely and hard-working woman. She is divorced but takes responsibility for her four children from age 6-12 years. She is now forty years old. Akosua lives together with her children in a family house at Dormaa, where she also does her trading. She is able to provide support to her family’s financial needs through the sale of 'kenkey'. 

'Kenkey' is one of the Ghanaians' favorite local dishes that is rich in carbohydrate. It is prepared with corn dough made into balls, cooked between 1-2 hours and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. It could also be enjoyed with other sauces. 'Kenkey' is known throughout all the tribes in Ghana and commonly sold on most streets.  Selling it for the past 15 years, Akosua has made quite a number of repeat customers through good customer relations. She plans to invest the loan to purchase bags of maize and cartons of fish to support her business. She dreams that one day she will be able to open a restaurant in her community.

Akosua is currently the leader of a trust bank group called 'Trust' made up of 12 members. The other members are also engaged in trades such as the sale of groceries, dried fish, food selling, plantain selling, traditional medicine, etc. Akosua hopes to support her kids so they can acquire a good education.

loans.use: To purchase bags of maize and cartons of fish

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Yolanda; ella tiene 44 años de edad, la socia es separada y tiene 3 hijos, los tres son estudiantes, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia se dedica a la realización y fabricación de sellos didácticos para colegios, jardines y otros;   Nuestra socia trae parte de la mercadería desde la ciudad de Lima, ella viaja cada mes a traer novedades y venderlos en su tienda en manzana pata, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para viajar y comprar mercadería en la ciudad de Lima, ella aprovecha que hay campañas escolares aún en la ciudad de Lima.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “RENOVACIÓN” ("Renewal") communal bank. She lives in the district of San Jerónimo, in the province and department of Cusco. Her name is Yolanda, and she is 44 years old. She is separated and has 3 children who are all students. Yolanda divides her time between her household activities and her retail business. Her work is creating and selling educational stamps for schools, day care centers, etc. She brings some of her merchandise from the city of Lima; she travels each month to look for new products to sell in her store in the village of Manzana Pata. She is requesting the loan in order to travel and buy merchandise in the city of Lima; she wants to take advantage of the fact that there are still special offers on school supplies in Lima. Yolanda values and appreciates the support provided to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Traveling to Lima and buying merchandise

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mateo Pumacahua se reúne en la ciudad de Chicheros del departamento del Cusco,  esta ciudad es más conocida por las ruinas Incas que tiene, cuenta la historia que en tiempos pasados cuando aun no era ciudad en lo que ahora son sus calles había la casa del Inca “Túpac Inca Yupanqui”.  Es también muy interesante esta población no sólo por ruinas y el templo, sin por los trajes y costumbres; además de su colorida y concurrida feria dominical. 

Al visitar este banco conversamos con el socio Bernando, es soltero y vive en Chinchero, él se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos  como mantas, fajas y chullos y vende a los turistas que visitan la ciudad, invierte 1000 dólares en los materiales como por ejemplo lana de oveja y lana de alpaca y tintes naturales como la cochinilla, cucamarca, etc. Ya son 8 años que lleva este oficio y le va muy bien, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito surtirá su negocio y va comprar más materiales. El anhelo del socio es viajar al extranjero pues ahí desea vender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Mateo Pumacahua Communal Bank meet in the city of Chinchero in the Cusco department. This city is more known for the Inca ruins that it has, telling the story that in times passed when there was still no city where there are now streets, there used to be the house of the Inca “Túpac Inca Yupanqui”. This population is also very interesting not only for the ruins and the temple, but for the costumes and customs; in addition to its colorful and crowded Sunday fair. On visiting this bank we talk with the member Bernardo. He is single and lives in Chinchero, where he makes knitwear like blankets, belts and chullos (Peruvian hat) and sells these to the tourists that visit the city. He is investing 1000 dollars in materials such as sheep and alpaca wool and natural dyes like conchineal, cucamarca, etc. He has done this for 8 years and it is going well. Being a member of the Foundation has really helped him to better himself and make his business grow. With this new loan he will stock his business and is going to buy more materials. The member's wish is to travel abroad and then he wants to sell his products there.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more materials such as sheep and alpaca wool and natural dyes like cochineal, cucamarca, etc.

loans.name: Mo Mary Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Margaret is forty-one years old. She is married to a farmer and together they have five children from age 11-25 years. Margaret is a hard-working trader. She sells smoked fish. Fish is widely used in cooking as one the most common sources of protein. It is mostly used in preparation of soup and sauces. Fresh fish is partially roasted on a fire to obtain smoked fish which is more flavorful. She plans to use the loan to purchase cartons of fresh fish from wholesalers in bulk to scale up her business. She has been in business for twelve years and hopes to expand her business to meet customers’ demands. She also aspires to see her children reach higher levels in education. 

Margaret is the leader of a trust bank group called “Mo Mary” (which means 'well done Mary'). There are four members in this group. The group adopts a co-guarantee system to obtain the loan and uses peer pressure and assistance to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To purchase cartons of smoked fish in bulk

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama A. lives with her husband, a farmer. She has been through junior high school.

Ama prepares rice porridge at Abura for sale. She requires the loan to buy sacks of rice to use for her porridge. She normally buys in small quantities, which is expensive some times. Also, she wants to build a better table whereby flies will be prevented from coming close to her food.

Ama intends to use the new profits which she expects from her expanded business to invest in other types of business.

loans.use: To buy sacks of rice to use for her porriadge

loans.name: Sisters Trust Bank Group

texts.en:
Mary is a humble young lady. She is married to a farmer with four children. She is now thirty-three years old. She loves selling cereals like maize, a business through which she makes a living for her family. Mary has sold maize for the past two years. She plans to invest the loan to purchase maize in bulk to meet the demand. Mary dreams that one day she will be able to expand her business to meet her customers growing demands. She always wishes for happiness and good health for her family.

Mary is currently the leader of a trust bank group called 'Sisters' made up of eight members. Members of the group provide assistance to one another in times of difficulty to settle their repayments.

loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk

loans.name: Zeburiatu

texts.en: Zeburiatu Y. buys fresh fish from the fishermen at sea to fry for sell at Abura. She is a married woman who has not received any form of education. Her husband is a carpenter. Zeburiatu uses her income to help  her husband take care of the family. She will use this loan to buy more fresh fish to fry for sale. Zeburiatu plans to invest the new profits from her expanded business into her business.

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish to fry for sale

loans.name: Yngrid

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Ingrid; ella tiene 43 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 3 hijos, Nuestra socia se dedica a la artesanía junto con su mamá La socia aprendió el oficio de su madre, y la mamá compro un stand en un conocido centro artesanal, Nuestra socia que siempre ayudó a su madre terminó por administrar el stand y hoy en día la socia compra mercadería de los mismos artesanos para venderlos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
NOur member Sra. Ingrid belongs to the RENOVACIÓN (Renewal) Community Bank. She lives in San Jerónimo district, in the province and department of Cusco. Ingrid is 43 years old, married, and has three children. She and her mother work as artisans. Ingrid learned her trade from her mother who bought a market stall in an area well-known for its artisans. Ingrid started out by helping her mother, then ran the stall, and now she buys merchandise from other artisans to sell. She is asking for a loan to buy more crafts. Ingrid is grateful for the valuable support provided to her through this loan. She promises to pay back what she owes according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more crafts

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
Doña Mirtha es una mujer muy trabajadora de 48 años de edad, casada y con un hijo que apoya aun con sus estudios. Se dedica a su negocio una pulpería que logro poner hace varios años, con ahorros de trabajo que trajo, ya que tuvo que irse a trabajar a Costa Rica, por que su situación económica estaba pésima.
Ahora se siente  estable por que tiene su propio negocio, que junto con su esposo trabajan en el despacho de la pulpería para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, y a la vez se hace el aseo y alimentos en su hogar.

Con este financiamiento comprara un exhibidor para lograr comprar mas productos de pollo, carne, embutido ya que los que tiene son de la coca cola, y no le permiten tener productos que no sean de los que ellos distribuyen. Por eso la importancia para lograr aumentar las ventas ya que son productos de consumo diario.
texts.en:
48-year old Sra. Mirtha is a hardworking woman. She is married and has a son whom she still supports as he is a student. Mirtha runs a small general store which she started several years ago with savings brought back from Costa Rico where she had had to go to find work as the economic situation at home was very bad. Now she feels more stable as she has her own business. She and her husband work in the office of the store to provide a better service to their customers. In addition Mirtha does the housework and cooking at home. With this loan she will buy a refrigerated display case so she can buy more chicken products, meat, and cold cuts. At the moment she only has Coca Cola fridges, and the company will only allow her to use them for their own products. Therefore it is important that she has a new refrigerated area so she can increase sales of these everyday products.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy a refrigerated display case for meats etc.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi T. is married to a fridge mechanic by profession. Esi sells both Fante kenkey and Accra kenkey (Ga). Esi has been in the kenkey business for about a year now. Esi will add the loan she is hoping to receive to her original capital to buy bags of maize to prepare kenkey for sale. In great anticipation, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize to prepare kenkey

loans.name: Gloria Epifania

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Epifania;  ella tiene 65 años de edad, la socia es viuda y tiene 6 hijos, todos independientes.  Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la artesanía, Nuestra socia tiene un taller y tienda en la plaza de San Blas, barrio típico de artesanos en dónde nuestra socia tiene su tienda para la exposición de su arte, la socia también se dedica mientras atiende su tienda a tejer en palitos chompas de lana, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member Sra. Epifania belongs to the RENOVACIÓN (Renewal) Community Bank. She lives in San Jerónimo district, in the province and department of Cusco. Epifania is 65 years old and a widow. She has six children, all of whom have left home. She spends part of her time doing household chores and the other part making crafts. She has a workshop and store in the San Blas plaza where a lot of artisans work. Epifania knits her wool sweaters whilst she looks after the store. The loan is so she can buy more merchandise. Epifania is grateful for the valuable support provided to her through this loan. She promises to pay back what she owes according to the schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise

loans.name: Gaviotas De Chuixac Group

texts.es:
Doña Miriam Yaneth Jiménez Rodriguez, es una persona que ha superado vendiendo alimentos todos los días en la plazuela, por lo tanto ella se dio cuenta que, vendiendo alimentos a podido mantener a su familia y cubrir sus gastos D. su hogar, por tal razón ella tomo la idea D. formar un grupo D. señoras, para que ellas puedan superar también este grupo está conformado por dieciocho integrantes,  mujeres que se dedican en diferentes funciones como crianza D. animales, venta D. ropa, venta D. artículos D. consumo diario. 

Las integrantes del Banco Comunal, “Gaviotas D. Chuixac”, residen en el Paraje Chuixac Barrio Santa Ana, Momostenango, están conformados por mujeres, todas se conocen bien desD. hace más D. doce años, decidieron solicitar un crédito en ASDIR para poder mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y la D. su familia ya que estas personas son D. escasos recursos y es D. gran ayuda para ellas ampliar su capital D. negocio y mejoras sus ventas como también sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Mrs Miriam Yaneth Jiménez Rodriguez earns her living by selling food every day on the square. She realised that by selling food she was able to support her family and cover her household expenses, so she set up a group for mutual support. The group has eighteen members, all of them women, whose different activities incluD. livestock rearing, sale of clothing and sale of consumer goods. The members of the “Gaviotas D. Chuixac” group loan live in Paraje Chuixac Barrio Santa Ana, Momostenango. The women, who have known each other for over twelve years, request a loan through ASDIR to improve their living conditions and those of their families. They are low-income individuals and the loan will enable them to expand their business capitals, increase sales and improve their incomes.

Translated from Spanish by Alba Sort , Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con el socio Adolfo, tiene 24 años,  es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco y estudia guía de turismo en el instituto superior Americana del Cusco, él se dedica a la elaboración en el taller “Niway Away” y a la venta de tejidos  como mantas, fajas y chullos y vende a los turistas que visitan la ciudad, invierte 500 de dólares en la mercadería que compra  materiales de lana de alpaca y maquinas de tejer. Ya son dos años que lleva este oficio, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito surtirá su negocio y va comprar más mercadería. El anhelo del  socio es tener su propio taller de artesanía.
texts.en:
When we visited the Mateo Pumacahua Communal Bank, we spoke with a member named Adolfo. He is 24 years old, single, and lives in the city of Chinchero in the department of Cusco. He is studying to become a tour guide at the Instituto Superior Americana del Cusco, and he works making and selling woven goods such as shawls, belts, and chullos [typical Andean wool caps]. He makes these at a craft studio called “Niway Away” and sells them to tourists who visit the city. Adolfo is investing 500 dollars in the materials he uses, such as alpaca wool and looms. He's been doing this work for two years, and working with the Kiva field partner has allowed him to get ahead and helped his business grow. With the new loan he will expand to sell more items and will buy more materials to work with. It is his hope to one day have his own studio in which to make his crafts.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials such as alpaca wool and looms

loans.name: Lila

texts.es: Lila tiene 52 años, es una emprendedora mujer que trabaja incansablemente para cumplir sus sueños, ella es soltera y vive con su hermana en casa de ella. El trabajo al que se dedica, es la venta de productos de belleza, desde hace 4 años, al igual que su hermana. Su forma de trabajo consiste en adquirir los productos de una reconocida marca de cosméticos y ofrecerlos mediante de catálogos a sus amigas y vecinas quienes prefieren los productos por ser de buena calidad y a un bajo precio. Parte de la ventaja que tiene, es que conoce los productos que tiene, y sugiere a sus clientes que cosmético debe escoger, es así que se ha ganado el cariño de sus clientes. En un futuro quiere mejorar su negocio comprando mayor cantidad de productos de belleza y así aumentar sus ingresos. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP siendo muy responsable y puntual con los pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de cosméticos para las próximas festividades por el día del padre.
texts.en:
Lila, 52, is an enterprising woman who works tirelessly to accomplish her dreams. She is single and lives with her sister in her sister's home. For 4 years she has been selling beauty products, like her sister. The way she works is that she acquires the products from a well-known cosmetics company and offers them through catalogs to her friends and neighbors. They prefer these products because of their good quality and low price. Part of the advantage she has is that she knows the products well, and can suggest to the customers which cosmetics they should choose, and in this way she earns her customer's loyalty. In the future she wants to improve her business, buying a larger quantity of beauty products and increasing her income. This is her 10th loan with MFP, and she has been very responsible and punctual with her payments. With the loan she requests, she will buy a greater quantity of cosmetics for the upcoming festivities of Father's Day.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en: Mariama S. cooks banku (locally called etew) and serves it with okro sauce and pepper sauce with fish at Abura. Mariama has received a junior high education. She is a widow and has six dependants.  She is responsible for the general welfare of her dependants. Her loan will be used to buy more corn to prepare banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to complete a kitchen she has started building.

loans.use: To buy more corn to prepare banku for sale.

loans.name: Habiba

texts.en: Habiba J. is married and has six dependants. She has received a senior high education. Habiba cooks banku at Abura for sale. Her husband is a trader. Habiba uses her income to help her husband take care of the home. Habiba will use the loan to purchase more corn to prepare banku for sale. With the new revenues from her expanded business, Habiba plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: To purchase more corn to prepare banku for sale.

loans.name: Margaret Carmen

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Margaret;  ella tiene 45 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 4 hijos independientes, el mayo r esta en la universidad, el segundo en un instituto, el tercero preparándose en la academia para la universidad y el último en sus últimos años de colegio. La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista ella vende escabeches en el mercado de San Pedro, el escabeche es un plato frío típico de la costa, a base de pollo y cebollas, con zanahorias y un condimento especial. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para pagar los estudios de sus hijos (educación).

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our member belongs to the Renovación Communal Bank. Our member lives in the San Jerónimo district in the Cusco province and department. Our member is Margaret. She is 45, married, and has four independent children. The oldest is in the university, the second one is studying in an institution, the third is academically preparing for the university, and the last one is in the last years of high school. Our member alternates her activities between the household and her small business. She sells “escabeche” at the San Pedro market. Escabeche is a fried dish that is typical on the coast. Its base is chicken and onions, and it has carrots and special seasoning. Our member is requesting a loan to pay for her children’s education. She is grateful for and values the support offered by this means and pledges to repay in a timely fashion. .

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for her children's education

loans.name: Yaa Maame

texts.en: Yaa Maame A. sells panties, underwear and bananas at Abura.  Yaa Maame is divorced and has two children. Yaa Maame has been selling panties, underwear and bananas for some time now. She is responsible for the welfare of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more panties and clothes, which will serve as additional goods for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: To buy more panties and clothes

loans.name: Rigia

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con la socia Regia, tiene 30 años,  es casada, tiene dos hijos (Fernando de años 09 y Lía Regina de un año y medio) y ellos viven en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco. Regia se dedica a la elaboración de artesanía en el centro de textil tradicional chicheros, ella va a este centro de trabajo tres veces a la semana desde las 8 de la mañana a hasta las 4:30 de la tarde. Ya son siete años que lleva este oficio, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito surtirá su negocio y va comprar más materiales como por ejemplo de lana alpaca y artesanía de tipo de muñequería. El anhelo del  socio es producir más mantas.
texts.en:
When we visited the Mateo Pumacahua Communal Bank, we spoke with a member named Rigia. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children (Fernando, who is 9, and Lía Regina, who is 18 months). They live in the city of Chinchero in the department of Cusco. Rigia works making traditional crafts in the Chicheros center for traditional textiles. She works there three days a week from 8 in the morning until 4:30 in the afternoon. She was been working at this job for 7 years, and working with the Kiva field partner has allowed her to get ahead and helped her business grow. With the new loan she will expand to sell more items and will buy more materials, such as alpaca wool and materials to make dolls. She hopes to be able to produce more shawls to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of items such as alpaca wool and dollmaking materials

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married to a ward assistant and has four children. She has been through junior high school.  Ekua sells provisions and soft drinks at Abura. Ekua uses the returns she gets from her business to help her husband take care of the home. Ekua will use the loan to purchase additional provisions to fill her shop. With the new income from her extended business, Ekua plans to build another shop in a different area.

loans.use: To purchase additional provisions for her shop

loans.name: Las Canasteras Group

texts.es:
Doña Loida Isabel Z. C. D. treinta nueve años D. edad, es una persona que ha superado criando animales tales como, gallinas ponedoras, cerdos, con este trabajo que ella realiza a podido mantener a su familia y cubrir sus gastos D. su hogar, por tal razón ella tomo la idea D. formar un grupo D. señoras, para que ellas puedan también superar este grupo está conformado por doce integrantes,  mujeres que se dedican en diferentes funciones como crianza D. animales, venta D. ropa, venta D. artículos D. consumo diario, elaboración D. canastas. Las integrantes del Banco Comunal “Las Canasteras”, del Paraje Chocaman Barrio Santa Isabel, Momostenango, están conformados por MUJERES todas se conocen bien desD. hace más D. doce años, el cual

Han decidido solicitar un crédito en ASDIR para poder mejorar sus condiciones D. vida y la D. su familia, ya que estas personas son D. escasos recursos y es D. gran ayuda para ellas ampliar su capital D. trabajo, mejorar sus ventas como también sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Loida Isabel Z. C. is thirty-nine years old. She is a person who has gotten ahead in life by raising animals, including pigs and laying hens. By doing this work, she has been able to support her family and cover her household expenses. For this reason, she had the idea to form a group of women so that the others can also make progress. The group has twelve members, all of them women, who work in different fields such as raising animals, selling clothing, selling staple goods, and making baskets. The members of the "Las Canasteras” communal bank of Chocaman, in the Santa Isabel area of Momostenango, are women who have known each other well for more than twelve years. They have decided to request a loan from ASDIR so that they can improve their living conditions and those of their families. The members are people with few economic resources, and it is a great help to them to expand their working capital, so that they can increase their sales and their income levels.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jamilatu

texts.en:
Jamilatu H. has a limited stock of goods in her shop at Abura and therefore she requires a loan to add to her capital to buy more and other goods for her shop.

Jamilatu has no educational background. Her husband is into farming and they have four children. With the sales she makes from her business she is able to support her husband in providing the basic needs of the family.

Jamilatu’s loan will be used to buy more provisions for her shop. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for her shop

loans.name: Florindo

texts.es: Florindo V. G., tiene la edad de 74 años, está casado y vive con su esposa y un hijo de 55 años.  El crédito lo quiere para la compra de materiales y productos para la mejoras en el área de repastos. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento  a la cercas y en poder mantener  calidad en los repastos, para que el ganado que tiene se desarrolle de la mejor manera y así obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área que desea mejorar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Florindo tiene algunos años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor
texts.en:
Florindo V. G. is 74 years old, married, and lives with his wife and a 55 year-old son. He is requesting this loan to buy materials and products to make improvements to his pastures. He would like to perform proper maintenance on the fences and to be able to maintain high-quality pastures, so that his cattle will develop as well as possible and therefore fetch the best price when he sells them. Florindo would also like to increase his number of animals and to be able to keep them in better conditions, including making improvements to a specific area. This is the first time that Florindo is taking out a loan from FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the opportunity they are providing him. Florindo has been raising cattle for several years. In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to be able to continue growing as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to make improvements to cattle pastures

loans.name: Carolina

texts.es: Carolina, tiene 24 años y vive con su pareja Iván de 25 años, con quien tiene 3 pequeños e inquietos hijos, quienes son su adoración, y por quienes se desvive  a diario para que no les falte nada, juntos viven en su casa propia. Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la agricultura desde hace 2 años, pues plantan café sobre terrenos que poseen y como todo buen productor de café, enseña a sus hijos las técnicas agrícolas, pero sin que ellos descuiden los estudios. Para carolina es fundamental estudien ya que anhela que ellos tengan una profesión. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la chacra, por la tranquilidad que le transmite y la manera de ver crecer sus frutos. Luego de un adecuado cuidado a sus plantaciones, la compensación se ve al momento de comercializar café, resultándole rentable el negocio. En  adelante, desea ampliar sus hectáreas de terrenos y producir mayor cantidad de este grano, asimismo quiere mejorar la construcción de su vivienda para darles una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y siente que progresa de la mano con la entidad de su confianza y los integrantes de su grupo comunal, con quienes le agrada laborar.Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de fertilizante, también quiere pagar a los operarios que contratará para que limpien sus cultivos y recolecten el café.
texts.en:
Carolina, age 24, lives with her 25 year old life partner, Iván. They have three small and active children, whom they adore. They struggle daily so that their children have what they need. They live together in her own house. She and her husband have devoted themselves to agriculture for two years. They plant coffee on their land. Like all good coffee producers, they teach their children farming techniques. They do this without neglecting their studies. To Carolina education is fundamental. She yearns for her children to have a profession. What she likes most about her work is the farm. She likes the tranquility it gives her and seeing the way the fruit grows. After taking good care of her crops, the compensation is seen when the coffee is sold. This business is very profitable for her. Later she wants to expand the number of hectares of land that she has and produce a greater quantity of this grain. She also wants to improve the construction of her house in order to give her family an adequate quality of life. This is her second loan with MFP. She feels that she is progressing thanks to the trust of the institution has given her and the members of her communal bank. She is pleased to be working with them. She will use the loan she has requested to buy various sacks of fertilizers. She also wants to pay the laborers she will hire to clear her plantings and collect the coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer and pay laborers to clear and plant

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es: Yamileth P. G., tiene la edad de 31 años, está casada, y  tiene 2  hijos, uno de 14 y otro de 5 años. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contenta con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Doña Yamileth tiene algunos años dedicada al ganado. Ella espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productora.
texts.en:
Yamileth P. G. is 31 years old, married, with 2 children: one 14-year-old and one 5-year-old. She is asking for a loan in order to buy some calves and feed. She wants to fully provide for the cattle so she can get the best return possible when they are sold. She also wants to increase the number of animals she has and be able to keep them in better conditions, including suitable land for keeping and raising the cattle. This is the first time she has sought a loan from FUDECOSUR, and is very happy with the help she has been given. Mrs. G. has several years experience with cattle. She hopes the future will include a better quality of life and economic stability to her family, and to be able to keep growing as a person and as a farmer.

Translated from Spanish by Zach Powell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cattle

loans.name: Jhonny Richard

texts.es:
El joven Jhonny tiene la edad de 32 años, padre de familia de dos hijos,
Para el no ha sido fácil poder construir su casa toda de concreto, ya que solo el arranque es de piedra, y luego de zinc ya que es de  pocos recursos económico,  su esposa trabaja como cocinera para poder ayudar a pagar los gastos básicos de agua, luz. El trabaja como guarda de seguridad,  y auque su salario es bajo, pero es fijo lo que le permite dar la alimentación a sus hijos.
Su anhelo es lograr una casa segura y digna para sus hijos que espera a través de estos financiamientos mejorar ya que es el medio viable, para poder avanzar en la infraestructura.
Este préstamo será destinado para el cambio de su techo, ya que por ser muy viejo se le pasa el agua, lo que le preocupa por la salud de sus hijos. Para esta obra comprara zinc, madera, clavos entre otros para hacer el cambio.
texts.en:
The young Jhonny is 32 years old and is the father of a family with two children. It has not been easy for him to build his house completely of concrete; only the first part is made of stone, and then it is zinc, since he has few economic resources. His wife works as a cook to help pay the basic expenses of water and light. He works as a security guard, and although his salary is low, it is regular, which allows him to feed his children. His goal is to have a safe and worthy house for his children. He hopes to improve his house through this financing, since it is a viable way to make progress on the infrastructure. This loan will be used to change the roof, since it is very old and it leaks, and this causes him to worry about the health of his children. For this work, he will buy zinc, wood, and nails, among other items, to make the change.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy zinc, wood, nails, and other materials to change the roof and provide better comfort for his family

loans.name: Norma Doris

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Norma;  ella tiene 44 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 1 hijo de 12 años de edad, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el turismo, Nuestra socia es de profesión guía de turismo, la socia con todos sus ahorros a puesto una casa hospedaje, La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar su casa hospedaje.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our community bank member belongs to the community bank "Renovacion." She lives in the San Jeronimo district in the province and department of Cusco. She is Sra. Norma. She is 44 years old, is married, and has a son who is 12 years old. She alternates her household activities with tourism. By profession, she is a tourist guide. She used all her savings to set up a guesthouse. She is applying for this loan so that she can put it into operation. This community bank member appreciates and values the support offered through the loans and promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Open a guest house

loans.name: Isaias

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con el socio Isaías, tiene 27 años,  es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco, él se dedica a brindar servicios de taxi en la misma ciudad  o cubre la ruta de Chinchero a Cusco ó viceversa. Ya son ocho años que brinda  este servicio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito él quiere hacer mantenimientos de su carro. El anhelo del  socio es abrir una empresa de transportes.
texts.en:
The staff of Asociación Arariwa visited with the Mateo Pumacahua Communal Bank and spoke with Isaías, a member who is 27 years old. He is single and lives in the city of Chinchero, in the department of Cusco. He provides taxi service within his city or covers the route from Chinchero to Cusco and vice versa. He has been offering this service for eight years already and it's going very well thanks to the effort he puts into his work. Being a member of the organization has really helped him to get ahead and to grow his business. With this new loan, he wants to do maintenance on his car. It is his hope to one day open a transport company.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Car maintenance

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: Luis  Angel  N. S., tiene la edad de 34 años, está soltero, y  tiene 3  hijos, uno de 10 y unos gemelos de 8 años de edad. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunos terneros y su alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área idónea para el mantenimiento y cría del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Luis tiene algunos años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Luis Angel N. S., 34, is single and has three children. He has a ten year-old son and eight year-old twins. He would like to use this loan to purchase some calves and to feed them. He wants to take good care of his cattle in order to make the greatest possible profit when he sells them. He would also like to increase his number of animals and to be able to raise them under better conditions. He has a suitable area for raising and breeding cattle. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and he is very happy with the services offered. Luis has been raising cattle for several years. He hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and greater economic stability in the future, and to continue to grow as a person and as a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Dionisio

texts.es: Dionisio C. G., tiene la edad de 60 años, está casado, y vive con su esposa. El crédito lo quiere para asistir su finca, específicamente para el cultivo de café, la idea es comprar el abono y el fertilizante. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo de café para lograr una mejor calidad y para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando sea tiempo de cosecha. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Dionisio también trabaja desde hace muchos años en la agricultura. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.
texts.en:
Dionisio is 60 years old, married and lives with his wife. The loan he is requesting will be used for his farm, specifically for raising coffee crop. He plans to purchase compost and fertilizer. Dionisio wishes to adequately maintain his coffee crop in order to achieve a better quality and to obtain the highest possible price when it is time to harvest. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR and is very happy with the services that have been provided to him. Don Dionisio has worked as a farmer for many years. Looking forward, he hopes to be able to provide his family a better quality of life and greater financial stability. He also hopes to continue to grow as a person and a producer.

Translated from Spanish by Tyson Shelley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Assistance for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Juan Bautista Group

texts.es: El grupo  “Juan Bautista” esta representado por el señor Daniel Ángel y conformado por 13 miembros, 3 varones y 10 mujeres, todos son muy alegres y unidos, este grupo va cursando un ciclo mas con la institución demostrando responsabilidad y honestidad en sus pagos. El señor Daniel Ángel es padre de familia de tres niños, es casada y su esposa se dedica a la venta de fruta, el se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado el se esfuerza mucho para poder tener darles un techo propio a sus hijos, en este momento el se encuentra viviendo en anticrítico; Daniel Ángel solicita el crédito para capital de trabajo para poder comprar mas ganado y venderlo a un mayor precio. Entre las actividades que realizan el resto de las socias están la venta de abarrote, venta de pan, venta de frutas, promotoras de cosméticos, venta de coca, los varones  actividad del trasporte, A.ñil y distintas actividades que realizan para poder progresar y  darles a sus hijos un mejor futuro. La  competencia  de sus negocios es alta por eso las socias trabajan duro y requiere un esfuerzo y un sacrificio para poder llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar, además tienen que competir con negocios grandes, fuertes ya establecidos en áreas mas comerciales como ser restaurantes, panaderas,  pero eso no es motivo para que ellos se desanimen, sino mas a lo contrario la competencia  les obliga a trabajar para crecer económicamente. El crédito será utilizado para incrementar su mercadería, la compra de insumos y herramientas para mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos para darles a sus familias una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Daniel Ángel represents the Juan Bautista group. It is comprised of 13 members, 3 men and 10 women. They are all very happy and united. This group is in one more cycle with the institution. They are demonstrating responsibility and honesty with their payments. Daniel Ángel is married and has three children. His wife sells fruit. He buys and sells livestock. He works very hard in order to be able give his children their own roof over their heads. At this time he is living in “anticrédito” (a special type of rental arrangement in Bolivia). Daniel Ángel is requesting a loan for working capital to be able to buy more livestock, which he will sell for a greater price. The activities that the rest of the women in the group do are selling groceries, selling bread, selling fruit, selling cosmetics, and selling coca. The men work in transportation, as bricklayers, and other different activities. They do these to be able to progress and give their children a better future. Competition in their businesses is high. But, the members work hard, and it requires effort and sacrifice to be able to bring home the daily bread. Also, they need to compete with large business, which are strong and already established in more commercial areas. They compete with businesses like restaurants and bakeries. But, this is not a reason for them to be discouraged. It is just the opposite. The competition makes them work to grow economically. The loan will be used to increase merchandise and to buy supplies and tools. These are to improve their sales and increase their incomes in order to give their families a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Jazmines Uno Group

texts.es: El grupo “Jazmines Uno” esta representado por la señora Constanza y conformada por 12 miembros, 2 varones y 10 mujeres, todos muy trabajadores y emprendedores en su quinto ciclo con la institución han demostrado responsabilidad, honestidad y muchas gas D. salir adelante con sus negocios para poder darles a sus hijos un mejor futuro con una educación adecuada y una buena alimentación. La señora Constanza es madre D. una niña y es casada, ella vive en una casa en alquiler y se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes en el mercado, ella es muy trabajadora y lo que mas desea es poder sacar adelante a su hija para que algún día pueda tener un casa propia, ella requiere el préstamo para poder adquirir mas mercadería y poder agrandar su tienda, el anterior financiamiento le sirvió para poder agrandar su tienda y refaccionar su caseta. Entre las actividades que realizan las otras socias esta la venta D. comida en su propio domicilio, uno D. los clientes trabaja como moto taxista y otro tiene su propia vagoneta y trabaja D. trufi, una D. las socias venD. ropa, la otra tiene su venta D. abarrotes y otra es modista. La competencia en el mercado es alta pero las socias ya cuentan con experiencia para poder afrontarla y también saben diversificar sus productos para no perder clientela por causa D. la competencia. El crédito será destinado a la iniciativa D. poder ampliar un poco mas sus negocios con la compra D. mercadería, insumos, compra D. repuesto y la retapizada D. sus vehículos para dar una mejor imagen a sus clientes. La mayoría D. las socias ya están por su 5to y 6to ciclo y están muy conformes con el apoyo económico que se les brinda para que puedan crecer en sus negocios y mejorar la calidad D. vida D. sus familias.
texts.en:
The “Jazmines Uno” Group is represented by Ms. Constanza and is maD. up of 12 members (two men and ten women) who are all hard-working entrepreneurs. They are in their fifth loan cycle with Fundación AgroCapital, and they have previously demonstrated their responsibility and honesty. They have also shown a desire to get ahead in their business endeavors, in order to give their children better futures, adequate education, and nutritious food. Ms. Constanza is married, has a little girl, and rents her home. She sells groceries in the market. She is very hard-working and her greatest wish is for her daughter to be able to get ahead so that one day, she can own her own house. Ms. Constanza needs this loan to acquire more merchandise and to be able to enlarge her shop. She used her last loan to expand her shop and to renovate her stand. Other members of the group work in various activities, such as selling food from home. One of the members runs a motorcycle taxi service and another owns a van and runs a minibus service. One of the associates sells clothing, another sells groceries, and another is a dressmaker. Theirs is a competitive market, but the members of the Jazmines Uno Group are experienced enough to face the competition and they also know how to diversify their products so that they don't lose customers to the competition. This loan will be used to expand and improve their businesses a little, by purchasing merchandise or ingredients, or by buying spare parts and reupholstering their vehicles (to give a better impression to customers). Most of the group members are in their 5th or 6th loan cycle and they are very satisfied with the economic support offered to them. It has allowed them to grow their businesses and to improve their families' quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and ingredients; to buy spare parts and reupholster vehicles

loans.name: Gilda Asunta

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Gilda;   ella tiene 40 años de edad, la socia es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo de 10 años de edad, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio la socia cría animales como aves de corral y tiene un auto que lo da para servicio de taxi.  Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar llantas para su auto y así poder seguir alquilándolo para que le genere ingresos económicos.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Gilda is a member of the “RENOVACIÓN” community bank. She lives in the district of San Jerónimo, in the province and department of Cusco. Gilda is 40 years old, and she is a single mother, raising one 10-year-old son. She balances household activities with business; she raises animals such as birds for poultry, and she has an automobile which she rents out for use as a taxi service. She is applying for a loan to buy tires for her vehicle so she can continue to rent it out as a source of income. Gilda is thankful for and values the support offered to her, and she promises to completely repay her debt by the established due date.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires for taxi

loans.name: Julian Edmundo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mateo Pumacahua se reúne en la ciudad de Chichero del departamento del Cusco,  esta ciudad es más conocida por las ruinas Incas que tiene, cuenta la historia que en tiempos pasados cuando aun no era ciudad en lo que ahora son sus calles había la casa del Inca “Túpac Inca Yupanqui”.  Es también muy interesante esta población no sólo por ruinas y el templo, sin por los trajes y costumbres; además de su colorida y concurrida feria dominical. 

Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con el socio Julián, tiene 38 años,  es casado, tiene 4 hijos,  vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco, él se dedica a trabajar en el grifo “Pisis” como administrativo de 7am hasta las 4pm. Julián y su esposa tienen un negocio familiar de elaboración de textil. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito, él quiere hacer tejidos de lana y desea compra lana de alpaca y tintes naturales como por  ejemplo la cochinilla. El anhelo del  socio es abrir una tienda artesanal donde puede expender sus productos.
texts.en:
The Mateo Pumacahua Community Bank meets in the city of Chinchero in the department of Cusco. This city is most well-known for its Inca ruins, which tell the story of times past, when on what now the city streets, there was the house of the Inca “Túpac Inca Yupanqui.” This area is also interesting not only because of its ruins and temple, but also because of the local clothing and customs, and its colorful and well-attended Sunday market. Upon visiting the Mateo Pumacahua Community Bank, we spoke with the bank member Julián. He is 38 years old and married with four children, and he lives in the city of Chinchero, in the department of Cusco. He works as a clerk at the Pisis gas station from 7am until 4pm. Julián and his wife have a family business in textile production. He has already been working in the business for several years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. Being a member of the Fundación has helped him substantially to improve and make his business grow. With this new loan, he would like to buy alpaca wool and natural dyes - for example, cochinilla, a red plant-based dye - to make weavings. Julián’s wish is to be able to open an artisanal shop where he can sell his products.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of natural dyes and alpaca wool

loans.name: Divinas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Divinas” esta representado por la señora Silvia y conformada por 13 miembros, es un grupo que esta por su segundo ciclo, son muy responsable, alegre, y cumplido y sobre todo muy solidario. La señora Silvia es casada y al igual que ella su esposo es muy trabajadora, ella se dedica al servicio de peluquería, negocio el cual instalado en la casa donde reside en anticretico, ella y su esposo desean poder ahorrar para tener una casa propia en la cual puedan formar una familia futura ya que ella aun no tiene hijos, ella requiere el dinero para poder comprar herramientas para su negocio como secadoras, planchas para el cabello y acomodar el ambiente para darles un mejor servicio a sus clientas que le generan el ingreso diario. En este grupo todos son multifacéticos es decir que trabajan en todo tipo de rubros, les gusta trabajar mucho y saben como hacer negocios, en este momento las socias se dedican a la venta de comida, venta de abarrotes, venta de pollos, venta de refrescos y empanadas, venta de ropa, venta de verduras, joyas y al transporte  público. En este caso no hay competencia porque todos tienen diferentes negocios y todos les va muy bien porque salen a distintos puntos de venta para poder vender su mercadería o ofrecer sus servicio, por ejemplo, la señora Susana vende empanadas y masitas tiene clientes que realizan pedidos por día y gana muy bien en su negocio. El crédito será utilizado para poder crecer mas a su negocio y atraer mas clientela para mejorar sus ingresos para mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Las socias ya tiene bastante experiencia con respecto a lo que es créditos solidarios, es un grupo que esta por su segundo ciclo,  termino muy bien en su primer crédito mostrando mucha capacidad para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
The communal bank, “Divinas” is represented by Silvia and is composed of 13 members. The group will be in its second loan cycle. The members are very responsible, cheerful, punctual, and above all, united. Silvia is married, and just like her, her husband is a hard worker. She is a hairdresser and works out of her home, which is under an anticredito agreement (anticretico is a transaction whereby a property owner requests a "loan" from the tenant in exchange for housing, which must be paid back at the end of the contract. If the loan is not repaid, the property owner loses the property to the tenant). She and her husband want to save for their own house where they can raise a family since they do not yet have children. Silvia needs capital to purchase tools for her business such as hairdryers, flat irons, and to arrange an ambience to give better service to her customers, who are the source of her daily income. All the members of the group are multifaceted, meaning they work in all kinds of fields. They like to work hard, and they know how to do business. The members sell food, groceries, chickens, soft drinks and empanadas, clothing, vegetables, jewelry, and offer public transport. The members do not compete with one another because everyone has a different business. They all do well because they go to different places to sell their merchandise or offer their services. For example, Susana sells empanadas and “masitas,” a type of pastry, and has clients that place orders by the day. Her business provides her with a decent salary. The loan will be used to grow the members’ businesses and attract more clients to increase income and improve quality of life for the families. The members already have plenty of experience with group loans. The group will be in its second loan cycle, and it completed its first loan very well, showing a great capacity for continuing working.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con la socia Hilda, tiene 34 años,  es casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco, ella se dedica a la elaboración  y venta de tejidos  como mantas, fajas y chullos y vende a los turistas que visitan la ciudad, invierte 1000 de dólares en la mercadería que compra  de la ciudad de Lima o ciudad del Cusco. Ya son 8 años que lleva este oficio, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito surtirá su negocio y va comprar más mercadería. El anhelo de la socia es convertirse en una comerciante.
texts.en:
Upon visiting the Mateo Pumacahua Communal Bank we talked with a member, Hilda. She is 34, married, and has two children. She lives in the city of Chinchero in the Cusco department. She makes and sells weavings like blankets, shawls, and “chullos” (article of clothing for the head). She sells to the tourists who visit the city. She invests 1,000 dollars on the merchandise that she buys from the city of Lima or the city of Cusco. She has been in this occupation for eight years. Being a member of the Fundación has greatly helped her to improve herself and to make her business grow. She will use the new loan to stock her business and buy more merchandise. The member’s aspiration is to become a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise like blankets and "chullos" (article of clothing for the head), etc.

loans.name: 8 De Septiembe Group

texts.es: El grupo “8 D. Septiembre” esta representado por Maribel y conformado por 12 miembros 2 varones y 10 mujeres, todos son muy trabajadores y responsables, todos se conocen muy bien ya que residen en la misma zona y confían plenamente en su grupos. El señor Rail que es el secretario del grupo es padre D. familia D. tres niños y es casado el y su esposa se dedican a la crianza D. pollos en su granja la cual fue construida desD. los cimientos por el señor Raúl, el es muy trabajador y es por eso que es el socio destacada del grupo, el requiere del préstamo para poder comprar alimento para sus pollos ya que el capital con el que contaba fue invertida en la adquisición D. alimentadores automáticos y camas para las ponedoras D. huevo, en este caso el se encarga D. la crianza y su esposa D. la venta D. los productos por lo que trabajan muy unidos. El resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. cosméticos, comida, abarrotes, ropa, asaditos y refrescos, bebidas y al servicio D. empleo doméstico y albañilería.
