En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias afirma que es alta pero que ellas saben como cambiar sus productos a artículos D. mayor demanda o cambian D. lugar D. venta para terminar con sus productos el resto D. los socios que prestan servicios tiene clientela. El préstamo será destinado a la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos, herramientas D. trabajo y para la inversión D. nuevos negocios como es el caso D. la señora Maria Eliane que se dedica al empleo domestico y desea poder tener un ingreso adicional con la venta D. anticuchos en la puesta D. la casa D. su suegra. En cuanto a la experiencia crediticia las socias ya cuentan con la misma ya que van cursando un segundo ciclo con la institución demostrando que saben como administrar sus negocios y tendiendo responsabilidad con sus obligaciones.
texts.en:
The “8 D. Septiembre” (September 8th) Group is represented by Maribel and maD. up of 12 members, 2 men and 10 women. They are all very hard-working and responsible, they all know each other very well since they live in the same area, and they trust their group members completely. Raúl is the secretary of the group. He is the father of three children and is married. He and his wife raise chickens in their barn, which Raúl built from the ground up. He is very hard-working, and this is why he is the featured group member. He needs the loan to buy feed for his chickens since the capital he had was invested in acquiring automatic feeders and beds for the egg-laying hens. In this case, he is responsible for raising the chickens, and his wife sells the products, so they work together very closely. The other members work selling cosmetics, food, groceries, clothing, barbecued meat, soft drinks and beverages and work in domestic service and masonry. As for the competitive environment, the members agree that competition is high, but they know how to change their products to items in greater demand or change their selling location to sell all their products. The other members who offer services have regular customers. The loan will be used for the acquisition of merchandise, supplies, work tools, and to invest in new businesses as in the case of Maria Eliane, who works in domestic services and wants to have additional income from selling kebabs at a stand at her mother-in-law's house. With regard to loan experience, the members have some since they are now in a second cycle with the institution, showing that they know how to run their businesses and being responsible with their obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Xeraxon Group

texts.es:
Doña Juana T., es una persona mayor de edad, pero a salido hacia adelante gracias al trabajo que realiza, ella se desempeña a la crianza de gallinas desde hace varios años y ha decidido unirse a dos personas más con el proposito de ampliar su capital de trabajo a los que denominan este grupo Xeraxon, estas señoras residen en en el Barrio Xeraxon del municipio de Nahualá, Sololá, y esperan obtener mejores ganacias por medio de la inversiopn del préstamo que solicitan a ASDIR, las otras dos integrantes de este grupon se dedican a la venta de granos basicos y venta de latas de aluminio para ser recicladas. 
Esta personas son de escasos recursos por lo que esperan seguir trabajando y con ello mejorar el ingreso familiar de cada una.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana T. is a senior citizen who has managed come out ahead thanks to her hard work. She has been raising chickens for several years, and she has decided to team up with two other people to form the Xeraxon group. The group’s members have the common goal of increasing their work capital together. These women live in the Xeraxon neighborhood in the municipality of Nahualá, Sololá, and they hope to obtain better earnings by investing the loan that they are applying for from ASDIR. The other two members of the group work selling of basic grains and recyclable aluminum cans. These women have few economic resources and because of this, they hope to continue working and to improve the family income of each individual.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Grupo “Esperanza” esta representado por la señora Eulalia y conformada por 12 miembros D. los cuales dos son varones y diez son mujeres, todos muy trabajadores y dinámicos como lo han demostrado en los cuatro ciclos que han trabajado con la institución creciendo mas y mas con cada préstamo. La señora Eulalia se dedica a la venta D. pollo crudo ella es madre D. familia y tienen tres hijos, ella es muy trabajadora ya que debe trasladar su mercadería hasta puerto Villarroel donD. tiene mayores clientes, una pequeña parte es vendida en el pueblo D. Ivirgarzama y el resto lo comercializa en el puerto, ella desea poder obtener el financiamiento para poder adquirir un vehículo para el trasporte D. su mercadería y poder generar mayores ganancias con su negocios. Una mayoría del resto del grupo se dedica a la venta D. pan, todo tipo D. masitas, tortas, empanadas y también todo tipo D. refrescos y algunas socias se dedican a la venta D. comida, ropa y gelatinas. En cuanto a la competencia no es alta ya que todos tienen cabida en un puerto que es frecuentemente visitado por turistas y trabajadores. El crédito será utilizado para la adquisición D. mercadería, insumos y herramientas D. trabajo que ayuden a generar un mayor ingreso para el sustento D. sus familias y para darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus hijos. Este es un banco comunal  ya tiene experiencia ya que este es su cuarto ciclo pero también  trabajaban con  otra entidades financiera similares cumpliendo a cabalidad con cada obligación financiera que tienen y mejorando cada día mas con sus negocios.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza” (Hope) Group is represented by Eulalia and maD. up of 12 members, two men and ten women. They are all very hard-working and dynamic, as they have shown in the four cycles that they have worked with the institution, growing more and more with each loan. Eulalia sells raw chicken. She is a mother and has three children. She is very hard-working since she has to move her merchandise to Villarroel port where she has more customers. A small part of her merchandise is sold in the town of Ivirgarzama, and the rest is sold at the port. She wants the loan so she can acquire a vehicle to transport her merchandise and be able to generate greater earnings with her business. Most of the other group members sell bread, all types of pastries, cakes, empanadas and all types of soft drinks, and some members sell food, clothing and gelatinas (gelatin treats). As far as competition goes, it is not high since they all have places at a port that is frequently visited by tourists and workers. The loan will be used for the acquisition of merchandise, supplies and work tools that help generate greater income to support their families and to give their children a better quality of life. This communal bank already has experience since this is their fourth loan cycle, but they also worked with other similar financial institutions, conscientiously fulfilling each financial obligation they had and improving their businesses daily.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Las 7 Calles Group

texts.es: El grupo “Las 7 calles” esta representada por la señora teresa y conformado por 10 miembros 3 varones y 7 mujeres, todos comerciantes del mercado de las 7 calles de ahí el nombre del grupo, todos son muy dinámicos y trabajadores como lo han demostrado en estos dos ciclos que van pasando juntos en la institución. La señora Teresa se dedica al alquiler de su garaje que es amplio y lo usa como estacionamiento durante el día y durante la noche lo alquila como deposito de la mercadería de las señoras que venden en la zona, ella es dueña de una casa en el mercado de las 7 calle y se encuentra bien ubicada, ella es madre de tres hijos que ya son mayores y se encuentran estudiando en la universidad, su mayores anhelo es poder verlos profesionales, ella requiere de préstamo para ampliar su negocio dándole un mayor espacio y construyendo depósitos para darles a sus clientas un servicio con mayor seguridad. El resto de las socias se dedican a la venta de salteñas, empanadas, venta de productos de belleza, venta de chinelas bordadas, venta de ropa nueva , venta de edredones, venta de dulces y sodas y al servicio de transporte en moto- taxis. En cuanto al entorno competitivo las socias afirma que es alta pero que ellas saben como cambiar sus productos a artículos de mayor demanda o cambian de lugar de venta para terminar con sus productos el resto de los socios que prestan servicios tiene clientela. El crédito será utilizado para la comprar mercadería como ropa, dulces, harina para la elaboración de empanadas, comprar  productos de belleza y la comprar repuestos de moto, en resumen capitalizar más su actividad comercial para poder crecer, por ejemplo el señor Juan Carlos desea este crédito para la adquisición de otra moto y así rentarla para `poder obtener un mejor ingreso para el sustento de su familia y para poder darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The “Las 7 Calles” group is represented by Teresa and made up of 10 members, 3 men and 7 women. All of them are merchants in the 7 Calles market, and that is how they got their name. All of them are very dynamic and hardworking, as they have shown during these two cycles with the institution. Teresa rents out her garage. It is large and used as a parking lot during the day, and at night is used as a warehouse for merchandise for the women who sell in the area. She is owner of a house in a good location in the 7 Calles market. She is a mother of three grown children who are studying at the university. Her greatest wish is to see them become professionals. She needs the loan to enlarge her business, giving it more space and building storage areas to give her clients a service with more security. The rest of the members sell salteñas, empanadas, beauty products, embroidered slippers, new clothing, candies and sodas and a motorcyle taxi service. In regards to the competitive ambience, the members affirm that it is strong but that they know how to change their products to items in high demand, or they change the place they sell to sell all their products. The rest of the members, who offer services, have their regular clients. The loan will be used to buy merchandise such as clothes, candies, and flour to make empanadas, to buy beauty products and to buy motorcycle parts. In short, to capitalize their business activity more in order to grow. For example, Juan Carlos wants the loan to adquire another motorcycle and rent it out in order to have more income to support his family and be able to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operational capital

loans.name: Bella Maria Group

texts.es: El banco comunal “Bella Maria” esta representado por la señora Liliana y conformado por 12 miembros todas mujeres muy unidad y trabajadores y sobre todo muy responsables y honestas como lo han ido demostrando en los cuatro ciclos que van cursando con la institución. La señora Liliana se dedica a la venta D. comida y es ama D. casa tiene 3 hijos y vive en la casa D. su suegra, ella es casada y su esposo también trabaja duro para poder salir adelante, la señora Liliana requiere el préstamo para poder comprar mesas y sillas para poder darles mayor comodidad a sus clientes y para la compra D. una cocina mas rápida que le permita tener a tiempo su almuerzo para la gente que ya tiene costumbre D. almorzar en su pequeña pensión improvisada la cual fue montando poco a poco con los financiamientos otorgados por la institución . el resto D. la socias se dedican a la venta D. pan, cosméticos y abarrotes, una mayoría del resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. comida. En cuanto a la competencia todas las socias venden casi por la misma zona y para no tener competencia entre ellas se ponen D. acuerdo para no cocinar lo mismo y tener un menú variado del cual puedan escoger los clientes. El crédito será utilizado para la compra D. mercadería, insumos y para la ampliación D. sus puestos D. venta D. comida y la compra D. materiales que ayuden a darles mejor atención a sus clientes. La socias van cumpliendo un cuarto ciclo con la institución por lo que tienen experiencia en créditos solidarios y saben como salir adelante con el crecimiento D. sus negocios para generar mejores ingreso que les permita darles una mejor calidad D. vida a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Bella Maria" group is led by Liliana and comprised of 12 women, all very united, hard working, and most of all very responsible and honest, as they have demonstrated in the four cycles that they have been involved with this institution. Liliana sells food, and she is the head of her household and has 3 children. They live in her mother-in-law's house. She is married, and her husband also works in order to get ahead. Liliana is requesting this loan in order to buy tables and chairs to proviD. a better level of comfort to her clients. Also, she wants to buy a better kitchen that would allow her to more quickly manage the lunch hour for the people who are used to coming to lunch at her small, improvised pension, a place that has been growing little by little though this institution's loans. The rest of the group's members work by selling bread, cosmetics, and groceries. The majority of the others sell food. In terms of competition, these women all work in nearly the same area, but they have agreed to not cook the same foods and to have a varied menu from which the clients can choose. This loan will be used to buy merchandise, ingredients to expands their food stands, and materials that will help them give a better experience to their clients. The members are enjoying their fourth cycle with this lending institution because they have experience with joint credits and know how to succeed in making their businesses grow and generating greater incomes that allow a better quality of life for them and their families.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Los Pisafuertes Group

texts.es: El grupo “Los Pisafuerte” esta representado por la señora Silvia Nair y conformado por 12 miembros, 3 varones y 9 mujeres todos se conocen muy bien y una gran mayoría del grupo son familiares entre primos, hermanos y sobrinos, con diferentes actividades y muy entusiastas. La señora Silvia Nair es una joven dinámica y soñadora pero muy entusiasta ella vive con su madre y se dedica  a la venta D. cosméticos por catalogo como ella es muy carismática tiene habilidad para vender y salir adelante ella aun no es casada pero tiene una pequeña niña a la cual saca adelante con su pequeño negocio, ella requiere del préstamo para incrementar su capital D. trabajo y poder aprovechar las ofertas para obtener mejores ganancias. El resto D. las socias se dedican a la venta D. comida, cosméticos, venta D. cerveza, ropa, servicios médicos,  servicios D. transporte y sastrería. No hay mucha competencia ya que se dedican a diferentes actividades y saben como salir adelante en cada uno D. sus rubros. En cuanto al destino del crédito muchos utilizar el mismo en la compra D. insumos, herramientas D. trabajo reparación D. sus herramientas D. trabajo y capital D. trabajo para incrementar sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos que les permitirá darles a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida. Este es un banco comunal  ya tiene experiencia ya que este es su tercer ciclo pero también  trabajaban con  otra entidades financiera similares cumpliendo a cabalidad con cada obligación financiera que tienen y mejorando cada día mas con sus negocios.
texts.en:
The "Los Pisafuerte" group is led by Silvia Nair and comprised of 12 total members, 3 men and 9 women, who all have different activities but all very enthusiastic. Everyone knows each other very well, and the majority are related as cousins, siblings, nieces, or nephews. Silvia Nair is a dynamic young woman, a dreamer, and very enthusiastic. She lives with her mother and sells catalog-order cosmetics. Because she is very charismatic she has a knack for sales and for success. While she is not married, she has a small daughter whom she supports with her small business. She is requesting this loan in order to increase her working capital and to be able to take advantage of special offers so as to generate better income. The rest of the group members sell food, cosmetics, beer, clothes, medical services, transportation service, and tailoring. There is not much competition between members since they are involved in different activities, and they know how to succeed in each one of their categories. As far as the intended use of the loan, many plan to use it for the purchase of materials, tools for repairs, tools for work, and working capital in order to increase sales and make better income, which would allow them to to give a better quality of life to their children. This is a community bank that has three cycles of lending experience, but they have also worked with other financial institutions, fully complying with every financial obligation they have and improving their businesses every day.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Merchlewitz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Yeison Wisney

texts.es:
Yeison de 24 años, vive en una zona urbana en las Orquídeas (llamado así porque en su originalidad había muchas flores orquídeas) de Guayaquil. tiene un hijo de dos años. Yeison después de casarse necesitaba mantener a su familia y tuvo que invertir sus ahorros en quintales de arroz y vendérselos a sus amigos. 

Con esfuerzo y dedicación hizo de esta venta de arroz su principal ingreso para su familia. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 16h00pm hasta las 18h00pm de lunes a domingo. Cada quintal de arroz lo vende a $ 32.00. Por este trabajo tiene tiempo para pasar con su familia. Por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar quintales de arroz para tener mas ingresos.  

En el futuro quiere tener un local para vender al por mayor.
texts.en:
Yeison is 24 years old and lives in an urban area of Guayaquil called “Orquídeas” (“Orchids,” so named because many orchids used to grow there). He has a two-year-old son. After marrying, Yeison had to provide for his family and invested his savings in sacks of rice to sell to his friends. With hard work and dedication, he has made selling rice the primary source of income for his family. He currently works from 4:00pm to 6:00pm Mondays to Sunday, selling each sack of rice for $32.00. This work enables him to spend time with his family, so he is requesting a loan to buy more rice so he can increase his income. In the future, he would like to have a wholesale shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sacks of rice

loans.name: Teodora Mercedes

texts.es:
Teodora de 46 años, vive en la Primavera de Duran (perímetro urbano fue originalmente irregular, con varios cerros, riachuelos y lagunas que aún se presentan como restos de una ecología en disolución). Tiene dos hijos  que estudian en escuelas fiscales. 

Para poder mantener a su familia ella empezó a vender víveres en un pequeño local que construyo en su casa. Poco a poco con esfuerzo y dedicación alcanzo a tener una tienda surtida. Vende enlatados, aceite, arroz y otros víveres de primera necesidad. Para tener mas variedad en su negocio quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, azúcar y aceites para su tienda. 

En el futuro quiere incrementa su capital de trabajo para construir mejor su casa y tener otra tienda.
texts.en:
Teodora is 46 years old and lives in the Primavera area of Duran (what is now an urban area was originally wild, with numerous hills, streams, and lakes; these are still present but the feeling of being in a natural environment is slowly dissolving). She has two children who attend public school. To take care of her family, Teodora began to sell groceries from a small shop in her home. With effort and dedication, she was able to little by little expand her business, and she now has a fully-stocked store. She sells canned goods, oil, rice, and other staple items. She would like to be able to offer more products, so she is requesting a loan to purchase rice, sugar, and oil for her shop. In the future, she would like to increase her working capital to make improvements to her home and to start another shop.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, and oil

loans.name: Maria Vicenta

texts.es:
La Sra. María Uchupaille es socia del Mujeres Floreciendo, vive en la parroquia de Paccha, esta parroquia se caracteriza por  la agricultura, es la ocupación tradicional a la que se dedican los habitantes de este pueblo, su producción solo abastece para el autoconsumo, solamente un pequeño sobrante es sacado hacia los mercados de la ciudad de Cuenca.

Nuestra socia tiene de 36 años de edad,  vive en unión conyugal,  ha concebido 4 hijos quienes se encuentran de 15, 12, 9 y 7 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos cursan el colegio y su dos últimos cursan la escuela, su esposo se dedica  a realizar artesanías como es todo tipo de joyas, en el trabajo de los dos han logrado construir su casa propia en donde viven muy tranquilos toda su familia.

Nuestra socia se dedica desde que se ha casado a trabajar con su esposo, labora desde las 8 a.m. hasta las 11 a.m. y en la tarde trabaja en el bar del colegio de su parroquia. Es su primer crédito y se encuentra ilusionada ya que con este  puede invertir para seguir creciendo en su negocio de artesanías, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales como piedras golfinadas (piedras preciosas bañadas en oro) y también para hacer arreglos a su casa ya que aun le falta  terminar.
texts.en:
María U. is a member of the “Mujeres Floreciendo” (“Blooming Women”) communal bank and lives in Paccha. Paccha is an area known for agriculture, as this has traditionally been the primary occupation of its inhabitants. Most of their crops are used in their community, with only a small amount being sold in the markets of Cuenca. María is 36 years old, lives in a civil union, and has 4 children, ages 15, 12, 9 and 7. Her two oldest children are in high school and her two younger are in elementary school. Her husband makes handicrafts and all kinds of jewelry. Working together, they have been to build their own home where their family lives very happily. She has worked with her husband since she got married. She works from 8:00am to 11:00am and then works in the café at the local high school in the afternoon. This is her first loan and she is very hopeful that with it she will be able to continue developing her handicrafts business. She will invest the loan in the purchase of supplies, such as gold-plated stones. She will also use the loan to make repairs to her home that are as yet unfinished.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of precious stones. Repairs to home.

loans.name: Dany

texts.es: Dany tiene 18 años, es soltero, vive en su propia vivienda con sus padres,  Luis de 54 años y Rosa de 45 años; y sus 2 hermanos de los 8 que tiene. Esta familia se caracteriza por ser muy unida, pues a pesar de que los hijos mayores que tiene, viven independientemente, pero siempre ayudan en la economía familiar. Cuando sus padres le cedieron terrenos como parte de su herencia, no lo dudo y empezó a cultivar café y plátano, es así que lleva en esta actividad más de un año. En ocasiones la ayudan  sus padres y hermanos, pero cuando es temporada de limpieza y cosecha contrata los servicios de operarios.  Gracias a los cuidados y técnicas que le enseño su padre, pudo obtener una cosecha de primera, sin embargo le resulta pesado trasladar los sacos de frutos, desde la chacra hasta su localidad. Su trabajo es muy rentable, porque le permite continuar invirtiendo en sus tierras, cubrir sus necesidades, ayudar a su familia y ahorrar para emprender nuevos retos más adelante, como el tener más plantaciones de café por ser un fruto muy solicitado, asimismo quiere estudiar la carrera de contabilidad en la ciudad. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP, y una vez más se compromete a no defraudar a sus compañeros de grupo, porque está contento de trabajar en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 20 sacos de fertilizantes con las cuales protegerá sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Dany is 18 years old. He is single and lives in his own house with his parents, Luis, 54, and Rosa, 45, and 2 of his 8 siblings. This family is very close; despite the fact that the children are older and independent, they help with the family finances. When his parents gave over some land to him as part of his inheritance, he didn't hesitate and began to grow coffee and plantains. He has been doing this activity for more than a year. At times, his parents and his siblings help him, but when it's time to clear and harvest he hires laborers. Thanks to the care and techniques his father taught him, he was abe to have a harvest on the first try. Nonetheless, it has been difficult to transport the sacks of product from his filed to town. His work is very profitable, because it allows him to continue investing in his land, cover his necessities, help his family and save for new challenges in the future, like having more coffee plantings, because it is in demand. He also wants to study accounting in the city. This is his second loan with MFP, and once again he is committed to not letting the other members of the group down, because he is happy with his community bank. With the loan he is asking for, he will buy 20 sacks of fertilizer which will protect his plantings.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Aurora

texts.es:
La Sra. María L. pertenece al banco comunal hace 5 años, esta muy  agradecida con su amiga quien la invito a formar parte del grupo, vive en la parroquia de Paccha, esta parroquia se encuentra al noreste del cantón Cuenca, la agricultura y ganadería, son las ocupaciones tradicionales de los habitantes, su atractivo turístico es su iglesia parroquial y el imponente cerro de Guagualzhumi tradicional por 
las ruinas arqueológicas, y su posición le da un dominio sobre buena parte de la planicie del Tomebamba.

Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos, y también a su labor tradicional quien aprendió de sus padres como es la agricultura y cría de animales, como chanchos, aves, cuyes, los que vende en su comunidad, también para obtener un poco mas de ingresos se dedica a vender comida típica ecuatoriana (tamales, humitas, tortillas, dulces, etc.), los mismos que vende recorriendo la ciudad.

Nuestra socia tiene 66 años de edad es madre soltera y ha concebido 2 hijos quienes  son  adultos ya que tienen 46 y 39 años de edad, son casados, solo su primer hijo vive con ella en su casa y es quien le ayuda en su economía; cuenta con su casa propia que es herencia de su padre.

Tiene una linda amistad con todas sus compañeras gracias a su carisma y alegría. Con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para la elaboración de sus productos, y  frutas para la elaboración de sus dulces, su meta es de seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Mrs. María L. has belonged to the communal bank for 5 years. She is very grateful with her friend who invited her to be a part of the group. She lives in the parish of Paccha. This parish is found in the northeast of the Cuenca canton. Agriculture and cattle are the traditional occupations of the residents. Its tourist attraction is its parish church and the imposing mountain of Guagualzhumi, known for its archeological ruins and its dominance over a large portion of the Tomebamba plain. María is a housewife and also has her traditional work she learned from her parents, such as raising animals such as pigs, birds, and guinea pigs that she sells in her community. She also obatins a little more income selling traditional Ecuadorian food (tamales, humitas, tortillas, sweets, etc.). She sells these throughout the city. Our member is 66 years old and is a single mother of two children who are adults, aged 46 and 39. They are married and only her oldest son lives with her in her house and helps her with her finances. She has her own home which she inherited from her father. She has a nice friendship with all of the other members thanks to her charisma and cheerfulness. She will invest the new loan to buy ingredients to make her products and fruit to make her sweets. Her goal is to keep growing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit, sugar, corn, flour, eggs, butter, salt, etc.

loans.name: Gorki Karlos

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “RENOVACIÓN”; Nuestro socio vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la provincia y departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él Sr. Karlos; el socio tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero. El socio es de profesión Ingeniero Mecánico y solicita el préstamo para poder avanzar en la construcción de su casa.

El socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Karlos belongs to the community bank "Renovacion"; he lives in the district of San Jeronimo in the province and department of Cusco. He is 26 and single. He is a mechanical engineer and is requesting this loan to move forward with the construction of his house. Karlos is grateful for the support offered through this loan, and values it. He promises to repay the loan on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home construction

loans.name: Futuro Para Un Bienestar (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Futuro para un Bienestar esta formado por 9 mujeres luchadoras, emprendedoras que se encuentran agrupadas para obtener un mejor futuro para sus familias, viven en la ciudad de Cuenca localidad que se caracteriza por la belleza de sus ríos, sus escritores, la arquitectura de sus templos y edificaciones,  su exquisista gastronomía así como su gente es cordial y  amable con el turista.

La señora  María Beatriz O. se encuentra en el banco comunal hace un año y medio invitada por una amiga que pertenece al bankito, los créditos le han beneficiado en su pequeño negocio.  Prepara comidas para entregar a sus clientes los mismos que ha conseguido con el paso de los años ya que trabaja en esta actividad hace 3 años, le va bien y poco a poco esta creciendo, labora de lunes a viernes de 8 de la mañana hasta las 3 de la tarde.

Nuestra socia vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 53 años de edad, se encuentra divorciada hace 20 años,  tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 se encuentran casados y su último hijo tiene 22 años y se encuentra estudiando en la universidad, también trabaja para pagarse sus estudios y cuando puede ayuda para la economía del hogar, gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un quintal de azúcar, arroz y muchos más víveres que necesita para la preparación de sus platos, su meta es seguir  adelante e incrementar más su negocio.

La señora Tania Anabella es  oriunda de la provincia de El Oro, se encuentra en Cuenca hace 3 años y vino a esta ciudad en busca de trabajo, tiene 38 años de edad y vive en unión libre con su pareja,  fruto de su unión ha concebido 4 hijos que se encuentran de 18, 15, 10 y 2 años, su primera hija pasa en casa ayudando a los quehaceres, el  segundo y tercer hijo estudian en colegio y escuela respectivamente, también cuida de un hijo de su esposo de otro compromiso que tiene 10 años,  esta muy contenta ya que se encuentra de 5 meses de gestación, no tiene casa propia y vive arrendando, su esposo es maestro albañil.

Nuestra socia ha empezado hace 2 meses la cría  de pollos para obtener ingresos para su hogar ya que antes se dedicaba  a la venta de especias, vendía recorriendo por todas las tiendas pero no obtenía muchas ganancias, ahora con su crédito pagará  una letra  por la compra de un terreno.

Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The community bank Futuro para un Bienestar is made up of 9 hard-working, enterprising women who have come together to obtain a better future for their families. They live in Cuenca, a location characterized by the beauty of its rivers, its writers, the architecture of its temples and buildings, its exquisite gastronomy and the friendliness and kindness shown to tourists. Maria Beatriz O. has been a member of this community bank for a year and a half. She was invited by a friend and the loans have helped her small business. She prepares food to deliver to her customers, whom she has obtained through her three years of work. Things are going well and bit by bit her business is growing. She works Monday to Friday from 8 am to 3 pm. She lives in Cuenca, is 53 years old and has been divorced for 20 years. She has 4 children: 3 are married and the youngest is 22 and studies at the university and also works to pay tuition and, where possible to help with household costs. Thanks to Maria's hard work, she has been able to build her own house. This loan will be invested in the purchase of a quintal of sugar, rice and many other supplies that she needs for the preparation of her dishes. Her goal is to get ahead and expand her business. Tania Anabella is a native of the El Oro province and has lived in Cuenca for 3 years; she came to this city searching for work. Tania Anabella is 38 and lives with her common-law partner with whom she has 4 children who are 18, 15, 10 and 2. Her oldest daughter stays at home helping with the housework; the second and third children study in high school and elementary school respectively. She also cares for her partner's 10 year old child from another union. She is very happy to be 5 months pregnant. They do not have their own home and rent their house. Her partner is a master mason. For two months she has raised chicken in order to obtain income for their home. Previously, she sold spices, traveling to all the stores, but she did not earn much. With this loan, she will pay a bill for the purchase of a plot of land. Her dream is that her children will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, meat and land

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar tiene 31 años, vive con su pareja Reina de 23 años, en una acogedora vivienda propia, está pareja quiere tener comodidades antes de convertirse en padres, porque no quieren que sus hijos tengan carencias. Desde hace dos años, se dedica a la agricultura de café y plátano en sus propias chacras, siendo éstas heredadas por su suegra. Por otro lado labora como operario en las tierras de los hacendados, ganando S/. 20.00 soles por día, mientras su esposa se dedica a las labores domesticas de la casa, pero en época de cosecha lo ayuda. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es limpiar la maleza de sus campos y cosechar sus frutos, por otro lado le es difícil cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas, por lo que pierde productividad. Pero sabe que en la agricultura, siempre gana buenas utilidades, por eso la considera rentable y por tal motivo desea ampliar las hectáreas de su chacra para continuar sembrando café. Asegura además que se convertirá en el mejor productor de café de la zona y para que su esposa también tenga beneficios económicos instalará una tienda de comestibles o de prendas de vestir en su casa. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y como ya conoce la metodología de trabajo de su grupo comunal, siento feliz por continuar acompañada de personas muy responsables y honestas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará 7 sacos de fertilizantes, además comprará madera, clavos, calaminas para terminar de construir el segundo piso de su domicilio.
texts.en:
Edgar is 31 and lives with his partner, Reina, 23, in a cosy home that they own. They are a couple who want to be well set-up before becoming parents, because they don't want their children to lack anything. For two years, Edgar has farmed coffee and bananas on his own farmlands, which he inherited from his mother-in-law. He also works as a labourer on the land of some landowners, earning about 20 soles per day. His wife does housework but helps him at harvest time. His favourite part of his job is clearing the weeds from his land and harvesting his fruits; on the other hand, it is difficult to keep his fields safe from pests which hurt productivity. But he knows that in agriculture, one always earns something useful, and thus he considers agriculture to be profitable and he wants to expand his farmlands to keep growing coffee. He is sure that he will become the best coffee producer in the area and, in order for his wife to also have economic benefits he will install a food store or a clothing store in their house. This is the second time he has taken out a loan with MFP, and as he already knows how the community group works together, he is happy to keep working with such very responsible and honest people. With the requested loan, he will buy 7 bags of fertilizer, and wood, nails and corrugated iron to finish the construction of the second floor of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: 7 bags of fertilizer and materials for home completion

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Marina;  ella tiene 36 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia vende papa en el mercado modelo de Urubamba, desde hace 10 años, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para poder comprar de los proveedores al mayoreo papa de todo tipo y bolsas de rafia para almacenar sus papas y llevarlos a vender al mercado, donde la socia tiene su stand.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Marina C. S. belongs to the "Perolniyoc" community bank; she lives in the province of Urubamba, Cusco. She is 36, lives with her partner and has 2 children. She does housework and retail; she has sold potatoes in the Urubamba Modelo market for 10 years. She is requesting this loan to be able to buy all types of potatoes wholesale from providers, and raffia bags to store the potatoes and bring them to sell in the market, where she has her stand. She is grateful for, and values the support offered through this loan and promises to repay it on time.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of potatoes

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con la socia Paulina, tiene 34  años,  es casada, tiene 2 hijos,  vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco, ella trabaja en una ONG contratada por el momento pero su actividad económica complementaria es ser técnica en gastronomía y restaurante en la playa de estacionamiento de los buses de que se dirigen de la ciudad de Chicheros a la ciudad del Cusco. Ya son siete años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socia de la fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito requiere comprar insumos como por ejemplos papas, carne y muchos más.
texts.en:
When visiting the "Mateo Pumacahua" communal bank, we spoke with Paulina, a member who is 34 years old. She is married with 2 children and lives in the city of Chinchero, in the department of Cusco. She currently works on a contract basis for an NGO. However, her complementary economic activity is working in the restaurant and hospitality field at the parking area for buses traveling from Chinchero to Cusco. She has dedicated herself to this business for the past seven years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the dedication she brings to her work. Being a member of the foundation has helped her greatly in making economic progress and expanding her business. With this new loan, she will buy needed supplies such as potatoes, meat and much more.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying supplies such as potatoes, meat and much more

loans.name: Leonor Consuelo

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mateo Pumacahua se reúne en la ciudad de Chichero del departamento del Cusco,  esta ciudad es más conocida por las ruinas Incas que tiene, cuenta la historia que en tiempos pasados cuando aun no era ciudad en lo que ahora son sus calles había la casa del Inca “Túpac Inca Yupanqui”.  Es también muy interesante esta población no sólo por las ruinas y el templo, si no por los trajes y costumbres; además de su colorida y concurrida feria dominical. 

Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con la socia Leonor, tiene 37 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos,  vive en la ciudad del Cusco, su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de transportes de turistas y su actividad complementaria de administrar su agencia de viajes llamada “Dery Tours”. Ya son 10 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socio de la fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, ella requiere el nuevo crédito para completar el monto que cuesta comprar una laptop para su hija.
texts.en:
The "Mateo Pumacahua" communal bank meets in the city of Chinchero in the department of Cusco. This city is well-known for its Inca ruins. The story is told that in past times, before the current city was built, it was the site of the home of the Inca “Túpac Inca Yupanqui.” The town is not only interesting for its ruins and temple, but also for its traditional clothing and customs, as well as its popular and colorful Sunday market. Visiting the "Mateo Pumacahua" communal bank, we spoke with Leonor, a member who is 37 years old. She is married with 3 children and lives in the city of Cusco. Her main economic activity is providing tourist transportation services, and her complementary activity is running her travel agency, called “Dery Tours.” She has dedicated herself to this business for 10 years, and it is going very well for her thanks to the dedication she brings to her work. Being a member of the foundation has helped her very much in getting ahead and expanding her business. She needs the current loan for to add to her savings in order to buy a laptop computer for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a laptop

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es: Hugo, es un joven muy alegre y trabajador de35 años, casado con Karina de 25 años, con quien tiene una pequeña hija Paola de 3 años, esta familia vive en su vivienda propia, ubicado en la localidad “Sanchirio Palomar” de La Merced. Su hija es el motor de su vida, por quien se esfuerza cada día y por quien se esmera en aprender todas las técnicas agrícolas necesarias, para tener una cosecha exitosa. Junto a su esposa, planta café y plátano en sus propios terrenos, es así que llevan 5 años trabajando sin descanso, luchando contra las adversidades climáticas y las plagas. Lo que más le gusta es tener siempre limpios sus tierras, porque según asegura, de esa manera sus cultivos se desarrollarán fuertes y frondosos, sin embargo su dificultad es tener que trasladar sus cosechas hacia el mercado de su ciudad. Su labor le es rentable porque puede vivir cómodamente, por eso continuará renovando sus plantaciones en búsqueda de una mayor productividad, además planea  instalar una tienda de comestibles en su domicilio, para tener más utilidades. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y como integrante de la junta directiva de su grupo, está feliz de continuar laborando en su grupo comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de fertilizante, e insumos para evitar las plagas.
texts.en:
Hugo is a cheerful and hardworking young man. He is 35 years old and married to Karina, who is 25. They have a young daughter named Paola, who is three years old, and live in their own home in the town of Sanchirio Palomar in La Merced. His daughter is the driving force behind his life. For this reason, Hugo strives each day to learn all the technical aspects of farming so that he can have a successful harvest. Together with his wife, he plants coffee and bananas on their own land that they have worked on tirelessly for five years. Among the obstacles they must battle against are inclement weather and pests. What he enjoys most about his work is clearing his land because it enables his crops to become strong and fruitful. However, the most difficult part is transporting his crops to the city market. Since the work is profitable, Hugo is able to live comfortably and continue making improvements to his farm in hopes of greater productivity. Later on, he plans to open a grocery store in his home to generate more revenue.

This is his second loan with MFP. Hugo is happy to continue working with his Communal Bank and was chosen to join its board of directors. With the loan he requested, Hugo will buy several sacks of fertilizers and supplies to help avoid pests.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers & farming supplies

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Guillermina;  ella tiene 45 años de edad, la socia es viuda, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia vende granos secos como habas secas, maíz, morado, maíz blanco, maíz amarillo, cereales. Ella vende en el mercado modelo de Urubamba, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar más productos y venderlos en su stand en Urubamba.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sra. Guillermina is a member of the Communal Bank “Perolniyoc”. She lives in Urubamba Province, which is part of the Department of Cusco.

Guillermina is 45 years old, widowed, and divides her time between her household activities and running her small business. She sells dried goods such as beans, purple corn, white corn, yellow corn, and grain. Guillermina sells at the standard market in Urubamba. She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more products and sell them from her stand in Urubamba.

Guillermina appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dried goods to sell

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con el socio Wilfredo, tiene 41  años,  es conviviente,   vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco, él trabaja en su restaurante atendiendo a sus clientes que vienen a de gustar sus comidas tradicionales que prepara, él y su esposa acomodaron una habitación de su domicilio donde funciona el restaurante, el restaurante está ubicado en la calle Garcilaso de la ciudad de chichero. Ya son 8 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito requiere ampliar el negocio y desea comprar sillas y mesas.
texts.en:
While visiting the Mateo Pumacahua Communal Bank, the staff of Asociación Arariwa had the opportunity to speak with Wilfredo. He is 41 years old, in a common law marriage, and lives in the city of Chinchero in the Department of Cusco. Wilfredo works in his restaurant and attends to his customers who come to enjoy the traditional food that he prepares. He and his wife set aside a room in their house to function as a restaurant. Their business is located on Garcilaso Street in the city of Chinchero. They have already been in operation for eight years and have done very well thanks to the effort they put into their work. Being a member of Asociación Arariwa has been a great help in improving and making the business grow.

With this new loan, Wilfredo wants to expand his business by purchasing chairs and tables.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chairs & tables

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Nuestro socio pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestro socio vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestro socio es él Sr. Jose; él socio tiene 50 años de edad, el socio es padre separado tiene 3 hijos y el trabaja en la quinta Carmelo, el socio es mozo, Nuestro socio solicita el préstamo para poder pagar las mensualidades de los estudios superiores de sus hijos.

El  socio agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sr. Jose is a member of the Communal Bank “Perolniyoc”. He lives in Urubamba Province, which is part of the Department of Cusco.

Sr. Jose is 50 years old, separated from his spouse, and the father of three children. He works at the Carmelo Estate and is currently single. Jose is requesting a loan to pay the monthly tuition for his children.

He appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, he promises to complete his payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for his children's monthly tuition

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es: El  señor José Alfredo G. R. es padre de familia preocupado por el bienestar de sus 3 hijos a los que quiere ofrecer comodidad. Es por ello que el quiere terminar de construir un cuarto que tiene en la planta alta de su casa, que con mismos prestamos de esta institución ha levantado pero por falta de capital aún no lo termina. El señor Alfredo necesita el apoyo para comprar el material de construcción y así terminar el cuarto y así ofrecer a su familia confort.
texts.en:
Sr. José Alfredo G. R. is a father who is concerned about the welfare of his three children for whom he wants to provide comfortable conditions. For this reason, he wants to finish the construction of a room on the upper floor of his house. With the loans from FVP, he was able start this project but he does not have the capital to finish it.

Sr. Alfredo needs this assistance so that he can buy the construction materials needed to finish the room and provide greater comfort for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Finish the construction of a room

loans.name: Blanca Margarita

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca T. vive en la comunidad de Poloma que es perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus verdes campos, llenos de cultivos de maíz, papas, etc., su gente es trabajadora, luchadora y siempre están en la búsqueda de un mejor futuro para sus familias.

Nuestra socia se dedica a la venta de leche hace 35 años, su producto lo vende recorriendo la ciudad de Cuenca, también cría animales como: gallinas, cuyes, chanchos, como lo hacen todos los que viven en el campo, los vende solo cuando tiene  alguna necesidad; también tiene una pequeña tiendita la cual abre solo cuando se encuentra en casa, y lleva 6 años trabajando en la misma.

Doña Blanca tiene 47 años de edad, es una mujer libre ya que se ha separado de su pareja, ha concebido 2 hijos, su primera hija de 23 años de edad, quien trabaja y apoya económicamente en el hogar, su segundo hijo de 12 años estudia en un colegio de la ciudad; gracias al esfuerzo de su trabajo ha logrado tener su casa propia.

 Se encuentra en la banca comunal hace varios años y los créditos le han beneficiado para todos sus negocios, con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda, su meta es remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Blanca T. lives in the community of Poloma, which is part of El Valle Parish. This parish is known for its green fields full of corn, potatoes, and other crops. The people are hardworking and always determined to find a better future for their families.

Blanca has been selling milk for 35 years and distributes her product throughout the city of Cuenca. She also raises animals such as chickens, guinea pigs, and hogs just like everyone else who lives in the country. The animals are sold only when necessary. She manages a small store whenever she is at home, which has been in operation for six years.

Doña Blanca is 47 years old. She is a free woman since she is already separated from the husband with whom she had two children. Her oldest daughter is 23 years old and works to help support the household financially. The second child is 12 years old and attends school in the city. Thanks to the effort invested into her work, Blanca was able to acquire her own home.

Blanca has been a member of her Communal Bank for several years and the loans she has taken have benefited all of her businesses. With this new loan, she will invest in the purchase of groceries for her store. Her goal is to remodel her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, oil, eggs, sodas, and other products for her store

loans.name: Fredy

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con el socio Fredy, tiene 39 años,  es casado,  vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco, su actividad principal es vender artesanía a los turistas que vienen a visitar las ruinas de la ciudad de chincheros y el y su esposa aprovechan para vender sus productos. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socio de la fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito requiere comprar más artesanía como por ejemplo chompas, chalinas, fajas y mucho más.
texts.en:
The staff of Asociación Arariwa visited with the Mateo Pumacahua Communal Bank and spoke with Fredy. He is 39 years old, married, and lives in the city of Chinchero in the Department of Cusco. His main business activity is selling handicrafts to tourists who come visit the ruins in the city of Chinchero. He and his wife take advantage of this opportunity to sell these products. They have been in business for several years and have done very well thanks to the effort they put into their work. Being a member of Asociación Arariwa has helped him greatly to improve and make his business grow.

With this new loan, Fredy plans to buy more handicrafts such as sweaters, scarves, belts, and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase handmade sweaters, scarves, belts, and other items to sell

loans.name: Yanny

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Yanny;  ella tiene 35 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, ella alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia vende granos secos como habas secas, maíz, morado, maíz blanco, maíz amarillo, cereales, entre otros. Ella vende en el mercado modelo de Urubamba, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos  y venderlos en su stand en Urubamba.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Yanny is a member of the Communal Bank “Perolniyoc”. She lives in Urubamba Province, which is part of the Department of Cusco.

Yanny is 35 years old, in a common law marriage, and divides her time between her household activities and running her small business. She sells dried goods such as beans, purple corn, white corn, yellow corn, grain, and other products. Yanny sells at the standard market of Urubamba. She is requesting a loan in order to buy dried goods to sell from her stand in Urubamba.

Yanny appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dried goods

loans.name: Judith

texts.es: Judith tiene 22 años, es una mujer trabajadora, comparte su vida con su esposo Ángel de 25 años y con su hija Luz clarita de 2 años, juntos viven en su casa propia. Hace más de 2 años arriendan terrenos en donde plantan café y plátano, que junto a su esposo trabajan para generarse mayores ingresos económicos, que le ayudarán a cubrir los gastos domiciliarios. Paralelamente su pareja trabaja como operario en los terrenos de los hacendados, donde gana S/. 20.00 soles por día, pero en épocas de cosecha trabaja el doble además su esposa también es contratada para éste trabajo. Lo que más le gusta a Judith es vivir en el campo, pues los sonidos que producen los animales y las plantas le transmiten la tranquilidad y eso le hace feliz. Por otro lado le incomoda trasladar sus cosechas a la ciudad por la distancia que tiene que recorrer con los pesados sacos, pero dice que vale la pena. Además las utilidades que le deja, son bastante considerables y le permiten ahorrar, ya que desea comprarse su propias chacras e incrementar su producción. Siendo su mayor anhelo brindarle a su hija una adecuada calidad de vida. “Cada sacrificio es por mi pequeña, quien es mi motivación cada día” refiere. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y esta contenta de continuar trabajando con su grupo comunal porque conoce la metodología de trabajo. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará decenas de plantas de café y varios sacos de fertilizantes para proteger sus tierras.
texts.en:
Judith is 22 years old. She is a hardworking woman who shares her life with her husband Ángel, who is 25, and their two year old daughter Luz Clarita. For more than two years, they have leased farmland on which they grow coffee and bananas. Judith and her husband have worked to generate more income to help cover the household expenses. At the same time, her husband works the fields of other farmers. He earns 20 PEN each day, but during the harvest season there is twice as much work, so Judith is also hired for this job. What she enjoys most is living in the country since the plants and the sounds of the animals convey a peace that makes her happy. On the flip side, she dislikes transporting her crops to the city over great distances since the sacks are heavy. However, she says the effort is worth it. Judith indicates the services she utilized have been quite substantial now that she has the chance to save toward the purchase of her own land in hopes of increasing production. Her greatest wish is to provide her daughter an adequate quality of life. “Each sacrifice is for my little girl, since she is my motivation each day,” says Judith.

This is her second loan with MFP. Judith is happy to continue working with her Communal Bank because she is familiar with their work methodology. The loan she requested will be used to buy dozens of coffee plants and sacks of fertilizers to help protect her land.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase coffee plants & fertilizers

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
La Sra. María C. es socia del banco comunal Poloma hace 3 años, siendo invitada por su mamá a formar parte de este gran grupo de mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras, vive en la comunidad de Maluay que pertenece a la parroquia el Valle, esta parroquia se caracteriza por sus verdes campos, llenas de cultivos de maíz, papas, etc., su gente es muy trabajadora, luchadora y siempre están en la búsqueda de un mejor futuro a sus familias.

Nuestra socia tiene 25 años de edad, vive en unión libre y fruto de esa relación ha concebido 3 hijos que se encuentran de 8, 6, 5 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la escuela, su esposo es maestro en la rama de la construcción, aun no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus suegros.

Doña María se dedica al arreglo de casas hace 3 años, en donde labora de 8 a.m. hasta las 3 p.m., también se dedica a la cría de animales como son pollos y cuyes, los mismos que vende en la ciudad de Cuenca. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento, su meta es de llegar a construir su casa propia para vivir junto a toda su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. María C. has been a member of the Poloma Communal Bank for three years. She was invited by her mother to join this great group of determined and enterprising women. María lives in the community of Maluay, which is part of El Valle Parish. This parish is known for its green fields full of corn, potatoes, and other crops. The local people work hard and struggle to achieve a better future for their families.

María is 25 years old, in a common law marriage, and has three children (ages 8, 6, and 5) that resulted from that relationship. The two older children are in school. Her husband works as a carpentry teacher. They do not have their own home, so they current live with her in-laws.

Doña María has been cleaning houses for three years and works from 8am until 3pm. She also raises animals, such as chickens and guinea pigs, and sells them in the city of Cuenca. This loan will be used to buy chickens and poultry feed. Her goal is to build a house of her own where she can live with her entire family.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chickens & poultry feed

loans.name: Enoc

texts.es: Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con el socio Enoc, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chinchero del Departamento del Cusco, su actividad económica principal es brindar servicios de taxi en la ciudad de Chichero y otra veces cubre la ruta Chichero – Cusco y viceversa y su actividad complementaria es la agricultura. Ya son cinco años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socio de la Fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito requiere ahorrar y después adquirir un vehículo.
texts.en:
On our visit to the community bank "Mateo Pumacahua," we spoke with Enoc, one of its members. He is single and lives in the city of Chinchero in the Cusco region. His principal economic activity is offering taxi services in the city of Chinchero, and sometimes he covers the Chinchero - Cusco (and return) route. His complementary activity is agriculture. He has already worked in this business for five years, and it is going very well for him, thanks to the effort that he puts into his work. Being a member of the Arariwa Foundation has helped him very much to aim higher and make his business grow. With this new loan, he needs to save and later acquire a vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To save and later acquire a vehicle.

loans.name: Sandra

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Sandra;  ella tiene 26 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, ella tiene 1 hijo pequeñito; Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia vende granos secos como habas secas, maíz, morado, maíz blanco, maíz amarillo, cereales, entre otros productos en el mercado de Bella Vista Urubamba. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos secos al por mayor y venderlos en su stand en el mercado de Bella Vista - Urubamba.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This community bank member belongs to the "PEROLNIYOC" group. She lives in the province of Urubamba, which is in the Cusco region. She is Sra. Sandra. She is 26 years old. She lives with her partner and has a small son. She alternates her household activities with retail sales. She sells dried grains such as dried beans, purple corn, white corn, yellow corn, and grains, among other products, in the Bella Vista - Urubamba market. She is applying for a loan to buy dried products at wholesale and sell them at her stand in the Bella Vista - Urubamba market. She is thankful for and values the support offered through loans and promises to make her payments in the established installments.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy dried products

loans.name: Yennifer

texts.es:
La socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; La socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Yennifer;  ella tiene 25 años de edad, la socia es soltera, La socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con el comercio minorista, la socia vende abarrotes en el mercado central, La socia vende arroz, azúcar, fideos, conservas, leche y más productos de primera necesidad. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de abarrotes y de este modo implementar su tienda y tner mayor venta.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The client belongs to the Perolniyoc Communal Bank (named after a waterfall and Incan archeological site). She lives in Urubamba Province, which is in the Department of Cusco. The client is named Yennifer. She is 25 years old and single. She divides her time between housework and her retail business; she sells groceries in the central market. Yennifer sells rice, sugar, pasta, canned foods, milk and other staple goods. She is asking for this loan to buy grocery items. She is grateful for and values the support offered to her through this medium, and she promises to make her loan payments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for grocery store

loans.name: Niger

texts.es: Níger tiene 18 años, es soltero, comparte su vida con sus padres y con uno de los 10 hermanos, ya que los mayores viven en Lima en búsqueda de mejores oportunidades laborales. Desde muy pequeño a Níger le enseñaron las técnicas del cultivo de café y plátano y durante estos 7 años ha aprendido todo sobre éste oficio. Ahora sabe distribuir bien su horario, se despierta a las 5 de la mañana para cuidar sus terrenos y a su retorno prepara los alimentos para sus padres, luego se dirige al colegio, donde pone todo su empeño para ser el mejor de su clase. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar porque según refiere verá recompensado su arduo trabajo, sabe que estas tierras que cultiva son la herencia que le dieron sus padres y no esta dispuesto a abandonarlos, ya que gracias a ello, obtiene buenas ganancias y con ello puede cubrir sus estudios y los gastos domésticos, entre otras cosas. Su prioridad es comprar más terrenos agrícolas, para incrementar su producción, principalmente plátanos, además planea construir una casa grande y cómoda en la ciudad, para instalar una ferretería y eso le ayudará a cumplir uno de sus máximos anhelos, que es estudiar medicina. Esta es la segunda  vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y demostró ser un socio muy puntual y entusiasta, por lo que es muy querido en su grupo comunal, donde le gusta laborar. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará varios sacos de fertilizantes, además de herramientas para la chacra como: machetes, costales, javas y trampas para animales.
texts.en:
Níger is 18 years old and single. He shares his life with his parents and with one of his 10 siblings, since the elder ones live in Lima looking for better work opportunities. Since he was very small, Níger has been taught techniques for growing coffee and bananas, and during these seven years he has learned everything about this job. Now, he knows how to manage his schedule well. He wakes up at 5 in the morning to take care of his land, and on his return he prepares food for his parents. Later he goes to school, where he puts all his effort into being the best in his class. What he likes most about his work is harvesting because he will see a reward for his hard work. He knows that this land he farms is the inheritance his parents gave him, and he will not abandon it since, thanks to it, he has a good income and can pay for his studies and the household expenses, among other things. His priority is to buy more farmland to increase his production, mainly of bananas. He also plans to build a large, comfortable house in the city in order to open a hardware store. This will help him to fulfill one of his greatest desires, which is to study medicine. This is the second loan Níger has had with MFP, and he has shown himself to be a very punctual and enthusiastic member. He is well-liked for this in his communal bank, where he likes to work. With the loan he is requesting, he will buy several sacks of fertilizer, as well as farm tools like: machetes, sacks, crates and traps for animals.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizers and tools

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Mateo Pumacahua se reúne en la ciudad D. Chicheros del departamento del Cusco,  esta ciudad es más conocida por las ruinas Incas que tiene, cuenta la historia que en tiempos pasados cuando aun no era ciudad en lo que ahora son sus calles había la casa del Inca “Túpac Inca Yupanqui”.  Es también muy interesante esta población no sólo por las ruinas y el templo, si no por los trajes y costumbres; además D. su colorida y concurrida feria dominical. 

Al visitar este banco comunal Mateo Pumacahua conversamos con la socia Paulina, tiene 66 años, es casada, tiene 3 hijos,  vive en la ciudad D. Chinchero del departamento del Cusco, su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio D. comida, ella acomodo una habitación D. su domicilio donD. abrió su tienda y ahí poder expender sus comidas tradicionales. Ya son 30 años que se dedica al negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo, el ser socia D. la fundación le ha ayudado mucho a superarse y hacer que su negocio crezca, con este nuevo crédito ella desea comprar más insumos como carne, arroz, fideos, muchos más comestibles.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mateo Pumacahua meets in the city of Chicheros in the department of Cusco. This city is well known for its Inca ruins and the history that in earlier times, when there was not yet a city where there are now streets, this was the site of the house of the Inca "Tupac Inca Yupanqui". The town is very interesting not only for its ruins and the temple, but for the dress and customs as well as the colorful and well attended Sunday fair. While visiting this communal bank Mateo Pumacahua, we talked with a member, Paulina, who is 66 years old, is married, has 3 children, and lives in the city of Chinchero in the department of Cusco. Her principal work is providing food service. She set up a room in her house where she opened a store and there she is able to sell her traditional foods. She has been working at this business for 30 years and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. Being a member of the foundation has helped her a great deal to improve herself and make her business grow. With this new loan she wants to buy more supplies like meat, rice, noodles, and many other food items.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Burke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more supplies like meat, rice, noodles, and many other food items.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Sofia;   ella tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo y su conyugue cría truchas en Urubamba, Nuestra socia alterna sus actividades del hogar con la educación. La socia es promotora en Ollantaytambo ubicado a 25 minutos de Urubamba. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para el hogar y pagar una pequeña deuda.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the “PEROLNIYOC” communal bank. She lives in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco. Her name is Sofia, and she is 32 years old. She has a live-in partner and one child. Her partner raises trout in Urubamba. Sofia divides her time between her household activities and her work in education. She provides educational support in the community of Ollantaytambo, 25 minutes from Urubamba. She is requesting the loan for household expenses and to pay a small debt. Sofia values and appreciates the support provided to her in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For household expenses and paying a small debt

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Ines;   ella tiene 55 años de edad, la socia es casada, tiene 1 hijo, su conyugue es agricultor y ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes, La socia se encarga de la administración de sus tienda de abarrotes en la provincia de Urubamba. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para implementar la tienda. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Ines belongs to the Perolniyoc Communal Bank and lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, Peru. Ines is 55 years old and married with one child. Her husband is a farmer and she has a small grocery store. She is the one responsible for the management of this store, located in Urubamba. She is asking for this loan to buy merchandise for her store. Ines values and is grateful for the support offered through microlending and promises to repay the loan as agreed.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es soltera y tiene 1 hijo, Rosa tiene un puesto en la plaza de armas de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende periódicos, semanarios, actividad que realiza todos los días.
Rosa pertenece al Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en quechua y lo que mas le gusta es el incentivo al ahorro. Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de periódicos.
Su mayor sueño es que su hijo culmine sus estudios y sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Rosa is single and has one son. She has a stall in the Plaza de Armas in the city of Ayacucho, Peru, where she sells newspapers and magazines. She works there every day of the week. Rosa belongs to the Imasumacc Communal Bank, whose name means "how beautiful" in Quechua. The thing she likes the most about being a member of this bank is the incentive to save money. Rosa needs a loan for 1500 Peruvian soles, which she will use to buy newspapers. Rosa's greatest dream is for her son to finish school and have a professional career.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of newspapers

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo tiene 54 años, comparte su vida con su esposa Antonia de 48 años y con 5 de sus 6 hijos, ya que el mayor trabaja de manera independiente, juntos viven en su casa propia. Este hombre trabajador, es conocido en su localidad como el “mil oficios”, ya que se dedica a varias actividades, como agricultor de café y plátano, albañil, sastre, panadero y carpintero en donde fabrica diversos muebles, que son vendidos en las ferias de su ciudad y entre sus vecinos, quienes le hacen pedidos especiales, es así que tiene 30 años practicando estas labores. Pablo, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposa y sus hijos en la agricultura, que es el trabajo que más ganancias le genera, ya que le permite brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Hasta ahora ha logrado cubrir los gastos domiciliarios, la educación de sus hijos además de invertir materiales para fabricar muebles. Lo que más le gusta es darle un acabado especial y pintar sus muebles y por tal motivo desea implementar su carpintería, además de mejorar la productividad de café, puesto que tiene planes de ser acopiador de café en su sector. Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP y se muestra orgulloso de continuar laborado con los integrantes de su grupo comunal, quienes son personas honestas y responsables y siempre trabajan de manera activa. 
Con el crédito que solicita, comprará maquinarias monofásicas, motores para disco que le servirán para cortar madera.
texts.en:
Pablo is 54 years old and shares his life with his wife Antonia who is 48, and with 5 of his 6 children, now that the eldest works independently. They all live in his own house. This hard-working man is known in his locality as having “a thousand skills” because he dedicates himself to various activities, including coffee and plantain farmer, brick layer, tailor, baker and carpenter – he even constructs diverse furniture which he sells in the city markets and among neighbors who submit special orders. Pablo has done these jobs for 30 years. He can count on the help of his wife and children in agriculture, the work that generates most of his income and permits him to offer the best to his family. Until now, he has been able to cover household costs and the education of his children, plus invest in materials to make furniture. What he likes most is to finish and paint his furniture, and for that reason, he wants to advance his carpentry and, in addition, to improve the productivity of his coffee, since he plans to be the coffee wholesaler in his sector. This is the 2nd time he has requested a loan with MFP and he is very proud of continuing to collaborate with the members of his communal group, who are honest and responsible persons who always work in an active manner. With the requested loan he will purchase special tools and equipment for cutting wood.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING MACHINES FOR CUTTING WOOD TO MAKE FURNITURE

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Narcisa;   ella tiene 48 años de edad, la socia es casada, tiene 4 hijos,  ella tiene una tienda de abarrotes, Nuestra socia trabaja implementando y vendiendo ella misma en su propia tienda de abarrotes. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mercadería para implementar la tienda. 

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
