Narcisa belongs to the Perolniyoc Communal Bank. She lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, Peru. Narcisa is 48 years old and is married with four children. She owns a small grocery store which she runs and operates herself. She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise for the store. Narcisa values and is grateful for the support offered by microlending, and she promises to repay the loan as agreed.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise for a small grocery store.

loans.name: Ma Guadalupe

texts.es: La señora Ma. Guadalupe Rodríguez cuenta con un negocio de la venta de ropa usada por más de 10 años local ubicado en un lugar muy concurrido de la ciudad, donde le va muy bien en sus ventas. Pero en la ciudad llovió mucho por lo que su casa se inundo y la ropa de su venta se le mojo mucho y alguna ya no sirve; es por ello que requiere de un préstamo para volver a surtir más mercancía variedad de colores y tallas.
texts.en:
Maria Guadalupe Rodríguez has owned a business selling used clothing for more than 10 years. Her stand is located in a very busy part of the city, so her sales are very good. However, recent heavy rains caused flooding in her house and many of the clothes she had stored for sale were ruined by the water. This is why Maria is asking for a loan. She would like to buy more merchandise so that she will have clothes of various colors and sizes to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To vary her stock of clothing for sale

loans.name: Delia Luz

texts.es:
Delia es socia del Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en quechua
Delia es casada y tiene 1 hijo, Delia se dedica a L. venta D. ropa y cosméticos por catálogos D. acuerdo a los pedidos D. sus clientes que son amigos y familiares, L. mayoría D. sus ventas son al crédito. Su préstamo será invertido en L. compra D. cremas, perfumes, labiales.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the community bank Imasumacc, which means How Lovely in Quechua.

Delia is married and has 1 child. Delia sells clothes and cosmetics from catalogs, filling orders from her customers that are her friends and family. The majority of her sells are on credit. Her loan will be invested in buying crèmes, perfumes and lip gloss. Her dream is to grow her business.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cremes, perfumes and lip gloss to sell

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
El sueño de Florentina es ampliar su establo, tener mas animales para producir leche y derivados, Florentina tiene sus tierras en la comunidad de Sachabamba en donde se dedica al engorde de ganado vacuno que luego vende en las ferias, además Florentina tiene un puesto en el mercado Nery García en donde vende verduras al por mayor y menor, productos que son adquiridos de los productores. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de zanahoria, cebolla, tomate.
Florentina tiene 3 hijos y desea que todos ellos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Florentina’s dream is to expand her stables, to have more animals to produce milk and dairy products. Florentina has her land in the community of Sachabamba where she fattens cattle to sell at markets. Florentina also has a stand at the Nery Garcia market where she sells vegetables wholesale and retail, products that she purchases direct from the producers. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of carrots, onions and tomatoes. Florentina has 3 children and hopes that they will all become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy carrots, onions and tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es: Gabriela L. S. y su esposo se dedican a la elaboración de pan dulce este distribuyen por las colonias ofreciéndolo con una bocina y así es como ellos venden toda su mercancía. La panadería es llamada La Bendición que ya tiene una antigüedad de 6 años, negocio que ha beneficiado en sustento de esta familia. Gabriela esta muy agradecida ya que con este será su segundo crédito y que gracias a el ha ido prosperando. Para seguir teniendo más ganancias necesita un préstamo para comprar más producto para elaboración del pan.
texts.en:
Gabriela L. S. and her husband work in the production of sweet bread that they distribute throughout residential developments, advertising it by loudspeaker. This is how they sell all their merchandise. The bakery is called La Bendicion, is 6 years old and has been sustained by the family. Gabriela is very grateful that this will be her second loan and that thanks to that she has been prospering. In order to continue making a profit she needs a loan to buy more products for the production of the bread.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase supplies and inventory

loans.name: Rosmery

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Rosmery;   ella tiene 23 años de edad, la socia es soltera., Nuestra socia trabaja en el restaurante el embrujo, ella es moza, La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar víveres para su hogar y un televisor.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Rosemery belongs to the Perolniyoc Communal Bank. She lives in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cusco, Peru. Rosemery is 23 years old and is single. She works as a waitress in a restaurant called El Embrujo. She is asking for a loan to buy items for her house, including a television. Rosemery values and is grateful for the support offered by microlending, and she promises to repay the loan as agreed.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a television and other items.

loans.name: Fanny Dareli

texts.es:
Fanny integra al Banco Comunal Imasumacc que significa Que Bello en quechua y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones.
Fanny es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo, tiene cabinas de Internet en la casa de su suegra, en donde también vende golosinas y algunos artículos de librería, ella se encarga de la atención y cuenta con la ayuda de su hermana. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de golosinas y algunas reparaciones de las computadoras.
Fanny desea tener otro negocio de venta de repuestos y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Fanny is a member of the Emasumacc Communal Bank. The bank’s name means How Beautiful in Quechua. What she likes the best are the trainings. Fanny is in a common law marriage, and she has one child. She has Internet booths in her mother-in-law’s house. She also sells sweets and some bookstore items. She runs the business with help from her sister. She will use the loan to buy sweets and to make some computer repairs. Fanny wishes to have another business selling replacement parts, and she wants to keep progressing.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sweets and to make some computer repairs

loans.name: Yazmin Yamara

texts.es: Yazmin Yamara es una joven que le gusta ir prosperando poco a poco sobre todo por que es madre de familia por quien tiene que salir a delante. Su esposo es un hombre que trabaja en maquiladora pero Yazmin para apoyarlo con los gastos se dedica a la venta de ropa usada actividad que realiza los fines de semana en las pulgas. Este negocio ya tiene un año al que en este momento desea invertir más para que le siga generando más ganancias.
texts.en:
Yazmin Yamara is a young woman who likes to advance little by little. She does this primarily because she is a mother and she has to get ahead. Her husband works in a factory. In order to help him with the expenses, Yazmin sells used clothes. She does this at the flea markets on the weekends. She has had this business for one year. Now she wants to invest more so that she can keep generating more income.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es: La señora Vicenta Rodríguez se dedica a la venta de ropa usada por más de 12 años donde ella tiene zapatos, monos de peluche y ropa. Este negocio ya es conocido por sus clientes pues ella tiene amabilidad con ellos al ofrecer sus artículos con el apoyo de su esposo que también es comerciante ambulante para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Vicenta necesita el apoyo de esta institución para seguir ofreciendo calidad de lo que ella vende.
texts.en:
Vicenta Rodríguez has been selling used clothes for over 12 years. She sells shoes, stuffed animals, and clothes. Her business is well known by her customers. She is friendly to them when she shows them her products. Her husband helps her. He, too, is a street vendor in order to cover the family expenses. Vicenta needs help from this institution to keep offering quality goods.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock her business

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Irene;   ella tiene 32 años de edad, la socia es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos estudiantes; Nuestra socia es promotora de pronoei; La socia también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, la socia trabaja en este ministerio público desde hace 4 años, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores y para comprar algunos víveres para el hogar.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our client belongs to the “PEROLNIYOC” communal bank. She lives in the province of Urubamba, which belongs to the department of Cusco.

Our client is Irene and she is 32 years old. She has a live-in partner and has 2 school-age children. She is a promoter of PRONOEI (acronym for the Peruvian ‘Non-formal program of initial education’). Irene is also involved in raising younger animals. She has worked in the public ministry for more than 4 years. She is requesting the loan to purchase younger animals and to purchase some supplies for the home.

She is grateful and values the support provided by these means. She promises to repay her loan in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Miguelina

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Miguelina;   ella tiene 42 años de edad, la socia es casada y tiene 2 hijos estudiantes en Cusco en la superior; su esposo es agricultor y la socia vende verduras en el mercado y también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y los vende. Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar animales menores para la crianza y la venta.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Our client belongs to the “PEROLNIYOC” communal bank. She lives in the province of Urubamba, which belongs to the department of Cusco.

Our client is Miguelina and she is 42 years old. She is married and has 2 children who are students of higher education in Cusco. Her husband is a farmer and she sells vegetables at the market and also raises young animals and sells them. She is requesting this loan to purchase younger animals to raise and sell.

She is grateful and values the support provided by these means. She promises to repay her loan in the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of younger animals

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María Del Carmen es una mujer divorciada que sola ha sacado a sus hijos adelante a pesar de cómo esta la situación económica en esta ciudad. Ella es una persona emprendedora en este momento cuenta con la venta de ropa usada y la venta de botas vaqueras que trae desde el centro del país. A su cargo tiene un hijo joven que esta estudiando en el Bachiller y es por ello que esta preocupada por el bienestar y la preparación académica. María del Carmen solicita un crédito para invertir mercancía y así seguir vendiendo para ofrecer a su hijo una mejora calidad de vida.
texts.en:
María del Carmen is a divorced woman that has only helped her children get ahead despite how the economic situation is in this city. She is an enterprising woman and she currently sells used clothing and sells cowboy boots that she brings from the center of the country. She has one son under her care who is studying in high school and it is because of this that she is worried about his well-being and academic preparation. María del Carmen is requesting a loan to invest in merchandise so that she can continue selling to offer her son a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenecen al banco comunal “PEROLNIYOC”; Nuestra socia vive en la provincia de Urubamba perteneciente al departamento del Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la Sra. Nieves;   ella tiene 53 años de edad, la socia es casada y la socia se dedica a la artesanía, Nuestra socia vende todo tipo de suvenirs en pachar. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar al por mayor artesanías de Pisac.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Nieves is a member of the “PEROLNIYOC” community bank; she lives in the province of Urubamba, in the department of Cusco. Nieves is 53 years old and married; she works selling artisanal crafts. She sells all types of souvenirs in Pachar, and she is applying for this loan to buy wholesale crafts from Pisac. She is grateful for and values the support offered to her with this loan, and she promises to complete her repayments in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Mairead Harris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of crafts from Pisac

loans.name: Gloria Maria

texts.es:
La Sra. Gloria Q. es socia del banco comunal Cochapamba, esta comunidad pertenece a la parroquia de El Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por su productividad agrícola, la misma que solo es para abastecer a su población, su gente también se dedican a la ganadería, muchos salen a la ciudad en busca de un mejor trabajo, como también una gran parte de la población joven a migrado a otras partes del mundo para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus familias.

Nuestra socia tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esa unión ha concebido 7 hijos de los cuales dos se encuentran casados y viven de manera independiente, una hija soltera que vive fuera del país y le ayuda un poco económicamente, dos de sus hijos trabajan y estudian y sus dos últimos se encuentran estudiando en el colegio, su esposo se dedica a trabajar en su taller de estucos (realización de cielos rasos).

La Sra. Gloria se dedica a los quehaceres en su hogar y también colabora en el taller de su esposo. Se encuentra en la banca comunal hace 3 años, los créditos le han beneficiado para crecer en su taller. Este nuevo crédito que recibe de parte de la Fundación Espoir lo va a invertir en la compra de materiales como cemento, yeso, etc. Su mayor sueño es ver a sus hijos llegar a ser unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Gloria Q. is a partner in the Cochapamba community bank, located to the El Valle parish. This parish is know for its agricultural activity, which feeds the local population. The people there also raise cattle, though many have migrated to the city in search of work, while a large number of the youth have migrated around the world to provide a better future for their families. Our partner is 49, married, and has borne 7 children. Two of the children are married and live independently, an unmarried daughter lives out of the country and helps out economically, two sons work and study and the other two are in high school. Her husband has a stucco shop (finishing ceilings). Gloria takes care of the household chores as well as helping out in her husband's shop. She has been part of the community bank for three years and the loans have helped grow the business. She will invest this new loan from Fundacion Espoir, in the purchase of cement, plaster etc. Her greatest dream is to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, plaster, paint, lime, resin etc.

loans.name: Maria Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. María Vanegas es una socia activa del banco comunal Chochapamba, hace 2 años, en el cual ha logrado una muy buena amistad con todas sus amigas y compañeras. Vive en la comunidad de San Miguel que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por su productividad agrícola, la misma que abastece a su población, su gente también se dedica a la ganadería, muchos salen a la ciudad en busca de un mejor trabajo, como también una gran parte de la población joven a migrado a otras partes del mundo, para brindarles un mejor futuro a sus familias.

Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres de su casa y al mismo tiempo aprovecha para criar animales como: pollos, cuyes, los mismos que los vende en su propia comunidad.

Doña María tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de los cuales dos son casados y ya viven de manera independiente, su último hijo es soltero, se dedica a trabajar y ayuda en la economía del hogar, su esposo es albañil actividad que le ha beneficiado para salir adelante con su familia, gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia. El nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la comprar de pollos para seguir creciendo en este negocio y salir adelante.
texts.en:
María has been an active member of the Chochapamba communal bank for the past 2 years, in which she has formed good relationships with all of her friends and co-members. She lives in the community of San Miguel, which belongs to the parish of Valle. This parish is known for its agricultural productivity, which supplies its population. Its people are also involved in cattle farming. Many leave for the city in search of a better job, and a large portion of the young generation has migrated to other parts of the world to provide a better future for their families.

María does the household chores in her house and at the same time takes of advantage of the time to raise animals such as chickens and guinea pigs, which she sells in her community.

María is 49 years old, married, and in her marriage has conceived 3 children, two of which are married and now live independently and their youngest son is single. María works and helps the household economy. Her husband is a builder, a job which has helped him to get ahead with his family. Thanks to her husband’s work, they have been able to build their own house. She is going to invest the new loan in the purchase of chickens to continue growing her business and to get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Nancy Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. Nancy V. es socia del banco comunal Cochapamba, vive en la comunidad de San Miguel, perteneciente a la parroquia del Valle, esta parroquia es conocida por su productividad agrícola, la misma que abastece a su población, también se dedican a la ganadería, muchos salen a la ciudad en busca de un mejor trabajo, una gran parte de la población joven a migrado a otras partes del mundo para brindarles un mejor futuro a  sus familias.

Doña Nancy se encuentra cerca de cumplir 45 años de edad, es casada y en su unión ha concebido 4 hijos, su primera hija tiene 23 años, casada y vive de manera independiente, su segundo hijo de 21 años estudia en el universidad, el tercero de 13 años estudia en el colegio, y su último hijo tiene apenas 5 años de edad, su esposo ha migrado para brindarles un mejor futuro. Con el esfuerzo del trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Nuestra socia se dedica a los quehaceres domésticos y también a la cría de animales como: borregos, pollos los que vende en su propia comunidad. Con el nuevo crédito que recibe de parte de la fundación Espoir lo va a invertir en vitaminas y alimento para sus animales, su meta es seguir creciendo y criar más animalitos.
texts.en:
Nancy V. is a member of the Cochapamba communal bank. She lives in the community of San Miguel, which belongs to the parish of Valle. This parish is known for its agricultural productivity, which supplies its population. Its people are also involved in cattle farming. Many leave for the city in search of a better job, and a large portion of the young generation has migrated to other parts of the world to provide a better future for their families.

Nancy is almost 45 years old, married, and in her marriage has conceived 4 children. Her first daughter is 23 years old, married and lives independently. Her second child, her son, is 21 years old and is in college. Her third is 13 years old and he is in high school, and her fourth is just 5 years old. Her husband has migrated to provide them with a better future. With her husband’s work, they have been able to build their own house.

Nancy does the household chores and also raises animals such as sheep and chickens, which she sells in her own community. With the new loan that she receives from the Espoir foundation, she will invest in vitamins and food for her animals. Her goal is to continue growing and to raise more animals.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grass, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Maria Nelly

texts.es: La solicitante es casada, tiene su negocio de venta de comida frente a la ciudad universitaria su mayor afluencia de publico son los estudiantes de la UNICA. Su esposo trabaja por la sierra como ingeniero tiene 2 hijas como carga familiar. Su casa es de material noble. Solicita el credito pa incremento de capital y arreglo de su local.
texts.en:
This client is married and has her own food sales business in front of the university. Her greatest influx from the public is the students of UNICA (Universidad Nacional ‘San Luis Gonzaga’ de Ica). Her husband works in the mountains as an engineer. She has 2 daughters under her care and their house is made with solid materials. She is requesting the loan to increase capital and to make repairs to her place of business.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase capital and maintenance work on business

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta C. is from the village of Minang, Roxas. She is 66 years old. Marietta is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Marietta owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily-use products, such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste, in the local community. Marietta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities. In 2008, Marietta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marietta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Marietta is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used for additional capital for her sari-sari (variety) store. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Marietta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. loans.name: Norly

texts.en: Norly V. is from the village of Olingan, Dipolog City. She is 39 years old. Norly is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Norly owns and operates a service-based business and at the same time operates a retail store. The main source of income for the retail business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Norly is just starting this business. In 2006, Norly joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Norly has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,500.00 Philippine pesos from PMPC, a Kiva partner. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Norly is requesting a new loan of 5,000.00 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials for the repair of her motor-cab. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Norly from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for the family's daily consumption and to support the education of her child. About PMPC Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. Antonia U. is from the village of Minang Roxas. She is 69 years old. Antonia is married and has 9 adult-aged children. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

       About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her fish vending business.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma D. is a 53 year- old loving woman to her husband, six children and three grand children. Though her eldest 27 year- old child has his own family and house, Emma still extends her moral and financial support to her grand children, especially to the one who has a kidney problem, while she also supports the needs of her five remaining children under her custody. Their age ranges are from 19 to 24 years old. The youngest (15 years old) attends school and the rest are in high school and college under graduates.

Despite many challenges Emma goes on achieving her dream of graduating her children from college and little by little improve their family lifestyle. She feel strong and courageous and she has made a request for a loan through ASHI. With this loan, she will be able to put up her own business which is variety store and to improve her self confidence by dealing with her costumers.  The profits she earns are her means of supporting her family. 

Furthermore, Emma wants to expand her business until it becomes stable and profitable. She hopes to satisfy her customers by providing them with all of their daily basic needs without them spending for transportation by going to the public market.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items, foodstuff, and beverages to increase the inventory of her variety store.

loans.name: Menda

texts.en:
Despite the fact that Menda S. J.’s three children, aged from 20 to 27, are already adults with her two eldest now having their own family, she still doesn’t want to resign from her career of being a mother to them. She wants to support their lives and those of their own families until they can get out from the umbrella of poverty. Menda’s husband was unemployed and that has added to the challenges of her life as a woman and the need to become productive.

With faith that one day she will be able to find a way to improve the life of her family, Menda was very happy to learn about ASHI way back in 2005. Then Menda and her husband agreed that she must join ASHI so she could request a loan which would be their source of financial capital to start up a business to earn a daily income. They thought of setting up a small eatery since her husband is a good cook.

After several loans from ASHI, their eatery has eventually grown and has been sustained. Menda has also been able to finance a 'buy and sell' business in partnership with her unemployed eldest son. Proceeds are equally divided between them so her son can support his own family's needs. The loan will be used to purchase bulk ingredients for cooking foods for her eatery. Some of the loan will be used to purchase bulk onions, salt and garlic for her son's 'buy and sell' business. As much as possible, Menda wants to grow and stabilize her eatery and her 'buy and sell' business through the support of loans through ASHI. Proceeds of her business would enable her to support her dream of sending her two children back to school until they graduate from college so they can have a different kind of life in the future - a life that is not poor.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her eatery and to buy food items for her son's business

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
As a “sari-sari” (variety) store owner, Bernadita D. hopes that someday through her store proceeds she will be able to set up a savings fund to finance building a comfortable better house which would be able to accommodate all of her eight children. Though her store is currently small selling only a few varieties of grocery items, foodstuffs and beverages as per the definition of  “sari-sari”, Bernadita is still hopeful that her aspirations will come true in future as she is able to request another loan after paying off the previous one. This will help her to support the growth of her business resulting in much greater profit.

Because life was very poor for Bernadita before she joined ASHI and her husband is only a small-time hired laborer, she wasn’t able to support the education of her five older children. All of them have only reached high school thus they are not able to be employed where they would receive a regular higher salary. Despite this, Bernadita still feels happy because her two sons are able to have their own livelihood as a security guard and a hired driver. Nevertheless, she still wants her three younger children to be able to graduate from college and have their own careers in future which is much better that what she and her husband have.

loans.use: To purchase bulk grocery items, foodstuffs and beverages to add to her store's inventory

loans.name: Sope Serigne Barra Mbacke Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SERIGNE BARRA MBACK a est créé il y a de cela 6 mois, il est composé de 09 femmes toutes issues du même Banc Villageois et du même village. Elles se sont organisées par affinité, elles sont âgées de 30 à 60 ans et sont au moins mères de 2 enfants. Dans le village se trouve un grand marché hebdomadaire qui draine des milliers de personnes par semaine. Ce qui fait que l'activité commerciale est permanente dans le village et contribue au développement économique de la localité et ses environs. Le nouveau crédit du groupe de solidarité lui permettra de renforcer ses activités économiques et de les diversifier. Leurs activités s’articulent au tour de la vente de céréales locales, de produits halieutiques, d’arachide et de crème glacée pour les détentrices de réfrigérateur. 

Madame Diouma D., la présidente du groupe de solidarité, à droite de la photo en grand boubou jaune et emmitouflée avec une écharpe blanche  est âgée de 53 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Elle joue un rôle fondamental dans le groupe par rapport au renforcement de la solidarité entre les membres. Elle est vendeuse de beignets et de condiments de cuisine depuis 04 ans. Son financement lui a permis de renforcer son activité de petit commerce. Son objectif est de réaliser plus de bénéfices et participer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille par la nourriture et la bonne couverture sanitaire et scolaire des enfants.
texts.en:
The SERIGNE BARRA MBACK group was created 6 months ago. It is composed of nine women all from the same “Banc Villageois” and the same village. Their mutual affinity brought them together. They are from 30 to 60 years old and are the mothers of at least two children. There is a large weekly market in the village that draws thousands of people every week. This means that there is a constant business activity in the village and it contributes to the economic development of the town and its vicinity. The new loan to the solidarity group will allow it to strengthen and diversify its economic activities. Their activities are structured around the sale of local cereals, seafood products, peanuts and ice cream for those who own a refrigerator. Mrs. Diouma D., the president of the solidarity group, is on the right of the photo wearing a large yellow “boubou” wrapped in a white scarf. She is 53-years old, married and the mother of six children. She plays a fundamental role in the group, strengthening the solidarity between members. She has been selling “beignets” and condiments for four years. Her funding has allowed her to bolster her small business. Her goal is to make more profit and to participate in the improvement of her family’s living conditions through food, health care and schooling.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To strengthen the economic activities of the solidarity group.

loans.name: Idania

texts.es: La solicitante es casada se dedica  a la venta de menu en su casa, ubicado en av Madrid N° 884 La Tinguiña, vive con su eposo tiene 2 hijos. Se dedica al negocio de venta de menu en su casa y tiene un ingreso semanal de  S/. 270.00. El destino del credito es para compra de mobiliario de su negocio: sillas, mesas, para atender a sus comensales.
texts.en:
Idania is married and runs a small restaurant in her house, which is located on Madrid Avenue in La Tinguiña. She lives with her husband and has 2 children. She makes about 270 Peruvian soles a week from this venture. She will use the loan money to buy chairs and tables for her restaurant, in order to better serve her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchas of furniture for her restaurant

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
Valeria es pequeña productora que habita en el municipio de Nueva Guinea en la comarca Villa Alvarez junto a su esposo y su hijo,  quienes trabajan como familia en las actividades del campo. Valeria  desde muy pequeña ha trabajado en esta actividad ya que sus padres le enseñaron como cuidar del ganado y la agricultura, y con esta experiencia ha podido tener su propio inventario ganadero. 

Esta solicitando su 5to crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para compra de ternero desarrollo, para engordarlos y posteriormente comercializarlos  a un precio justo en el que pueda recibir mayor ganancia, y de esta manera fortalecer su inventario ganadero, y mejorar la calidad de vida del núcleo familiar.  

El mayor anhelo de Valeria es de aumentar su inventario ganadero, así salir adelante con otros ingresos, para tener un vida justa y humana.
texts.en:
Valeria is a small cattle rancher who lives in the Nueva Guinea municipality in the rural community of Villa Alvarez. She lives with her husband and son. They work the land together as a family. Valeria has worked in this activity since she was a little girl. Her parents taught her how to take care of the cattle and to farm. With this experience she has been able to have her own herd of livestock. She is requesting her fifth loan with the AFODENIC institution. She will buy a calf to raise and fatten. Later she will sell it for a fair price so that she can get greater income. This is the way to strengthen her herd of cattle and improve the quality of life for her family. Valeria’s greatest desire is to increase her herd. That way she will get ahead with other income in order to have a just and humane life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a calf

loans.name: Jose Tomas

texts.es:
Don José Tomás es casado habita en el municipio de Nueva Guinea en la Comarca Caño Blanco junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa e hijos, los que le ayudan a desarrollar su actividades de su finca.  Desde muy joven y gracias a su padre se ha dedicado  a las actividades agropecuarias:  como el establecimiento de cultivos de granos basicos, raices y tuberculos, ordeño y cuido de su inventario ganadero, su finca de 50 Mzs cuenta con buen manejo sanitario y nutricional.

Esta solicitando su 8vo credito para compra de ternero desarrollo, para cuidarlos y engordarlos para que puedan alcanzar el peso que requiere el mercado nacional e internacional, y que al venderlos pueda obtener mayores ganancias que le ayudara a brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su núcleo familiar, su mayor sueño es salir adelante con su inventario, pues es el patrimonio de su familia.
texts.en:
Don José Tomás is married, he lives in the municipality of Nueva Guinea in the Comarca Caño Blanco with his wife and children who all help with the activities of his farm. Thanks to his father he has been carrying out farming activities since he was very young, such as growing basic grains, roots, and tubers as well as milking and taking care of his livestock. His farm measures 50 Mzs with good sanitary and nutritional conditions.

He is requesting his 8th loan to buy calves in order to fatten them until they reach the weight required by the national and international market, and then sell them to obtain higher profits to allow him and his family to obtain better living conditions. It is his dream to increase his inventory as it is the patrimony of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase products.

loans.name: Juan Zenon

texts.es:
Juan Zenón de 47 años de edad esta casado con la Sra. Xiomara Amador, viven junto a sus hijos en la Comarca El Jicaro, jurisdiccion de Nueva Guinea, en donde junto a  su esposa e hijos desarrollan las actividades de su finca,  desde muy joven ha trabajado en las actividades agropecuarias y gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio tiene su pequeña finca en la que se dedica al establecimiento de cultivos de granos basicos, establecimeinto de musacea, ordeño y cuido de su inventario ganadero, de igual manera el mantenimiento de la finca, la que cuenta con buen manejo sanitario y nutricional, ademas por la venta de productos lacteos recibe ingresos adicionales para el sustento familiar.  

Esta solicitando su 1er credito para compra de ternero desarrollo, los que pretende cuidarlos y engordarlos para que cuando alcancen el peso que requiere el mercado nacional e internacional, pueda comercializarlos a un excelente precio que le permita obtener buenas ganancias que le ayudaran a darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.  

Sueña con poder darle a su familia buenas condiciones y fortalecer su inventario ganadero, ya que es el patrimonio que les dejara cuando falte.
texts.en:
Juan Zenón is 47 years old, married to Mrs. Xiomara Amador. They live with their children in the Comarca El Jicaro, jurisdiction of Nueva Guinea where he works his farm together with his wife and children. Since very young he has worked in farming and thanks to his effort and sacrifice he owns a small farm where he grows basic grains and musaceae, milks and takes care of his livestock as well as the maintainance of the farm which has good sanitary and nutritional conditions. He also receives extra income to support his family by selling dairy products .

He is requesting his first loan to buy calves, which he will look after and fatten, and when they reach the weight required by the national and international market he will sell them at an excellent price which will allow him to obtain good profit to improve the living conditions of his family.

It is his dream to give his family good conditions and increase his livestock as it represents the patrimony of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of calves.

loans.name: Jose Antonio

texts.es:
Josè Antonio de 33 años de edad habita en la Cmca. El Jicaro del municipio de San Miguelito junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa la Sra. Marisol Morales y sus 2 niños menores de edad.  Cuenta con una gran experiencia en la actividad agropecuaria pues desde muy joven se ha dedicado al cuido de su pequeña finca de 40 Mzs en donde realiza ordeño de su ganado, elaboracion de queso, establecimiento de cultivos.  

Esta solicitando su 4to crédito a la instituciòn de AFODENIC con el objetivo de comprar terneros de desarrollo, los cuales los cuidara y engordara para comercializarlos cuando obtengan el peso del mercado, esperando obtener ganancias que le permitan mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José Antonio is 33 years od and lives in the Comarca El Jícaro of the municipality of San Miguelito with his wife, Mrs. Marisol Morales, and their 2 young children. He has a lot of farming experience as he has been taking care of his small far of 40 Mzx since he was very young, he milks his cows and makes cheese as well as grows crops.

He is requesting his fourth loan with the AFODENIC to buy calves which he will look after and fatten to sell when they have reached the market weight. He hopes the profits will allow him to improve the living conditions of his family.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase calves

loans.name: Consolatrix

texts.en:
Consolatrix B. is from the village of Pb. Manukan. She is 54 years old. Consolatrix is married and has 2 adult-aged children. To make a living, Consolatrix owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Consolatrix has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Consolatrix joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Consolatrix is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used additional capital for her sari-sari store. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Consolatrix from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her  family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: additional capital for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene N. is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Barangay Narawis, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by selling spices. Her husband helps her run the business, and they have 3 young children who are between 2 and 6 years old.

Arlene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the support of loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase the family's income by engaging in the spice business. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 15,000 from her business activities.

Arlene is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,000 was used to fund operations of her spice business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is seeking her 11th loan, in the amount of Php 19,000, which she intends to use to sustain her spice business. Arlene is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, providing them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To fund her spice business

loans.name: Bernadita

texts.en:
Bernardita E. is a married woman who supports her family by selling herbal products. She lives in Canaway, Siaton, Negros Oriental with her husband and their 9 children, who are between 13 and 34 years of age.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her herbal products business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Bernardita is now borrowing PHP 19,000 so that she can have additional working capital for her business. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Bernardita aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miralyn

texts.en:
Miralyn R. is a married woman who supports her family by running a general store. She lives in Brgy.3 Siaton, Negros Oriental with her husband and their 3 children, who are 26, 28 and 29 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2000 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000.

Miralyn is now borrowing PHP 15,000 to use as additional working capital. This will be her 16th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Miralyn aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon--a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Chroeng

texts.en: Mrs. K. is a 50-year-old cultivator who resides in the capital, Phnom Penh. K. was married, but her husband died of senility years ago. She now has four children who are no longer in school. To help cover the family’s daily expenses, three of her children work in the construction field, while the other works with her in the farming business. K. owns a piece of farmland located away from the watering system, so she can hardly irrigate her crop. To solve the problem, K. is asking for a loan to purchase a machine that she uses to pump the water for her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a machine for pumping water for her crops

loans.name: Mungunzul

texts.en: Mungunzul G. is 20 years old. She got married in August 2009 and lives with her husband in a traditional Mongolian housing tent, called a ger, neighboring her mother's home. Their life condition is good and their furniture is quite new, because the couple just got married. The husband works as a porter at Narantuul market, loading and hauling luggage and goods.  He earns 200,000 MNT wage per month. They have not planned to have a baby yet. Her mother, G., has been running a shoe sales business for a long time and purchased a stall at the market for her daughter, Mungunzul. Mungunzul has not got much business experience yet, so she asks help from her mother. This time Mungunzul is trying to go to Erlian, a Chinese border city and trading center, to purchase products herself in order to gain experience and run her business independently. Mungunzul is a very modest girl. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase kids' sports shoes and summer shoes.

loans.use: To purchase kids shoes to sell.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Gantulga M.  is 42 years old, lives with his daughter, son and mother in a traditional housing tent called a ger. His health condition is good. After graduation from the driving course, his son will help him to run a taxi. Gantulga has been working as a taxi driver since 2005 with his own car. His daily revenue is approximately 30-40 thousand tugrugs. Half of the revenue is used to fill the car with petrol. Last year, the plot of land on where they live suffered from flood and he repaired the basement of his house with the loan he had received. He is now expanding his house. Gantulga is a hardworking and modest person. He says, “What I want most is to complete our house building.” He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan for house expansion and purchasing some construction materials such as an iron roof, sand, gravel, door, window and timber.

loans.use: To expand his house.

loans.name: Samnang

texts.en:
Mrs. Samnang S., age 52 years, is a widow with nine children: one son and eight daughters. Six of them are married and live outside the family home, two assist their mother in the business and another one attends school. They are living along national road number one, about thirty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Samnang has just been selling soup, Chinese noodles, coffee and porridge in her village for six months. She hopes to expand the shelter where she operates the business, so Samnang is asking for her first of $1,000 to use for the purpose. She will also use a part of her loan to purchase soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: To expand the shelter where she sells soup, Chinese noodles, coffee and porridge and buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Sokno

texts.en:
Mr. S. Um, is 37 years old and his wife, Mrs. Chantha Um, 36, live along National Road Number One about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 1991 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. S. was not in the photo, his wife was available instead. 

S. has been selling cows for ten years. He buys cows from other villages far a way from his house and sells them to the slaughterhouse. His wife has been farming for seven years. She grows green beans on her farmland in the village. S. is asking for his first loan of 600USD to purchase additional cows for resale.

loans.use: To purchase cows for resale.

loans.name: Sovannara

texts.en:
Mr. Sovannara R., age 47 (shown in the picture), and his wife, Mrs. Sophy Long, age 38, live in a small village outside of Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1986 and have four children: three sons and one daughter. One of them is married and lives outside the family home, two attend school and another one stays at home. Besides his children, he also has his mother living with him.      

Sovannara has been a taxi driver for ten years. He drives garment factory workers from his village to the factory and back. Mrs. Sophy Long stays at home.

Sovannara hopes to put an addition on his house. It will be better for family members to live. So, he is asking for his first loan in the amount of $500 to use for the project.

loans.use: To put an addition on his house.

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en: Mr. Thoeun R. (shown in the photo), 27, and his wife, Mrs. Sarat Choy, 27, have been married since 2009 and just have a young son. They are living across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Thoeun has been a chef since 2006. He cooks for a restaurant in Phnom Penh. His wife is a cleaner. She works along with her husband. The couple do not have their own transportation to work and very often they spend a lot of money on traveling costs. Facing this, Thoeun is asking for a loan of $500 to purchase a motorbike for commuting.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Altanshagai

texts.en: Altanshagai D., age 31, lives with his parents together in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a ger. His father is a guard and his mother runs a small shop attached to their fence. Since Altanshagai started his business activity in 2008, his work has been very stable. After graduating from high school, he attended a mobile phone repair and service course in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Now he is studying in a language training center to learn Chinese in order to import cheaper mobile phone spare parts from China. Altanshagai is a hardworking, optimistic and aggressive person. He says, “I have never asked for money from my parents for my living. Also, I bought a small car and now I have a plan to expand my workplace. I am able to make money for my Chinese language training fees from my mobile repair business.” Altanshagai is requesting a 560,000 MNT loan to purchase mobile phone spare parts such as displays, chargers, key buttons and so on.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone spare parts

loans.name: Roberta

texts.en:
Roberta R., 42, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Roberto R., a construction worker, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her frozen food business while overseeing operations of her clothing stall.

Roberta has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow six times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 15,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying more products to be incorporated into her current product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow. She also hopes to have her house repaired so that her family can have a safe and comfortable home.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary D., 58, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Vicente D., a driver, they are blessed in their marriage. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own doormat-making business while overseeing operations of their jeepney.

Mary has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow six times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her doormat business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying raw materials needed to continue operations of both her rug-making business and their jeepney.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can slowly build up her very own jeepney fleet.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw materials

Helen O., 46, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Felix O., a construction worker/coal businessman, they are blessed with five children. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her fuel business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying coal in bulk that she will retail to her customers.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow and be successful.


* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy coal in bulk

loans.name: Marieta

texts.en:
Marieta C., married to Ireneo Coliseo and blessed with a child, makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store for quite some time now.

Marieta has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her variety store.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 14,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries needed to replenish and maintain the quantity of stock in her current product inventory.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow so that she can renovate her house with her profits.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her store

loans.name: Annaliza

texts.en:
Annaliza M., 31, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Reymar M., a cobbler/electrician, they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own variety store while also selling bulk rice and electronic cellular phone loads.

Annaliza has been a regular member of the Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her retail business.     

To ensure the success of her business, she would like to apply for a PHP 14,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding business by buying groceries, sacks of rice and phone load cards to replenish her current product inventories.

She dreams that her business will continue to grow. She hopes that her family will be together as all happy and contented families are. She also strives to save their finances for the future of the children.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her general store

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en:
Ruby V., 34, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Ricardo V., a driver, they are blessed with a child in their marriage. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.  She has been managing her own rug-making business while selling personal products through her direct selling line.

Ruby has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow eight times in CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to expand and improve her businesses.
